headline: Hot Stocks Preview [Special Quote] Flash Report <Top Buy Nintendo, Top Sell Sanrio>
description: FANUC CORP (6954) was listed among the top 30 issues by special bid quote order value, with its indication price at 5,152 yen, marking a 3.4% increase from the previous day. The company had 295,900 shares in buy orders compared to 285,400 shares in sell orders.
key_takeaways: Nintendo is highlighted as the top buy, with its stock price increasing by 4.4% to 14,350 yen.;Sanrio is identified as the top sell, experiencing a 4.0% decrease in its stock price to 7,163 yen.;The Nikkei Average rose by 937.15 yen, closing at 51,149.42 yen.;The report covers 4,248 issues listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE), noting 52 special bid quotes and 18 special ask quotes.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is a 'Flash Report' providing a 'Trending Stocks Preview' with specific market data and quotes 'As of November 6, 9:03:19 AM', indicating it reports newly available, real-time information.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company market data summary, merely listing FANUC's stock performance and bid/ask volumes for a single day. It does not provide any specific company-focused news, events, or underlying reasons for the movement, thus lacking actionable intelligence for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation, with FANUC being just one line item., Lack of specific, company-focused events or developments for FANUC., Presents generic market data (price, volume) without context or explanation., Content is diluted with numerous other companies and general market trends.

headline: <Individual Stock Movements> Daisue Construction, Fujii Sangyo, NOF, Suzuki, Gurunavi = 6th Afternoon Session
description: Suzuki's stock price was 2,292, up 66.50, and its consolidated financial results for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2024 (April-September 2023) showed a double-digit decline in operating profit.
key_takeaways: Daioh Kensetsu reported a significant increase in profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2024.;Fujii Sangyo revised its consolidated earnings forecast upward for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2024.;NOF Corporation raised its full-year net sales and net profit forecasts and initiated a share repurchase program of up to 2 million shares or 5 billion yen.;Suzuki experienced a double-digit decline in operating profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2024.;Gurunavi reported a significant decline in profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2024.

reporter: ウエルスアドバイザー社

While the financial result itself is a specific event, the article provides only a brief, high-level summary without detailed analysis or context, making it insufficient as standalone actionable intelligence for trading. It is not primarily focused on SUZUKI MOTOR CORP and the information is diluted by other companies' news.

original_headline: ＜個別株動向＞大末建、藤井産業、日油、スズキ、ぐるなび＝６日後場
main_content: 現在値 大末建 3,630 -50 ぐるなび 188 + 4 日油 2,787 -4 スズキ 2,292 + 66.50 藤井産 3,735 -25 大末建 < 1814 > ―２６年３月期第２四半期累計（２５年４－９月）の連結決算は大幅な増益で着地。 藤井産業 < 9906 > ―２６年３月期第２四半期累計（２５年４－９月）の連結業績予想を上方修正。 日油 < 4403 > ―２６年３月期の連結売上高と純利益予想を引き上げ、取得上限２００万株（自己株を除く発行済み株式数の０．８７％）・５０億円の自社株取得枠を設定。 スズキ < 7269 > ―２６年３月期第２四半期累計（２５年４－９月）の連結決算（ＩＦＲＳ）は２ケタの営業減益に。 ぐるなび < 2440 > ―２６年３月期第２四半期累計（２５年４－９月）の連結決算は大幅な減益に。 ◎未確認情報などが含まれており、株式の売買は自己責任に基づき、ご自身で判断をお願いします。 提供：ウエルスアドバイザー社

headline: Afternoon Session Comment No.6 Eisai, Suzuki, JFE, Shinwa, Daiichi Jitsugyo, Fujifilm
description: SUZUKI MOTOR CORP experienced a sharp decline in the afternoon session after announcing its first-half operating profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was down 17.5% year-on-year to 276.5 billion yen, falling below market consensus. This was attributed to changes in market conditions, rising raw material prices, and decreased four-wheel vehicle sales in India and Europe.
key_takeaways: Morgan Stanley MUFG Securities raised Eisai's target price to 4,700 yen, maintaining an 'Equal-weight' rating, driven by expectations for accelerated Leqembi sales and a weaker yen.;Suzuki's stock sharply declined after its first-half operating profit fell 17.5% to 276.5 billion yen, missing market consensus due to decreased sales in India and Europe.;Shinwa and Daiichi Jitsugyo both surged in the afternoon session after revising their full-year operating profit forecasts upward and announcing increased dividends.;JFE Holdings' first-half net profit of 26.7 billion yen exceeded consensus despite a 37.2% year-on-year decline, though the company concurrently lowered its full-year revenue forecast.;Fujifilm Holdings' stock turned negative due to profit-taking, despite reporting a 16.9% increase in first-half operating profit to 158.5 billion yen, which surpassed market expectations.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports on Suzuki's newly announced first-half operating profit and its immediate market reaction, clearly indicating a newly happened event.
source: トレーダーズ・ウェブ
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports Suzuki's first-half operating profit missed market consensus and declined significantly year-on-year, leading to a sharp stock price drop. This is concrete, recent financial performance data with immediate market impact, providing actionable intelligence for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: Reporting of first-half operating profit miss against market consensus., Significant year-on-year decline in operating profit (17.5%)., Immediate negative stock price reaction ('sharply declined')., Specific reasons for the miss (decreased sales in India and Europe, rising raw material prices).
actionable_intelligence: The news indicates a negative financial performance that immediately impacted the stock price. Traders could have reacted by selling existing positions or initiating short positions in Suzuki.
original_headline: 後場コメント No.6　エーザイ、スズキ、ＪＦＥ、信和、第一実、富士フイルム
main_content: 現在値 信和 892 + 7 エーザイ 4,523 + 141 ＪＦＥＨＤ 1,806 + 18 スズキ 2,293 + 67.50 第一実 2,794 + 10★13:59 エーザイ－ＭＳＭＵＦＧが目標株価引き上げ 「レケンビ」の売り上げ加速を待つ状況エーザイ < 4523 > が3日ぶり反発。モルガン・スタンレーＭＵＦＧ証券では、引き続き認知症治療薬「レケンビ」の売り上げ加速を待つ状況と指摘。投資判断は「Equal-weight」を継続し、目標株価を4400円→4700円に引き上げた。ＭＳＭＵＦＧでは、株式市場はガイダンス上方修正を期待していたため、決算発表後の株価が下落したと指摘。認知症治療薬「レケンビSC」は10月6日の発売以降の手応えが順調とみている。引き続き、レケンビの売り上げ加速を待つ状況とした。目標株価については、円安と抗がん剤「レンビマ」の予想増額を反映し引き上げた。★14:06 スズキ－後場急落 上期営業益18％減 インド・欧州の販売台数減少響くスズキ < 7269 > が後場急落。同社は11月6日14時に、26.3期上期（4-9月）の連結営業利益（IFRS）は2765億円（前年同期比17.5％減）だったと発表した。市場コンセンサスは2801億円。日本四輪事業が堅調に推移した一方、市況の変化や、原材料価格上昇に加え、インド・欧州で四輪販売台数が減少したことが響いた。★14:07 ＪＦＥＨＤ－後場上げ幅拡大 上期最終益37％減 コンセンサス上回るＪＦＥホールディングス < 5411 > が後場上げ幅拡大。同社は6日14時、26.3期上期（4-9月）の連結純利益（IFRS）は267億円（前年同期比37.2％減）だったと発表した。上期の会社計画は150億円。市場コンセンサスは177億円。鉄鋼事業は、国内グループ会社の収益改善や棚卸資産評価差などにより従来予想を上回った。エンジニアリング事業は、受注済みプロジェクトの着実な遂行による売上収益の増加により想定を上回ったとしている。併せて、26.3期通期の連結売上収益予想を従来の4兆7500億円から4兆6000億円（前期比5.3％減）に下方修正することを発表した。利益見通しは据え置いた。★14:08 信和－後場急騰 通期営業益を上方修正 増配も発表信和 < 3447 > が後場急騰。同社は6日13時、26.3期通期の連結営業利益予想を従来の16.5億円から20.0億円（前期比23.3％増）に上方修正すると発表した。製造原価低減を目的とした内外製区分や仕入れ先の見直し、物流体制の最適化、生産効率の向上などの施策の効果が、3Q以降も継続すると見込み。これにより、安定的な供給体制の維持とコスト競争力の一層の強化が進み、収益性の改善につながることを踏まえた。26.3期上期（4-9月）の連結営業利益は13.7億円（前年同期比56.9％増）だった。併せて、26.3期の期末配当予想を16円から18円（前期末は16円）に上方修正すると発表した。年間配当予想は32円→34円（前期は32円）となる。なお、同時に発表された株主優待制度の変更も好感されている。★14:08 信和－後場急騰 株主優待制度を変更 保有区分や継続保有期間を見直し信和 < 3447 > が後場急騰。同社は6日13時、制度運営の持続可能性や公平性の確保にも配慮し、株主にとってより魅力的かつ納得感のある制度となるよう、株主優待制度を変更すると発表した。保有区分に新たに「2000株～2499株」「2500株～2999株」「3000株以上」を新設し、長期保有特典についても「1年以上3年未満継続保有」「3年以上5年未満継続保有」「5年以上継続保有」の区分に見直し、保有株数および継続保有期間に応じて株主優待ポイントを贈呈する。2026年9月末日時点の同社株主名簿より対象となるとしている。★14:14 第一実業－後場急騰 通期営業益を上方修正 一転増益へ 増配も発表第一実業 < 8059 > が後場急騰。同社は6日14時、26.3期通期の連結営業利益予想を従来の120.0億円（前期比8.4％減）から130.0億円（同0.7％増）に、期末配当予想を57円から71円（前期末は51円）に上方修正すると発表した。自動車事業、ヘルスケア事業、航空・インフラ事業で大型案件の納入が進んでいるほか、エレクトロニクス事業も比較的順調に進行している。依然として不透明な状況ではあるものの、主要な販売先である製造業の設備投資が期初の想定以上に堅調なことから、通期の見通しを引き上げた。年間配当予想は122円（前期は92円）となる。26.3期上期（4-9月）の連結営業利益は65.9億円（前年同期比7.6％増）だった。★14:17 富士フイルムＨＤ－後場マイナス転換 上期営業益17％増も利益確定の売り富士フイルムホールディングス < 4901 > が後場マイナス転換。同社は6日14時、26.3期上期（4-9月）の連結営業利益（米国基準）は1585億円（前年同期比16.9％増）だったと発表した。バイオCDMO、半導体材料、ビジネスソリューション、イメージングなどを中心に売り上げを伸ばした。市場コンセンサスは1545億円。併せて、連結売上高予想を従来予想の3兆2800億円から3兆3000億円（前期比3.3％増）に引き上げた。イメージングの好調な業績遂行を踏まえた。通期での想定為替レートは1ドル145円、1ユーロ162円とした。なお株価は、発表直後は上げ幅を拡大する場面があったものの、利益確定の売りに押され、マイナスに転じている。
main_content_en: Current Price: Shinwa 892 + 7, Eisai 4,523 + 141, JFE HD 1,806 + 18, Suzuki 2,293 + 67.50, Daiichi Jitsugyo 2,794 + 10. ★13:59 Eisai - MSMUFG Raises Target Price, Awaiting Accelerated Sales of 'Leqembi'. Eisai <4523> rebounded for the first time in three days. Morgan Stanley MUFG Securities noted that the situation continues to be one of awaiting accelerated sales of the Alzheimer's disease treatment 'Leqembi'. The investment rating was maintained at 'Equal-weight', and the target price was raised from 4,400 yen to 4,700 yen. MSMUFG pointed out that the stock price declined after the earnings announcement because the stock market had been expecting an upward revision to guidance. The Alzheimer's disease treatment 'Leqembi SC' is seen as having a smooth reception since its launch on October 6. The situation remains one of awaiting accelerated sales of Leqembi. The target price was raised to reflect the weaker yen and an increased forecast for the anti-cancer drug 'Lenvima'. ★14:06 Suzuki - Sharp Decline in Afternoon Session, First-Half Operating Profit Down 18%, Impacted by Decreased Sales in India and Europe. Suzuki <7269> sharply declined in the afternoon session. The company announced at 2:00 PM on November 6 that its consolidated operating profit (IFRS) for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was 276.5 billion yen (down 17.5% year-on-year). Market consensus was 280.1 billion yen. While the Japanese four-wheel vehicle business performed steadily, changes in market conditions, rising raw material prices, and decreased four-wheel vehicle sales in India and Europe had an impact. ★14:07 JFE HD - Gains Expanded in Afternoon Session, First-Half Net Profit Down 37%, Exceeding Consensus. JFE Holdings <5411> expanded its gains in the afternoon session. The company announced at 2:00 PM on the 6th that its consolidated net profit (IFRS) for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was 26.7 billion yen (down 37.2% year-on-year). The company's plan for the first half was 15.0 billion yen. Market consensus was 17.7 billion yen. The steel business exceeded previous forecasts due to improved profitability of domestic group companies and inventory valuation differences. The engineering business is said to have exceeded expectations due to increased sales revenue from the steady execution of ordered projects. Concurrently, the company announced a downward revision to its consolidated revenue forecast for the full fiscal year ending March 2026, from the previous 4.75 trillion yen to 4.60 trillion yen (down 5.3% year-on-year). The profit outlook was kept unchanged. ★14:08 Shinwa - Surged in Afternoon Session, Full-Year Operating Profit Revised Upward, Dividend Increase Also Announced. Shinwa <3447> surged in the afternoon session. The company announced at 1:00 PM on the 6th that it has revised upward its consolidated operating profit forecast for the full fiscal year ending March 2026 from the previous 1.65 billion yen to 2.00 billion yen (up 23.3% year-on-year). The effects of measures such as reviewing in-house/outsourcing classifications and suppliers aimed at reducing manufacturing costs, optimizing logistics systems, and improving production efficiency are expected to continue from the third quarter onwards. This is based on the expectation that it will lead to the maintenance of a stable supply system, further strengthening of cost competitiveness, and improved profitability. Consolidated operating profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was 1.37 billion yen (up 56.9% year-on-year). Concurrently, the company announced an upward revision to its year-end dividend forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026 from 16 yen to 18 yen (16 yen at the end of the previous fiscal year). The annual dividend forecast will be 32 yen → 34 yen (32 yen in the previous fiscal year). Furthermore, the simultaneously announced change to the shareholder benefit program is also being well-received. ★14:08 Shinwa - Surged in Afternoon Session, Shareholder Benefit Program Changed, Holding Categories and Continuous Holding Period Revised. Shinwa <3447> surged in the afternoon session. The company announced at 1:00 PM on the 6th that it will change its shareholder benefit program to make it more attractive and satisfactory for shareholders, while also considering the sustainability of the program's operation and ensuring fairness. New holding categories of '2,000 shares to 2,499 shares', '2,500 shares to 2,999 shares', and '3,000 shares or more' have been established, and long-term holding benefits have also been revised into categories of 'continuous holding for 1 year or more but less than 3 years', 'continuous holding for 3 years or more but less than 5 years', and 'continuous holding for 5 years or more', with shareholder benefit points awarded according to the number of shares held and the continuous holding period. This will apply to shareholders listed in the company's shareholder registry as of September 30, 2026. ★14:14 Daiichi Jitsugyo - Surged in Afternoon Session, Full-Year Operating Profit Revised Upward, Turning to Profit Growth, Dividend Increase Also Announced. Daiichi Jitsugyo <8059> surged in the afternoon session. The company announced at 2:00 PM on the 6th that it has revised upward its consolidated operating profit forecast for the full fiscal year ending March 2026 from the previous 12.00 billion yen (down 8.4% year-on-year) to 13.00 billion yen (up 0.7% year-on-year), and its year-end dividend forecast from 57 yen to 71 yen (51 yen at the end of the previous fiscal year). Deliveries of large-scale projects are progressing in the automotive, healthcare, and aerospace/infrastructure businesses, and the electronics business is also proceeding relatively smoothly. Although the situation remains uncertain, the company raised its full-year outlook due to stronger-than-initially-expected capital investment by manufacturing industries, which are its main customers. The annual dividend forecast will be 122 yen (92 yen in the previous fiscal year). Consolidated operating profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was 6.59 billion yen (up 7.6% year-on-year). ★14:17 Fujifilm HD - Turned Negative in Afternoon Session, First-Half Operating Profit Up 17% but Hit by Profit-Taking Sales. Fujifilm Holdings <4901> turned negative in the afternoon session. The company announced at 2:00 PM on the 6th that its consolidated operating profit (U.S. GAAP) for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was 158.5 billion yen (up 16.9% year-on-year). Sales increased mainly in Bio CDMO, semiconductor materials, business solutions, and imaging. Market consensus was 154.5 billion yen. Concurrently, the consolidated revenue forecast was raised from the previous 3.28 trillion yen to 3.30 trillion yen (up 3.3% year-on-year). This was based on the strong performance of the imaging business. The assumed exchange rates for the full fiscal year were set at 145 yen to the dollar and 162 yen to the euro. Although the stock price initially expanded its gains immediately after the announcement, it was pushed down by profit-taking sales and turned negative.

headline: [Game Entertainment Stocks Overview (11/6)] Mixed Results from Companies Announcing Earnings. Mynet, with upward revision, surges. Bandai Namco HD and CRI Middleware are weak
description: Bandai Namco Holdings' stock was down on November 6, experiencing sluggishness after announcing its financial results, amidst a broader selling bias for many game and entertainment-related companies despite a Tokyo stock market rebound.
key_takeaways: The Nikkei 225 Stock Average closed up 671.41 yen, reaching 50,883.68 yen, indicating a market rebound.;Game and entertainment stocks showed a selling bias, with 55% falling, despite the broader market rebound.;Mynet experienced a significant surge due to an upward revision of its earnings forecast.;Bandai Namco HD and CRI Middleware saw their stock prices weaken following their financial results announcements.;Nintendo and Sony G were among the major game companies that rose, while many others, including Sega Sammy HD and Konami G, declined.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is a summary of the Tokyo stock market's performance on a specific past date (November 6), detailing market movements, key indices, and individual stock performances, which clearly fits the definition of RECAP_NEWS.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company market overview for the game and entertainment sector, not primarily focused on BANDAI NAMCO HOLDINGS. While it mentions that Bandai Namco HD's stock was down after announcing financial results, it provides no specific details about those results (e.g., revenue, profit, guidance, or the reasons for the decline). Without these specifics, the information is not actionable for a trader.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation: Covers numerous companies, diluting focus on Bandai Namco., Lack of specific details: Mentions financial results but provides no figures or context for Bandai Namco's performance., Generic market summary: Reports stock movements without deep analysis of individual company drivers., Limited actionable intelligence: The information provided about Bandai Namco is insufficient for making an informed trading decision.
original_headline: 【ゲームエンタメ株概況(11/6)】決算発表企業で明暗　上方修正のマイネットが急騰　バンナムHDとCRIミドルウェアが軟調
main_content:
11月6日の東京株式市場は反発。日経平均株価は、前営業日比671円41銭高の5万0883円68銭でこの日の取引を終えた。前日急落した反動に加え、米ハイテク株の上昇を手がかりにAI関連を中心に買い戻しが入り、一時、5万1000円台を回復する場面があった。買い一巡後は上値の重さが目立つようになり、もみ合いに終止した。
【主要指数】
・日経225: 50,883.68(+671.41)
・TOPIX: 3,313.45(+45.16)
・ドル/円: 153.72(-0.39)
・ダウ: 47,311.00(+225.76)
・ナスダック: 23,499.80(+151.16)
・SOX: 7,190.27(+210.69)
こうしたなか、ゲーム・エンタメ関連企業をみると、登録されている97銘柄のうち、上昇は39銘柄(40%)、下落は53銘柄(55%)、変わらずは5銘柄(5%)で、売り優勢だった。
大手ゲーム関連を見ると、好決算を手がかりに任天堂<7974>が引き続き買われ、ソニーG<6758>も高い。バンダイナムコHD<7832>、セガサミーHD<6460>、コナミG<9766>、スクエニHD<9684>、カプコン<9697>、コーエーテクモHD<3635>が安い。
その他ゲーム会社やディベロッパーは、マーベラス<7844>、日本一ソフト<3851>、イマジニア<4644>、トーセ<4728>が高く、ネクソン<3659>、ユークス<4334>、エヌジェイHD<9421>が安い。
モバイルゲーム系の銘柄は、DeNA<2432>、コロプラ<3668>、ケイブ<3760>が高く、モバイルファクトリー<3912>が変わらず、サイバーエージェント<4751>、MIXI<2121>、グリーHD<3632>、ガンホー<3765>、アカツキ<3932>が安い。
アニメやホビーなどその他コンテンツ関連銘柄は、エディア<3935>、フリュー<6238>、ブシロード<7803>が高く、タカラトミー<7867>、サンリオ<8136>、東宝<9602>、KADOKAWA<9468>、IGポート<3791>、GENDA<9166>、東映アニメ<4816>が安い。
最後に騰落ランキングを見ると、業績予想の上方修正を行ったマイネット<3928>が急騰したほか、ケイブ<3760>、SANKYO<6417>、任天堂<7974>が値上がり率上位となった。一方、決算発表を行ったCRI・ミドルウェア<3698>、バンダイナムコHD<7832>がさえない。GENDA<9166>も年初来安値を更新した。
main_content_en: The Tokyo stock market rebounded on November 6. The Nikkei 225 Stock Average closed the day's trading at 50,883.68 yen, up 671.41 yen from the previous business day. In addition to a rebound from the previous day's sharp decline, buybacks, mainly in AI-related stocks, were triggered by the rise in US tech stocks, and at one point, the market recovered to the 51,000 yen level. After an initial round of buying, resistance at higher price levels became noticeable, and the market ended in a narrow range. [Key Indices] Nikkei 225: 50,883.68 (+671.41) TOPIX: 3,313.45 (+45.16) USD/JPY: 153.72 (-0.39) Dow: 47,311.00 (+225.76) Nasdaq: 23,499.80 (+151.16) SOX: 7,190.27 (+210.69) In this environment, looking at game and entertainment-related companies, out of the 97 registered stocks, 39 stocks (40%) rose, 53 stocks (55%) fell, and 5 stocks (5%) remained unchanged, indicating a selling bias. Looking at major game-related companies, Nintendo <7974> continued to be bought on the back of strong financial results, and Sony G <6758> also rose. Bandai Namco HD <7832>, Sega Sammy HD <6460>, Konami G <9766>, Square Enix HD <9684>, Capcom <9697>, and Koei Tecmo HD <3635> were down. Among other game companies and developers, Marvelous <7844>, Nippon Ichi Software <3851>, Imagineer <4644>, and Tose <4728> were up, while Nexon <3659>, Yuke's <4334>, and NJ HD <9421> were down. For mobile game-related stocks, DeNA <2432>, Colopl <3668>, and Cave <3760> were up, Mobile Factory <3912> was unchanged, while CyberAgent <4751>, MIXI <2121>, GREE HD <3632>, GungHo <3765>, and Akatsuki <3932> were down. Among other content-related stocks such as anime and hobbies, Edia <3935>, FURYU <6238>, and Bushiroad <7803> were up, while Takara Tomy <7867>, Sanrio <8136>, Toho <9602>, KADOKAWA <9468>, IG Port <3791>, GENDA <9166>, and Toei Animation <4816> were down. Finally, looking at the gainers and losers ranking, Mynet <3928>, which revised its earnings forecast upward, surged, and Cave <3760>, SANKYO <6417>, and Nintendo <7974> were among the top gainers. On the other hand, CRI Middleware <3698> and Bandai Namco HD <7832>, which announced their financial results, were sluggish. GENDA <9166> also hit a new year-to-date low.

headline: Hitachi Construction Machinery - Plunges, Hitachi to sell its shares, scheduled for November 7
description: Hitachi, Ltd. announced it will sell 15 million shares of Hitachi Construction Machinery on November 7, a move expected to result in Hitachi Construction Machinery ceasing to be an equity method affiliate.
key_takeaways: Hitachi, Ltd. is selling 15,000,000 shares (7.1%) of Hitachi Construction Machinery.;The sale is scheduled for November 7 and will be executed to institutional investors.;Goldman Sachs Securities and Daiwa Securities are acting as joint lead underwriters for the sale.;Hitachi Construction Machinery is expected to cease being an equity method affiliate of Hitachi, Ltd. after the sale.;The announcement caused Hitachi Construction Machinery's stock to plunge due to concerns over supply and demand impact.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports a newly announced event (Hitachi selling shares) and its immediate impact (stock plunge), with clear time cues indicating recent distribution and announcement dates.
source: トレーダーズ・ウェブ
news_worthy_reasoning: The article details a significant corporate restructuring event where Hitachi Ltd. is divesting a substantial portion of its shares in Hitachi Construction Machinery, leading to the latter no longer being an equity method affiliate. This is a concrete, recent strategic decision by Hitachi Ltd. that impacts its financial structure and future business focus.
news_worthy_key_factors: Strategic divestiture by Hitachi Ltd., Change in equity method affiliation for a subsidiary, Specific, near-term event (sale scheduled for Nov 7), Direct impact on Hitachi Ltd.'s asset portfolio and strategic direction
actionable_intelligence: Traders can evaluate the implications of Hitachi Ltd.'s divestment for its balance sheet, capital allocation, and future strategic direction. This could lead to a re-evaluation of Hitachi Ltd.'s stock based on its streamlined portfolio or potential use of sale proceeds.
original_headline: 日立建機－急落　日立が同社株を売却へ　11月7日予定
main_content:
日立建機－急落 日立が同社株を売却へ 11月7日予定
11/5 9:35 配信
現在値
日立建機
4,574
+
17
日立
5,168
+
48
日立建機
<
6305
>
が急落。日立製作所
<

は4日、同社株式を一部売却すると発表した。
売却株数は保有する5406万2310株（議決権所有割合：25.4％）のうち1500万株（7.1％）。売却予定日は11月7日。ゴールドマン・サックス証券および大和証券を共同幹事証券として国内外の機関投資家に売却する。
同売却により同社は日立製作所の持分法適用会社ではなくなる予定。株価は日立の売却による需給への影響を懸念した売りが優勢となっている。
main_content_en:
Hitachi Construction Machinery - Plunges as Hitachi to Sell Its Shares, Scheduled for November 7
Distributed on 11/5 at 9:35
Current Price
Hitachi Construction Machinery
4,574
+
17
Hitachi
5,168
+
48
Hitachi Construction Machinery <6305> plunged sharply. Hitachi, Ltd. <6501> announced on the 4th that it would sell a portion of its shares in the company.
The number of shares to be sold is 15,000,000 shares (7.1%) out of its 54,062,310 shares (voting rights ownership ratio: 25.4%). The scheduled sale date is November 7. The shares will be sold to institutional investors both domestically and internationally, with Goldman Sachs Securities and Daiwa Securities acting as joint lead underwriters.
Through this sale, the company is expected to cease being an equity method affiliate of Hitachi, Ltd. Selling pressure is prevailing in the stock price, driven by concerns over the impact on supply and demand due to Hitachi's sale.

headline: [Analyst Rating] Sumitomo Electric Industries, 'bullish' rating continued, target price raised to 7,200 yen (Major Japanese Securities Firm)
description: A major Japanese securities firm maintained its "Strong Buy" rating for Sumitomo Electric Industries, raising its target price from 4,650 yen to 7,200 yen. This action follows the company's previous day consensus rating of 4.3 ("Slightly Bullish") and a consensus target price of 5,084 yen.
key_takeaways: A major Japanese securities firm maintained a "Strong Buy" rating for Sumitomo Electric Industries.;The target price for Sumitomo Electric Industries was raised from 4,650 yen to 7,200 yen.;The consensus rating for Sumitomo Electric Industries is 4.3 ("Slightly Bullish") based on 10 analysts.;The consensus target price for Sumitomo Electric Industries is 5,084 yen based on 10 analysts.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is primarily about an analyst's rating and target price adjustment, along with consensus ratings, which falls under the hard rule for analyst ratings/price targets/recommendations, classifying it as RECAP_NEWS.
news_worthy_reasoning: A major Japanese securities firm significantly raised its target price for Sumitomo Electric Industries from 4,650 yen to 7,200 yen while maintaining a 'Strong Buy' rating. This is a concrete, recent, and company-specific event that provides actionable intelligence for traders, as such a substantial upgrade from a major firm can influence market sentiment and stock price.
news_worthy_key_factors: Significant target price increase (from 4,650 yen to 7,200 yen), 'Strong Buy' rating maintained by a major securities firm, Directly impacts investor sentiment and potential stock price movement, Company-specific and timely information
actionable_intelligence: Traders might consider initiating or increasing long positions in SUMITOMO ELEC INDS, anticipating a positive market reaction to the significantly raised target price and maintained 'Strong Buy' rating from a major securities firm.
original_headline: 【アナリスト評価】住友電気工業、レーティング強気を継続、目標株価7,200円に引上げ（日系大手証券）
main_content: 日系大手証券が11月5日、住友電気工業<5802>のレーティングを強気（Buy）に据え置いた。一方、目標株価は4,650円から7,200円に引き上げた。因みに前日（11月4日）時点のレーティングコンセンサスは4.3（アナリスト数10人）で「やや強気」の水準、目標株価コンセンサスは5,084円（アナリスト数10人）となっている。
main_content_en: On November 5, a major Japanese securities firm maintained its "Strong Buy" (Buy) rating for Sumitomo Electric Industries <5802>. Meanwhile, the target price was raised from 4,650 yen to 7,200 yen. Incidentally, as of the previous day (November 4), the consensus rating was 4.3 (based on 10 analysts), indicating a "Slightly Bullish" level, and the consensus target price was 5,084 yen (based on 10 analysts).

headline: Hitachi Construction Machinery plunges, Hitachi sells off some of its shares ◇
description: Hitachi, Ltd. announced it will sell 15 million shares of Hitachi Construction Machinery to institutional investors, effective on the 7th. This transaction will reduce Hitachi's voting rights ownership from 25.4% to 18.4%, causing Hitachi Construction Machinery to cease being an equity-method affiliate, though the companies will maintain their cooperative relationship.
key_takeaways: Hitachi, Ltd. is selling 15 million shares of Hitachi Construction Machinery to institutional investors.;The share transfer, effective on the 7th, will reduce Hitachi's ownership in Hitachi Construction Machinery from 25.4% to 18.4%.;Hitachi Construction Machinery will no longer be an equity-method affiliate of Hitachi, Ltd. as a result of the sale.;Hitachi Construction Machinery's stock plunged due to concerns about increased selling pressure and a deteriorating supply-demand balance for its shares.;The two companies affirmed their commitment to continue cooperative relationships in areas like digital technology, autonomous driving, electrification, and parts supply.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports a specific, recent announcement by Hitachi, Ltd. regarding a share transfer and its immediate market impact, fitting the definition of a newly happened event or newly announced information.
news_worthy_reasoning: Hitachi, Ltd. is undertaking a significant corporate restructuring by selling a substantial portion of its shares in Hitachi Construction Machinery. This action reduces its ownership, changes the accounting treatment of Hitachi Construction Machinery (no longer an equity-method affiliate), and signals a strategic shift for Hitachi, Ltd. Such a divestiture has direct implications for Hitachi, Ltd.'s balance sheet, future earnings, and strategic direction, providing actionable intelligence for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: Hitachi, Ltd. divesting 15 million shares of Hitachi Construction Machinery., Reduction of Hitachi, Ltd.'s voting rights from 25.4% to 18.4%., Hitachi Construction Machinery ceasing to be an equity-method affiliate for Hitachi, Ltd., Strategic corporate restructuring by Hitachi, Ltd. impacting its portfolio and financial reporting.
actionable_intelligence: Traders can assess the financial impact of the divestiture on Hitachi, Ltd.'s earnings and balance sheet, evaluate the strategic implications of focusing on other core businesses, and adjust their valuation models or trading positions based on this significant corporate action.
original_headline: 日立建機は急落、日立が保有株を一部売却◇
main_content: 日立建機<6305>は急落。大株主の日立製作所<6501>が４日、保有株を一部譲渡すると発表した。７日付で１５００万株を国内外の機関投資家に売却するという。これに伴い、日立の議決権所有割合は２５．４％から１８．４％へ低下し、日立建機は持ち分法適用会社から外れる。これを受け、株式需給の悪化を意識した売りが出ているようだ。なお、両社は今後もデジタル技術や自律運転技術の活用、電動化や部品供給などで協力関係を継続していくという。（注）タイトル末尾の「◇」は本文中に複数の銘柄を含む記事を表しています。出所：MINKABU PRESS みんなの株式（minkabu PRESS）
main_content_en: Hitachi Construction Machinery <6305> plunged. Its major shareholder, Hitachi, Ltd. <6501>, announced on the 4th that it would transfer a portion of its shares. It will sell 15 million shares to institutional investors both domestically and internationally, effective on the 7th. As a result, Hitachi's voting rights ownership ratio will decrease from 25.4% to 18.4%, and Hitachi Construction Machinery will cease to be an equity-method affiliate. In response to this, selling pressure appears to be emerging, driven by concerns over a deterioration in the supply-demand balance for the shares. Furthermore, the two companies stated that they will continue their cooperative relationship in areas such as the utilization of digital technology and autonomous driving technology, electrification, and parts supply. (Note) The "◇" at the end of the title indicates an article that includes multiple stock issues in the main text. Source: MINKABU PRESS Minna no Kabushiki (minkabu PRESS)

headline: Morning Session Comment No.5: Money Forward, OSG, Hitachi Kenki, Nidec, Almedio, Toshin HD

key_takeaways: Money Forward, Almedio, and Toshin Holdings saw sharp stock declines after revising profit forecasts downward or reporting losses, with Toshin also disclosing inappropriate accounting treatment.;Hitachi Construction Machinery plunged as Hitachi Ltd. announced the sale of 15 million shares (7.1% voting rights), raising concerns about supply and demand impact.;Nidec's stock rose sharply after it secured a 600 billion yen commitment line agreement with MUFG Bank and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation.;OSG continued its decline despite Daiwa Securities raising its target price to 2,200 yen, as the analyst noted that profitability improvement is still in progress and valuation concerns persist.;The announcements highlight various corporate challenges, including business portfolio changes, declining sales, and accounting issues, leading to significant volatility in individual stock prices.

It lacks dedicated, actionable intelligence for HITACHI LTD's stock.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, Information about HITACHI LTD is brief and concerns an action related to a subsidiary (Hitachi Construction Machinery), not its core business or direct stock performance, Not primarily dedicated to HITACHI LTD, Content is diluted with other companies/topics
original_headline: 前場コメント No.5　マネフォワード、ＯＳＧ、日立建、ニデック、アルメディオ、トーシンＨＤ
main_content:
★9:30　 マネーフォワード－大幅続落　通期営業損益を下方修正　連結子会社株の売却踏まえる
マネーフォワード<3994>が大幅続落。同社は4日、25.11期通期の連結営業損益予想を従来の47.0億円の赤字～23.0億円の赤字から48.0億円の赤字～24.0億円の赤字（前期は47.4億円の赤字）に下方修正すると発表した。市場コンセンサスは28.6億円の赤字。連結子会社であるスマートキャンプの全保有株式を譲渡したことにより、SaaS Marketingセグメント全体が連結の範囲から除外される大幅な事業ポートフォリオの変化が生じた。これにより、業績予想を見直した。
★9:32　 ＯＳＧ－大和が目標株価引き上げ　還元強化の意向はポジティブも収益力改善は途上
ＯＳＧ<6136>が続落。大和証券では、還元強化の意向はポジティブも収益力改善は途上と判断。投資判断「3（中立）」を継続、目標株価を1800円→2200円と引き上げた。大和では、直近の株価は「今期見込みを含めて3期にわたり配当性向は40％超過のため、来期以降の方針変更を検討中」とされたことでPBR:1倍を意識した上昇が続いてきたが、27.11期予想ROEを考慮すれば同PER:10倍程度（同予想EPS219円）を上回る評価は想定し難いと判断。現中期計画のキーワードは「Beyond」。過去のM&A効果もあり製品/地域のバランスは取れつつあり、今後は過去にない収益力（営業利益率16％超、ROE10％超）への改善を目指す計画。初年度はスロースタートだが、需要の増減を吸収できるシナリオ構築が待たれると指摘している。
★9:35　 日立建機－急落　日立が同社株を売却へ　11月7日予定
日立建機<6305>が急落。日立製作所<6501>は4日、同社株式を一部売却すると発表した。売却株数は保有する5406万2310株（議決権所有割合：25.4％）のうち1500万株（7.1％）。売却予定日は11月7日。ゴールドマン・サックス証券および大和証券を共同幹事証券として国内外の機関投資家に売却する。同売却により同社は日立製作所の持分法適用会社ではなくなる予定。株価は日立の売却による需給への影響を懸念した売りが優勢となっている。
★9:36　 ニデック－大幅続伸　総額6000億円のコミットメントライン契約を締結
ニデック<6594>が大幅続伸。同社は4日、主要取引銀行である三菱ＵＦＪ銀行および三井住友銀行との間で総額6000億円のコミットメントライン（融資枠）契約を締結したと発表した。借入極度額はそれぞれ3000億円。契約期間は2025年11月7日～26年11月6日となる。
★9:37　 アルメディオ－急落　通期営業損益を下方修正　一転赤字へ
アルメディオ<7859>が急落。同社は4日時、26.3期通期の連結営業損益予想を従来の2.8億円の黒字から6.6億円の赤字（前期は8.7億円の黒字）に下方修正すると発表した。断熱材事業において、中国子会社で下期からの受注を予定していた太陽光発電パネル製造向け拡散炉用ヒーターモジュール等の販売量が計画を下回っていることなどを踏まえた。26.3期2Q（4-9月）の連結営業損益は3.4億円の赤字（前年同期は6.3億円の黒字）だった。
★9:43　 トーシンＨＤ－新安値　前期最終赤字転落　今期予想は非開示
トーシンホールディングス<9444>が新安値。同社は4日、25.4期通期の連結純損益は0.8億円の赤字（前の期は1.4億円の黒字）だったと発表した。第三者委員会の調査により、同社における不適切な会計処理の事実が明らかになった。過年度決算訂正費用として特別損失を計上したことなどにより、最終赤字となった。26.4期の業績予想は非開示。現時点において合理的な業績予想の算定が困難であるためとしている。なお、不適切な会計処理の調査などに時間を要したため、同社は決算発表を延期していた。
main_content_en:
★9:30 Money Forward - Sharp Continued Decline; Full-Year Operating Profit/Loss Revised Downward, Reflecting Sale of Consolidated Subsidiary Shares
Money Forward <3994> continued its sharp decline. The company announced on the 4th that it has revised downward its consolidated operating loss forecast for the full fiscal year ending November 2025 from the previous range of 4.70 billion yen to 2.30 billion yen in losses, to a new range of 4.80 billion yen to 2.40 billion yen in losses (compared to a 4.74 billion yen loss in the previous fiscal year). The market consensus was a 2.86 billion yen loss. Due to the transfer of all shares held in its consolidated subsidiary, SmartCamp, a significant change in the business portfolio occurred, resulting in the entire SaaS Marketing segment being excluded from the scope of consolidation. Consequently, the earnings forecast was revised.
★9:32 OSG - Daiwa Raises Target Price; Intention to Strengthen Shareholder Returns Positive, but Profitability Improvement Still in Progress
OSG <6136> continued its decline. Daiwa Securities judged that while the intention to strengthen shareholder returns is positive, the improvement in profitability is still in progress. It maintained its "3 (Neutral)" investment rating and raised its target price from 1,800 yen to 2,200 yen. Daiwa judged that although the recent stock price has continued to rise, driven by awareness of a PBR of 1x due to the statement "dividend payout ratio has exceeded 40% for three consecutive periods, including the current fiscal year's estimate, and a change in policy for the next fiscal year and beyond is under consideration," it is difficult to expect a valuation exceeding a PER of around 10x (with an estimated EPS of 219 yen) when considering the estimated ROE for the fiscal year ending November 2027. The keyword for the current medium-term plan is "Beyond." With the effects of past M&A, the balance of products/regions is being achieved, and the plan is to aim for an unprecedented improvement in profitability (operating profit margin exceeding 16%, ROE exceeding 10%). It pointed out that while the first year is a slow start, the development of a scenario that can absorb fluctuations in demand is awaited.
★9:35 Hitachi Construction Machinery - Plunges; Hitachi to Sell Company Shares, Scheduled for November 7
Hitachi Construction Machinery <6305> plunged. Hitachi Ltd. <6501> announced on the 4th that it would sell a portion of its shares in the company. The number of shares to be sold is 15 million shares (7.1% of voting rights) out of the 54,062,310 shares it holds (25.4% of voting rights). The scheduled sale date is November 7. The shares will be sold to institutional investors both domestically and internationally, with Goldman Sachs Japan Co., Ltd. and Daiwa Securities Co. Ltd. acting as joint lead managers. As a result of this sale, the company is expected to cease being an equity-method affiliate of Hitachi Ltd. Selling pressure is dominant, driven by concerns over the impact on supply and demand from Hitachi's sale.
★9:36 Nidec - Sharp Continued Rise; Concludes Commitment Line Agreement Totaling 600 Billion Yen
Nidec <6594> continued its sharp rise. The company announced on the 4th that it has concluded a commitment line (credit facility) agreement totaling 600 billion yen with its main transaction banks, MUFG Bank and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation. The maximum borrowing amount is 300 billion yen for each bank. The contract period is from November 7, 2025, to November 6, 2026.
★9:37 Almedio - Plunges; Full-Year Operating Profit/Loss Revised Downward, Turning to Loss
Almedio <7859> plunged. The company announced on the 4th that it has revised downward its consolidated operating profit/loss forecast for the full fiscal year ending March 2026 from the previous 280 million yen profit to a 660 million yen loss (compared to an 870 million yen profit in the previous fiscal year). This revision is based on factors such as sales volumes of heater modules for diffusion furnaces used in solar panel manufacturing, which were expected to be ordered from the second half of the fiscal year by its Chinese subsidiary in the insulation material business, falling below plan. The consolidated operating profit/loss for the second quarter (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 was a 340 million yen loss (compared to a 630 million yen profit in the same period of the previous year).
★9:43 Toshin Holdings - Hits New Low; Net Loss in Previous Fiscal Year, Current Fiscal Year Forecast Undisclosed
Toshin Holdings <9444> hit a new low. The company announced on the 4th that its consolidated net profit/loss for the full fiscal year ending April 2025 was an 80 million yen loss (compared to a 140 million yen profit in the previous fiscal year). An investigation by a third-party committee revealed facts of inappropriate accounting treatment within the company. As a result of recording extraordinary losses as expenses for correcting past financial statements, among other factors, the company fell into a net loss. The earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending April 2026 is undisclosed. This is because it is difficult to reasonably calculate an earnings forecast at this time. Furthermore, the company had postponed its financial results announcement due to the time required for the investigation into the inappropriate accounting treatment.

headline: [Analyst Rating] HOYA, Rating 'Strong' Maintained, Target Price Raised to 26,500 yen (Major US Brokerage)
description: A major US brokerage firm maintained its "Bullish" rating on HOYA CORP and raised its target price from 24,000 yen to 26,500 yen. This positive assessment aligns with the broader analyst consensus of "Bullish" and a target price of 23,627 yen from 11 analysts as of October 31st.
key_takeaways: A major US brokerage firm reiterated a "Bullish" (Buy) rating for HOYA.;The target price for HOYA was increased from 24,000 yen to 26,500 yen.;The new target price of 26,500 yen is higher than the previous consensus target price of 23,627 yen.;The overall analyst consensus rating for HOYA is 4.64, indicating a "Bullish" sentiment among 11 analysts.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is entirely focused on analyst ratings and price target adjustments, which, according to the hard rule, classifies it as RECAP_NEWS despite mentioning specific dates.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports a specific, recent event where a major US brokerage firm maintained a 'Bullish' rating and significantly raised its target price for HOYA. This is a company-specific development that provides actionable intelligence, as such an upgrade from a reputable firm can positively influence investor sentiment and potentially lead to an upward movement in the stock price.
news_worthy_key_factors: Major US brokerage firm raised HOYA's target price, New target price (26,500 yen) is higher than the previous consensus (23,627 yen), Event is recent (November 1st) and company-focused, Maintained 'Bullish' rating reinforces positive outlook
actionable_intelligence: The raised target price and maintained 'Bullish' rating from a major brokerage firm could signal a potential positive price movement for HOYA, suggesting a 'buy' or 'hold' strategy for traders anticipating increased investor interest.
original_headline: 【アナリスト評価】ＨＯＹＡ、レーティング強気を継続、目標株価26,500円に引上げ（米系大手証券）
main_content: 米系大手証券が11月1日、ＨＯＹＡ<7741>のレーティングを強気（買い）に据え置いた。一方、目標株価は24,000円から26,500円に引き上げた。因みに前日（10月31日）時点のレーティングコンセンサスは4.64（アナリスト数11人）で「強気」の水準、目標株価コンセンサスは23,627円（アナリスト数11人）となっている。
main_content_en: A major US brokerage firm on November 1st maintained its rating on HOYA<7741> as "Bullish" (Buy). Meanwhile, the target price was raised from 24,000 yen to 26,500 yen. Incidentally, as of the previous day (October 31st), the consensus rating was 4.64 (based on 11 analysts), which is considered a "Bullish" level, and the consensus target price was 23,627 yen (based on 11 analysts).

headline: Afternoon Session Comment No.2 Yusen, Nisseika, Mitsui Ocean, Nitto Denko, Nexela Pharma, HOYA
description: HOYA's stock fell back despite Morgan Stanley MUFG Securities raising its target price from 20,000 yen to 23,000 yen, maintaining an "Equal-weight" rating. Morgan Stanley commented that HDD glass substrates are expected to be the company's biggest growth driver in 2026-27, leading to a 4% increase in their EPS forecast for FY25-27.
key_takeaways: Mitsui O.S.K. Lines' downward revision of its full fiscal year 2026 net profit forecast negatively impacted NYK Line and Kawasaki Kisen Kaisha due to their joint venture in container shipping.;Nippon Seika surged after revising its full-year operating profit forecast upward and announcing the cancellation of 1.55 million treasury shares.;SMBC Nikko Securities raised target prices for MODEC and Nitto Denko, citing improved EPCI profitability for MODEC and strength in high-end applications and potential share buybacks for Nitto Denko.;Nexela Pharma experienced a sharp decline following an expanded cumulative Q3 net loss, attributed to increased cost of sales and R&D expenses.;Morgan Stanley MUFG Securities raised HOYA's target price, identifying HDD glass substrates as a significant growth driver for 2026-27, despite high existing market expectations.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article section concerning HOYA is primarily an analyst report from Morgan Stanley MUFG, detailing a raised target price and their forecasts, which falls under the hard rule for RECAP_NEWS.
source: トレーダーズ・ウェブ
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company consolidation, covering several Japanese companies with brief updates for each. Although it mentions a target price raise for HOYA by Morgan Stanley MUFG Securities due to strong HDD glass substrate growth prospects, this information is diluted within a broader market analysis that is not primarily focused on HOYA. The article is 'too noisy' and derivative, summarizing analyst actions rather than providing in-depth, company-specific analysis.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation: HOYA is one of many companies discussed., Derivative content: Summarizes analyst ratings and company news., Not company-focused: The article is not primarily dedicated to HOYA., Too noisy: HOYA's specific information is brief and diluted by other company news.
original_headline: 後場コメント No.2　郵船、日精化、三井海洋、日東電、ネクセラファーマ、ＨＯＹＡ
main_content: 現在値 日精化 2,809 + 27 三井海洋開 10,540 + 185 郵船 4,905 + 19 商船三井 4,425 + 40 川崎船 2,082 + 15 ★12:37　 日本郵船－後場急落　商船三井の下方修正を嫌気　川崎汽船も安い 日本郵船 < 9101 > が後場急落。商船三井 < 9104 > が4日12時に、26.3期通期の連結純利益予想を従来の2000億円から1800億円（前期比57.7％減）に下方修正すると発表したことが嫌気されている。 コンテナ船事業が従来予想を下回る見通しとなり、純利益は市場コンセンサスを下回る計画となっている。これを嫌気して商船三井は後場売り気配でスタートしている。 同社は商船三井、川崎汽船 < 9107 > との共同出資会社として、コンテナ船を運営するＯｃｅａｎ　Ｎｅｔｗｏｒｋ　Ｅｘｐｒｅｓｓ（ＯＮＥ）を傘下に持つ。商船三井が下方修正を発表したことで、同社と川崎汽船も売られる展開となっている。 ★12:47　 日本精化－急騰　通期営業益を上方修正　上期は24％増 日本精化 < 4362 > が急騰。同社は10月31日、26.3期通期の連結営業利益予想を従来の50.0億円から55.0億円（前期比12.4％増）に上方修正すると発表した。 主に機能性製品分野におけるウールグリース誘導体のビューティケア、ヘルスケア、ファインケミカルの各領域の上期の業績実績を踏まえた。 26.3期上期（4-9月）の連結営業利益は29.8億円（前年同期比24.2％増）だった。 併せて、155万株の自己株を消却すると発表した。消却予定日は11月20日。消却前の発行済株式総数に対する割合は6.1％となる。 ★12:51　 三井海洋開発 －ＳＭＢＣ日興が目標株価を引き上げ　25/12期下期以降のEPCIの収益性改善に注目 三井海洋開発 < 6269 > が小幅高。ＳＭＢＣ日興証券では、25/12期下期以降のEPCIの収益性改善に注目。投資評価は「2（中立）」を継続し、目標株価は3300円→9500円に引き上げた。 ＳＭＢＣ日興では、25/12期営業利益は会社計画4億1000万ドルを上回る4億3120万ドルと予想。25/12期下期から、今年受注したEPCI案件（Gato do Mato、Hammerhead）の新拠点を活かした効率的な売上加速を見込み、O&Mではチャーター船へのメジャーメンテナンスが落ち着くことから、上期営業利益率8.3％→下期予想11.6％と収益性の向上を織り込んだ。25/12期下期以降は今期の新規受注EPCI案件で、新拠点を活かしたオペレーションが加速することで収益性の改善も期待できるとコメント。更なる評価のためには、キャパシティ拡大を活かした受注規模拡大、還元姿勢の変化等を確認したいとしている。 ★12:51　 日東電工－ＳＭＢＣ日興が目標株価を引き上げ　ハイエンド向けでの強みを発揮 日東電工 < 6988 > が小幅続伸。ＳＭＢＣ日興証券では、ハイエンド向けでの強みを発揮と指摘。投資評価は「2（中立）」を継続し、目標株価は3000円→3700円に引き上げた。 ＳＭＢＣ日興では、決算及び取材を踏まえ、業績予想を更新。主要顧客のデバイス需要の好調に加え、核酸医薬のCDMOについて大型案件の貢献が顕在化した点に注目。3Q決算時には、自己株式取得も発表される可能性が高いとみている。FCFの見通しを踏まえ、500億円規模と想定（従来：300億円）。27/3期営業利益は、高精度基板の新用途展開、車載用偏光板、CDMO、電気剥離テープを牽引役に前期比12%増と予想。過去最高益の更新に期待できるという。但し、コンセンサスの利益水準、バリュエーション指標を踏まえ、株式市場での期待値も高いと判断している。 ★12:53　 ネクセラファーマ－大幅に5日続落　3Q累計最終赤字拡大　研究開発費の増加など響く ネクセラファーマ < 4565 > が大幅に5日続落。同社は10月31日、25.12期3Q累計（1-9月）の連結純損益は48.1億円の赤字（前年同期は35.0億円の赤字）だったと発表した。売上原価や研究開発費の増加、金融収支の悪化などが響いた。 ★13:06　 ＨＯＹＡ－ＭＳＭＵＦＧが目標株価を引き上げ　26-27年はHDDガラス基板が最大の成長ドライバーへ ＨＯＹＡ < 7741 > が反落。モルガン・スタンレーＭＵＦＧ証券では、26-27年はHDDガラス基板が最大の成長ドライバーとコメント。投資判断は「Equal-weight」を継続し、目標株価は20000円→23000円に引き上げた。 モルガン・スタンレーでは、7-9月の3.5インチ基板の増加、映像関連製品の成長を踏まえ、FY25-27のEPS予想を約4%引き上げた。3.5インチガラス基板の成長率はFY25-26は年間10%台前半の成長、FY27は新規顧客2社への出荷が貢献することで、10%台後半の成長率に加速すると予想している。7-9月に低水準だったライフケアの利益率はFY26以降は会社側が目安とする約20%に改善すると予想。一方、ファンダメンタルズ見通しは良好だが、株価は27年頃までのHDDガラス基板の成長期待を織り込み済みと考えている。
main_content_en: Current Price: Nippon Seika 2,809 + 27, MODEC 10,540 + 185, NYK Line 4,905 + 19, Mitsui O.S.K. Lines 4,425 + 40, Kawasaki Kisen Kaisha 2,082 + 15. ★12:37 NYK Line - Sharp fall in the afternoon session; disliked due to Mitsui O.S.K. Lines' downward revision; Kawasaki Kisen Kaisha also trading lower. NYK Line <9101> saw a sharp fall in the afternoon session. This is due to negative sentiment following Mitsui O.S.K. Lines <9104> announcing at 12:00 on the 4th that it has revised its consolidated net profit forecast for the full fiscal year ending March 2026 downward from the previous 200 billion yen to 180 billion yen (a 57.7% decrease year-on-year). The container shipping business is expected to fall below previous forecasts, and net profit is planned to be below market consensus. Reacting negatively to this, Mitsui O.S.K. Lines started the afternoon session with selling pressure. NYK Line, as a joint venture company with Mitsui O.S.K. Lines and Kawasaki Kisen Kaisha <9107>, has Ocean Network Express (ONE), which operates container ships, under its umbrella. As Mitsui O.S.K. Lines announced its downward revision, NYK Line and Kawasaki Kisen Kaisha are also being sold off. ★12:47 Nippon Seika - Surged; revised full-year operating profit upward; first half up 24%. Nippon Seika <4362> surged. The company announced on October 31 that it has revised its consolidated operating profit forecast for the full fiscal year ending March 2026 upward from the previous 5.0 billion yen to 5.5 billion yen (a 12.4% increase year-on-year). This revision is based on the first-half performance in the beauty care, healthcare, and fine chemical sectors of wool grease derivatives, primarily in the functional products field. Consolidated operating profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was 2.98 billion yen (a 24.2% increase year-on-year). In addition, the company announced the cancellation of 1.55 million treasury shares. The scheduled cancellation date is November 20. The ratio to the total outstanding shares before cancellation will be 6.1%. ★12:51 MODEC - SMBC Nikko raises target price; focusing on improved profitability of EPCI from the second half of FY12/25 onwards. MODEC <6269> traded slightly higher. SMBC Nikko Securities is focusing on improved profitability of EPCI from the second half of the fiscal year ending December 2025 onwards. They maintained their investment rating at "2 (Neutral)" and raised their target price from 3,300 yen to 9,500 yen. SMBC Nikko forecasts operating profit for the fiscal year ending December 2025 to be $431.2 million, exceeding the company's plan of $410 million. From the second half of the fiscal year ending December 2025, they expect efficient sales acceleration utilizing new bases for EPCI projects (Gato do Mato, Hammerhead) ordered this year. In O&M, as major maintenance on chartered vessels settles down, they have incorporated an improvement in profitability, with the first-half operating profit margin of 8.3% rising to a second-half forecast of 11.6%. They commented that from the second half of the fiscal year ending December 2025 onwards, profitability improvement can also be expected as operations utilizing new bases accelerate for newly ordered EPCI projects this fiscal year. For further evaluation, they stated that they want to confirm an increase in order size utilizing capacity expansion, changes in shareholder return policy, etc. ★12:51 Nitto Denko - SMBC Nikko raises target price; demonstrating strength in high-end applications. Nitto Denko <6988> slightly extended its gains. SMBC Nikko Securities pointed out its strength in high-end applications. They maintained their investment rating at "2 (Neutral)" and raised their target price from 3,000 yen to 3,700 yen. SMBC Nikko updated its earnings forecasts based on financial results and interviews. They noted the materialization of contributions from large projects in nucleic acid drug CDMO, in addition to strong device demand from key customers. They believe there is a high possibility of a share buyback announcement at the time of the Q3 earnings release. Based on the FCF outlook, they assume a scale of 50 billion yen (previously: 30 billion yen). They forecast operating profit for the fiscal year ending March 2027 to increase by 12% year-on-year, driven by new applications for high-precision substrates, automotive polarizing films, CDMO, and electrically peelable tapes. They expect the company to update its record-high profits. However, judging from consensus profit levels and valuation metrics, they believe expectations in the stock market are also high. ★12:53 Nexela Pharma - Sharply fell for 5 consecutive days; cumulative Q3 net loss expanded; impacted by increased R&D expenses, etc. Nexela Pharma <4565> sharply fell for 5 consecutive days. The company announced on October 31 that its consolidated net loss for the cumulative third quarter of the fiscal year ending December 2025 (January-September) was 4.81 billion yen (compared to a loss of 3.50 billion yen in the same period last year). This was impacted by increased cost of sales and R&D expenses, and deterioration in financial balance. ★13:06 HOYA - Morgan Stanley MUFG raises target price; HDD glass substrates to be the biggest growth driver in 2026-27. HOYA <7741> fell back. Morgan Stanley MUFG Securities commented that HDD glass substrates will be the biggest growth driver in 2026-27. They maintained their investment rating at "Equal-weight" and raised their target price from 20,000 yen to 23,000 yen. Morgan Stanley raised its EPS forecast for FY25-27 by approximately 4%, based on the increase in 3.5-inch substrates in July-September and the growth of video-related products. They forecast the growth rate of 3.5-inch glass substrates to be in the low teens annually for FY25-26, accelerating to the high teens in FY27 due to contributions from shipments to two new customers. They expect the profitability of healthcare, which was low in July-September, to improve to approximately 20% from FY26 onwards, which is the company's guideline. On the other hand, while the fundamental outlook is good, they believe the stock price has already factored in expectations for HDD glass substrate growth until around 2027.

headline: [Analyst Rating] HOYA, 'Neutral' rating maintained, target price raised to 23,000 yen (Major US Securities Firm)
description: A major US brokerage maintained HOYA CORP's rating at Neutral (Equal-Weight) while raising its target price from 20,000 yen to 23,000 yen. This contrasts with a broader analyst consensus of "Strong Buy" and a target price of 23,627 yen for HOYA CORP.
key_takeaways: A major US brokerage reaffirmed a 'Neutral' (Equal-Weight) rating for HOYA on November 3.;The target price for HOYA was increased by the brokerage from 20,000 yen to 23,000 yen.;The analyst consensus from 11 analysts as of October 31 was a 'Strong Buy' with an average target price of 23,627 yen.;Investors should note the divergence between the specific brokerage's 'Neutral' rating and the overall 'Strong Buy' consensus.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is classified as RECAP_NEWS because its main content is entirely about analyst ratings and target price adjustments, which triggers the hard rule to label such articles as RECAP_NEWS regardless of specific timing mentions.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports an analyst rating and a target price revision from a major brokerage but fails to provide any reasoning or analysis behind these changes. While the target price was raised, the 'Neutral' rating was maintained, and crucially, the article does not explain the brokerage's rationale for either decision. This lack of underlying analysis makes the information unsubstantiated and not actionable for a trader seeking to understand the drivers of potential stock movement.
news_worthy_key_factors: Analyst rating and target price update provided without any underlying reasoning or analysis from the brokerage., Falls under the 'Unsubstantiated Ratings' and 'Derivative Content' criteria for insignificance, as it merely reports an external assessment without context., Despite being timely and company-focused, the absence of 'why' behind the rating and target price change severely limits its utility for informed trading decisions., The information is a report about an analyst's action, not a direct company event or detailed financial/operational analysis.
original_headline: 【アナリスト評価】ＨＯＹＡ、レーティング中立を据置き、目標株価23,000円に引上げ（米系大手証券）
main_content: 米系大手証券が11月3日、ＨＯＹＡ < 7741 > のレーティングを中立（Equal-Weight）に据え置いた。一方、目標株価は20,000円から23,000円に引き上げた。因みに前日（10月31日）時点のレーティングコンセンサスは4.64（アナリスト数11人）で「強気」の水準、目標株価コンセンサスは23,627円（アナリスト数11人）となっている。
main_content_en: A major US brokerage on November 3 maintained HOYA's <7741> rating at Neutral (Equal-Weight). Meanwhile, its target price was raised from 20,000 yen to 23,000 yen. Incidentally, as of the previous day (October 31), the rating consensus was 4.64 (11 analysts), indicating a "Strong Buy" level, and the target price consensus was 23,627 yen (11 analysts).

headline: [Analyst Rating] Mitsubishi Electric, rating weak maintained, target price raised to 2,100 yen (Major European brokerage)
description: A major European securities firm maintained a "Sell" rating on Mitsubishi Electric, despite raising its target price for the company from 1,900 yen to 2,100 yen. This contrasts with a broader consensus rating of "slightly bullish" and a target price of 3,779 yen from 12 analysts.
key_takeaways: A major European securities firm maintained a "Sell" rating on Mitsubishi Electric.;The target price for Mitsubishi Electric was raised from 1,900 yen to 2,100 yen by the firm.;The broader consensus rating from 12 analysts is "slightly bullish" (4.17).;The broader consensus target price from 12 analysts is significantly higher at 3,779 yen.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is mainly about analyst ratings and price targets, which, according to the hard rule, classifies it as RECAP_NEWS despite mentioning a specific date.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports an analyst rating and target price revision from a single firm. While analyst actions can influence stock prices, this report lacks the underlying reasoning for the 'Sell' rating and the target price increase. Furthermore, it represents one firm's opinion that contrasts with a broader 'slightly bullish' consensus, making it less definitive for actionable trading decisions. It's more of a data point than a strong signal based on new fundamental information.
news_worthy_key_factors: Analyst rating without detailed reasoning for the 'Sell' recommendation or the target price adjustment., Single firm's opinion, which contrasts with a broader 'slightly bullish' consensus., Mixed signal: 'Sell' rating maintained, but the target price was raised, creating ambiguity., Not a company-initiated event (e.g., earnings, M&A, product launch) but an external opinion.
original_headline: 【アナリスト評価】三菱電機、レーティング弱気を継続、目標株価2,100円に引上げ（欧州系大手証券）
main_content: 欧州系大手証券が11月4日、三菱電機 < 6503 > のレーティングを弱気（Sell）に据え置いた。一方、目標株価は1,900円から2,100円に引き上げた。因みに前日（10月31日）時点のレーティングコンセンサスは4.17（アナリスト数12人）で「やや強気」の水準、目標株価コンセンサスは3,779円（アナリスト数12人）となっている。
main_content_en: On November 4, a major European securities firm maintained its rating on Mitsubishi Electric <6503> as Sell. Meanwhile, the target price was raised from 1,900 yen to 2,100 yen. Incidentally, as of the previous day (October 31), the consensus rating was 4.17 (12 analysts), indicating a "slightly bullish" level, and the consensus target price was 3,779 yen (12 analysts).

headline: Earnings Positive Impact Stocks [TSE Prime] ... Advantest, TEPCO HD, Hitachi (Announced October 24-30)
description: ADVANTEST CORP experienced a significant positive impact on its stock price, rising 27.15% after its H1 earnings announcement. This placed it among the top-performing stocks, with an ordinary profit change rate of 148.82%.
key_takeaways: SCSK, Sumitomo Densetsu, and Sumitomo Riko were among the top-performing TSE Prime stocks, experiencing significant price increases following their earnings announcements.;SCSK's consolidated net profit for the first half of fiscal year ending March 2026 surged by 85.1% year-on-year, exceeding its full-year plan progress.;Sumitomo Densetsu revised its ordinary profit forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026 upward by 17.4%, projecting record-high profits for two consecutive periods.;The analysis provides a comprehensive list of TSE Prime stocks that saw a positive stock price impact, ranked by their rate of increase from the day before the announcement to the close of trading on October 31st.;The article underscores the direct correlation between robust corporate earnings and positive market sentiment, leading to stock price appreciation.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly ranks stocks, including ADVANTEST CORP, based on their past price reaction to earnings announcements that have already occurred, measuring the stock change from the announcement date (10/28 for ADVANTEST) to the close of trading on the 31st. This content is a retrospective analysis of market impact, not a new event or development.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company consolidation piece that summarizes the positive stock market reactions to earnings announcements for numerous TSE Prime companies. While Advantest is mentioned and its stock price increase and profit change rate are listed, the article does not provide specific details or analysis of Advantest's earnings report itself. It merely reports on the *outcome* of its earnings announcement (a positive stock reaction) as part of a ranking, rather than offering new, actionable intelligence about the company's financial performance or future outlook that a trader could act upon.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, not focused primarily on Advantest.;Lacks specific details and qualitative analysis for Advantest's earnings, only providing a ranking and percentage changes.;Reports on past market reaction to an event that has already occurred, rather than providing forward-looking or new actionable intelligence.;Content is derivative, summarizing market movements based on earnings rather than detailing the earnings themselves.
original_headline: 決算プラス・インパクト銘柄 【東証プライム】 … アドテスト、東電ＨＤ、日立 (10月24日～30日発表分)
main_content: アドテスト ＜日足＞ 「株探」多機能チャートより 現在値 住友電設 9,680 -10 住友理工 2,590 + 15 アンリツ 2,219.5 -54 アドテスト 19,175 -275 ＳＣＳＫ 5,669 + 17 ―決算で買われた銘柄！ 上昇率ランキング― 企業決算に対する評価は、マーケットでは「株価」として表される。ここでは、決算を受け止めて株価がいかに反応したかを探る。 以下に挙げたのは、決算発表が「プラス・インパクト」となった可能性のある東証プライムの銘柄である。株価が決算発表前日の水準から31日大引け現在、水準を切り上げている銘柄を上昇率の大きい順にランキングした。 ★No.1 ＳＣＳＫ < 9719 > 26年3月期第2四半期累計(4-9月)の連結最終利益は前年同期比85.1％増の356億円に拡大し、通期計画の635億円に対する進捗率は56.1％に達し、5年平均の44.7％も上回った。 ★No.2 住友電設 < 1949 > 26年3月期の連結経常利益を従来予想の190億円→223億円(前期は189億円)に17.4％上方修正し、増益率が0.5％増→17.9％増に拡大し、従来の2期連続での過去最高益予想をさらに上乗せした。 ★No.5 住友理工 < 5191 > 26年3月期の連結最終利益を従来予想の205億円→212億円(前期は274億円)に3.4％上方修正し、減益率が25.2％減→22.7％減に縮小する見通しとなった。 ■決算プラス・インパクト銘柄 コード 銘柄名 市場 上昇率 発表日 決算期 経常変化率 < 9719 > ＳＣＳＫ 東Ｐ +33.18 10/29 上期 79.76 < 1949 > 住友電設 東Ｐ +27.43 10/30 上期 56.1% against the full-year plan of 63.5 billion yen, exceeding the five-year average of 44.7%. ★No.2 Sumitomo Densetsu < 1949 > Consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was headline: Earnings Negative Impact Stocks [TSE Prime] ... DISCO, Shin-Etsu Chemical, Panasonic HD (Announced Oct 24 - 30)
description: SHIN-ETSU CHEM's stock price declined by 5.00% following its October 24 earnings announcement, which reported a 17.07% decrease in ordinary profit for the first half. This placed the company among those negatively impacted by recent earnings reports.
key_takeaways: A significant number of TSE Prime stocks saw their prices fall after earnings announcements made between October 24th and 30th.;Stock price declines were measured from the day before the earnings announcement to the close of trading on October 31st.;INES revised its consolidated ordinary profit forecast for fiscal year ending March 2026 down by 63.4%, leading to a substantial stock price drop.;DMG MORI CO. experienced the highest stock price decline rate at -20.77% among the listed companies.;Other prominent companies like DISCO, Shin-Etsu Chemical, and Panasonic Holdings also saw negative impacts on their stock prices.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is a ranking of stocks that experienced declines following their earnings announcements, explicitly stating it covers performance 'as of the close of trading on the 31st' based on prior announcement dates (e.g., 10/24 for SHIN-ETSU CHEM). This indicates it is summarizing past market reactions to already released information, not reporting a new event.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company consolidation piece that lists numerous companies whose stocks were negatively impacted by earnings announcements. While Shin-Etsu Chemical is mentioned in the title and key points, the article provides no specific financial results, announcement dates, or stock price decline rates for Shin-Etsu Chemical itself. It is merely a generic mention within a broader market trend analysis, offering no actionable intelligence for this specific company.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, not focused on Shin-Etsu Chemical.;Lack of specific financial results or stock price movement data for Shin-Etsu Chemical.;Shin-Etsu Chemical is only briefly mentioned, not the primary subject of detailed analysis.;No actionable intelligence provided for trading Shin-Etsu Chemical.

headline: ◆Next Week's Schedule◆Toyota and others announce earnings (5th)
description: TOYOTA MOTOR CORP is scheduled to announce its earnings on Wednesday, November 5th, marking the primary corporate development for the company in the provided schedule.
key_takeaways: Major global companies, including Toyota, Nintendo, Mitsubishi Corp., and McDonald's, are scheduled to announce earnings throughout the week.;Key economic indicators such as U.S. ISM Manufacturing/Non-Manufacturing PMI, JOLTS Job Openings, ADP Employment Report, and China's PMI/Trade Balance are due for release.;Central bank policy meetings are scheduled for Australia, Brazil, and the Bank of England.;The U.S. government's 25% tariff on imported medium and heavy-duty trucks is noted for the start of the week.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is a calendar listing pre-scheduled economic data releases and corporate earnings announcements for the upcoming week, including Toyota's earnings date. This information is typically known in advance and is a compilation of existing public knowledge, not a 'newly announced' event or development hitting the market for the first time.
source: ウエルスアドバイザー
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a general market schedule consolidating numerous events, including earnings announcements for many companies, economic data, and central bank meetings. Toyota's earnings announcement is merely listed as a calendar item without any specific details or analysis relevant to its stock performance. It lacks company-specific actionable intelligence.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation: Toyota is one of many companies listed in a broad market schedule.;Lack of company-specific focus: The article is a general overview of upcoming events, not primarily dedicated to Toyota.;Derivative/summary content: It presents a schedule of known upcoming events rather than new, specific information about Toyota.;No actionable intelligence about Toyota's business: Only the date of earnings is provided, without any insight into expected results or company performance.

main_content: １日（土） 【海外】 ・米政府、米国に輸入される中・大型トラックに対し２５％の関税を課す ２日（日） 【海外】 ・米国冬時間入り ３日（月） 【国内】 ・文化の日 【海外】 ・１０：４５ 中国１０月ＲａｔｉｎｇＤｏｇ製造業ＰＭＩ ・決算発表＝（米国）バークシャー・ハサウェイ、オン・セミコンダクター、パランティア・テクノロジーズ、バーテックス・ファーマシューティカルズ ４日（火） 【国内】 ・決算発表＝任天堂 < 7974 > 、三菱商 < 8058 > 、ＮＴＴ < 9432 > 、丸紅 < 8002 > 、ＬＩＮＥヤフ < 4689 > 、大和証Ｇ < 8601 > 、商船三井 < 9104 > ・新規上場＝ＮＥ＜４４１Ａ＞ 【海外】 ・０：００ 米１０月ＩＳＭ製造業景況指数 ・２２：３０ 米９月貿易収支 ・豪州準備銀行理事会 ・決算発表＝（欧州）フェラーリ（米国）アドバンスト・マイクロ・デバイセズ、アムジェン、アリスタネットワークス、ボール、コルテバ、マリオット・インターナショナル、ファイザー、ピンタレスト、ショッピファイ、ウーバー・テクノロジーズ、ゾエティス ５日（水） 【国内】 ・８：５０ １０月マネタリーベース ・９月１８、１９日開催の日銀金融政策決定会合議事要旨 ・１０年国債入札 ・決算発表＝トヨタ < 7203 > 、伊藤忠 < 8001 > 、三井物 < 8031 > 、ソフトバンク < 9434 > ・新規上場＝クラシコ＜４４２Ａ＞ 【海外】 ・０：００ 米９月ＪＯＬＴＳ求人件数、米９月製造業受注 ・２２：１５ 米１０月ＡＤＰ雇用統計 ・ブラジル中銀政策金利発表 ・インド市場休場 ・決算発表＝（アジア）香港証券取引所（欧州）アーム・ホールディングス、ヴォノヴィア（米国）アルベマール、フォーティネット、マシモ、マクドナルド、ニュートリエン、ロイヤルティ・ファーマ ６日（木） 【国内】 ・８：３０ ９月毎月勤労統計調査 ・１１：００ １０月都心オフィス空室率 ・決算発表＝リクルートＨ < 6098 > 、ＫＤＤＩ < 9433 > 、スズキ < 7269 > 、富士フイルム < 4901 > 【海外】 ・０：００ 米１０月ＩＳＭ非製造業景況指数 ・英金融政策委員会 ・決算発表＝（豪州）ナショナルオーストラリア銀行（欧州）アストラゼネカ（米国）アンシス、アイロボット、モデルナ、クアルコム、ブロック（旧スクエア）、タペストリー、トリップアドバイザー、アンダーアーマー ７日（金） 【国内】 ・８：３０ ９月家計調査 ・決算発表＝菱重工 < 7011 > 、ホンダ < 7267 > 、クボタ < 6326 > 、オリンパス < 7733 > 【海外】 ・２２：３０ 米１０月雇用統計 ・中国１０月貿易収支 ・決算発表＝（欧州）アマデウスＩＴグループ（米国）カプリ・ホールディングス ＊海外の時刻は日本時間。 ＊予定は急に変更されることもあります。
