[Earnings Forecast/Financial Results Flash] Renesas Electronics <6723> announced on October 30 that its pre-tax profit/loss for the third quarter (cumulative) of the fiscal year ending December 2025 was -49,243 million yen.

headline: [Analyst Forecast] HOYA, FY March 2026 Ordinary Profit Forecast. Up 0.1% from previous week.
description: HOYA CORP's ordinary profit forecast consensus increased by 0.1% to 283,391 million yen from the prior week's 283,114 million yen. Its rating consensus remained unchanged at 4.6.
key_takeaways: HOYA's ordinary profit forecast for FY March 2026 increased by 0.1% from the prior week.;The updated ordinary profit forecast stands at 283,391 million yen.;The previous week's forecast was 283,114 million yen.;The analyst rating consensus for HOYA remained unchanged at 4.6.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports a minor (0.1%) update to the consensus ordinary profit forecast, which is an aggregation of analyst views rather than a new corporate announcement or a primary market-moving event. This type of information, while updated, is more akin to a summary of evolving market sentiment than a 'breaking' development.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports an extremely minor (0.1%) upward revision in the ordinary profit forecast for FY March 2026. This marginal change, combined with an unchanged analyst rating consensus, does not provide actionable intelligence that would likely impact the stock price in the near term.
news_worthy_key_factors: Forecast revision is only 0.1%, which is negligible.;The forecast is for a future fiscal year (FY March 2026), reducing immediate impact.;Analyst rating consensus remained stable, indicating no significant shift in sentiment.;No other material events (e.g., earnings, new products, M&A) are discussed.
original_headline: 【アナリスト予想】ＨＯＹＡ、26年3月期経常予想。対前週0.1%上昇。
main_content: ＨＯＹＡ<7741>の経常利益予想コンセンサスは、前週値の283,114百万円から0.1%上昇し、283,391百万円となった。因みにレーティングコンセンサスは4.6で変わらずのまま。
main_content_en: The ordinary profit forecast consensus for HOYA <7741> increased by 0.1% from the previous week's value of 283,114 million yen to 283,391 million yen. Incidentally, the rating consensus remained unchanged at 4.6.

headline: Special Bid Quote: Advantest, Hitachi, Pana HD are bid-only
description: PANASONIC HOLDINGS CORP (Pana HD <6752>) is among several companies that are raising their bid quotes, indicating increased buying interest.
key_takeaways: Advantest is raising its special bid quote, driven by 30.3 billion yen in buying orders.;Hitachi, Mitsui Mining & Smelting, Pana HD, and Toyo Engineering are also experiencing rising bid quotes.;Japan Steel Works shows strong buying interest, potentially leading to a raised bid quote and a daily limit high.;Shimano is lowering its special offer quote due to 1.13 billion yen in selling orders.;Makuake, SMS, Kigenso, Hokuetsu Corp, and iole are also facing lowered offer quotes due to significant selling pressure.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article provides a real-time snapshot of market activity as of a specific time ('10月29日9時03分32秒現在'), reporting on current stock movements and buying interest for Panasonic Holdings. This constitutes new, immediate market information hitting the market.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company market snapshot, with PANASONIC HOLDINGS CORP (Pana HD) mentioned briefly as one of several companies experiencing rising bid quotes. It lacks specific financial details or in-depth analysis pertaining solely to Panasonic, making the information too diluted and not sufficiently actionable for a dedicated trading decision on Panasonic.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, not focused primarily on Panasonic.;PANASONIC HOLDINGS CORP is mentioned only briefly as one of many companies with rising bid quotes.;No specific financial figures or detailed reasoning are provided for Panasonic's situation.;The content is a general market observation rather than a company-specific event analysis.
original_headline: ＜特別気配＞　アドテスト、日立、パナＨＤが買い気配
main_content: 10月29日9時03分32秒現在、特別買い気配は33銘柄、特別売り気配は12銘柄となっている。アドテスト < 6857 > は303億円とトップの買い注文(売りは122億円)を集めて特別買い気配を切り上げている。日製鋼 < 5631 > も買いが売りを大幅に上回る注文が入っており、買い気配を切り上げてストップ高まで買い進まれる可能性がある。そのほか、日立 < 6501 > や三井金属 < 5706 > 、パナＨＤ < 6752 > 、東洋エンジ < 6330 > も買い気配を切り上げている。一方、シマノ < 7309 > は11.3億円とトップの売り注文(買いは8.0億円)を集めて特別売り気配を切り下げている。マクアケ < 4479 > も売りが買いを大幅に上回る注文が入っており、売り気配を切り下げてストップ安まで売り込まれる可能性がある。そのほか、エスエムエス < 2175 > や稀元素 < 4082 > 、北越コーポ < 3865 > 、イオレ < 2334 > も売り気配を切り下げている。
main_content_en: As of 9:03:32 AM on October 29, there are 33 stocks with a special bid quote and 12 stocks with a special offer quote. Advantest <6857> is raising its special bid quote, having attracted the top buying orders of 30.3 billion yen (selling orders are 12.2 billion yen). Japan Steel Works <5631> also has orders where buying significantly exceeds selling, and there is a possibility that its bid quote will be raised and buying will continue until it reaches the daily limit high. In addition, Hitachi <6501>, Mitsui Mining & Smelting <5706>, Pana HD <6752>, and Toyo Engineering <6330> are also raising their bid quotes. On the other hand, Shimano <7309> is lowering its special offer quote, having attracted the top selling orders of 1.13 billion yen (buying orders are 800 million yen). Makuake <4479> also has orders where selling significantly exceeds buying, and there is a possibility that its offer quote will be lowered and selling will continue until it reaches the daily limit low. In addition, SMS <2175>, Kigenso <4082>, Hokuetsu Corp <3865>, and iole <2334> are also lowering their offer quotes.

headline: Stocks with Strong Earnings to Watch Today: Advantest, Kinden, Toenec (Announced After Market Close on the 28th)
description: ADVANTEST CORP revised its current fiscal year's net profit up 24% and raised its record high profit forecast, driven by strong demand for AI-related semiconductors. The company also announced a share buyback program of up to 150 billion yen or 2.5% of outstanding shares.
key_takeaways: Advantest revised its current fiscal year's net profit up 24%, raised its record high profit forecast, and announced a 150 billion yen share buyback program.;Kinden and Toenec significantly revised their ordinary profit forecasts upward, projecting record highs for two consecutive periods, and increased their annual dividends.;Other companies like WOWOW, Realgate, TSEC, Nippon Coinco, Nippon Sharyo, and Musashi also reported strong performance, with several reversing previous profit decrease forecasts or projecting record high profits.;Key drivers for the strong performance include increased demand for HPC and AI-related semiconductors, improved project profitability, exceeding expectations in other income, and favorable foreign exchange rates due to a weaker yen.;Many companies are not only raising profit forecasts but also increasing shareholder returns through higher dividends or share buybacks.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly states that ADVANTEST CORP announced its financial results, an upward revision of its full-year profit forecast, and a new share buyback program 'after the market close on October 28'. These are new events, fresh guidance, and a new corporate action, which are likely not yet fully priced into the market.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports Advantest's significant upward revision of its net profit forecast by 24%, projection of record high profits, and announcement of a substantial 150 billion yen share buyback program. These are concrete, recent, and highly positive financial developments directly impacting the company's valuation and shareholder returns, providing clear actionable intelligence for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: 24% upward revision of current fiscal year's net profit forecast;Projection of record high profits for two consecutive periods;Announcement of a 150 billion yen share buyback program (2.5% of outstanding shares);Strong H1 FY2026 net profit surge (2.4 times year-on-year)
actionable_intelligence: The news indicates a strong positive outlook for Advantest, driven by robust market demand and a commitment to shareholder returns. Traders might consider buying or holding the stock, anticipating a positive market reaction to the revised forecasts and share buyback announcement.
original_headline: 本日注目すべき【好決算】銘柄 アドテスト、きんでん、トーエネク (28日引け後 発表分)
main_content: 10月28日の引け後に決算を発表した銘柄のなかから、業績好調や配当増額など市場で評価される可能性の高い銘柄を取り上げた。アドテスト<6857>[東証Ｐ]　　★今期最終を24％上方修正・最高益予想を上乗せ、自社株買いも発表◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結最終利益は前年同期比2.4倍の1698億円に急拡大して着地。HPCデバイスやAI関連半導体の需要の高まりを背景に、半導体の複雑化や性能向上などが進む中、高性能SoC半導体向け検査装置の販売が大きく伸びた。業績好調に伴い、通期の同利益を従来予想の2215億円→2750億円に24.2％上方修正。増益率が37.4％増→70.6％増に拡大し、従来の2期連続での過去最高益予想をさらに上乗せした。併せて、発行済み株式数の2.5％にあたる1800万株または1500億円を上限に自社株買いを実施すると発表。きんでん<1944>[東証Ｐ]　　★今期経常を24％上方修正・最高益予想を上乗せ、配当も20円増額◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益は前年同期比2.4倍の340億円に急拡大し、従来予想の240億円を上回って着地。良好な市場環境を背景とした工事採算の向上に加え、生産性向上を進めたことが上振れにつながった。併せて、通期の同利益を従来予想の700億円→865億円に23.6％上方修正。増益率が8.4％増→34.0％増に拡大し、従来の2期連続での過去最高益予想をさらに上乗せした。業績好調に伴い、年間配当を従来計画の100円→120円(前期は90円)に増額修正した。トーエネク<1946>[東証Ｐ]　　★今期経常を18％上方修正・最高益予想を上乗せ、配当も13円増額◆26年3月期の連結経常利益を従来予想の170億円→200億円に17.6％上方修正。増益率が10.7％増→30.2％増に拡大し、従来の2期連続での過去最高益予想をさらに上乗せした。屋内線工事の豊富な手持ち案件が順調に進捗する中、採算性の向上が想定を上回ることなどを織り込んだ。併せて、年間配当を従来計画の52円→65円に増額修正した。配当方針を変更し、配当性向を40％以上(従来は30％以上)に引き上げる。ＷＯＷＯＷ<4839>[東証Ｐ]　　★上期経常を一転31％増益に上方修正◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益を従来予想の6億円→21億円に3.5倍上方修正。従来の減益予想から一転して30.8％増益見通しとなった。その他収入が想定を上回ったことに加え、番組費などの一部費用の発生が第3四半期以降へずれ込むことなどが上振れの要因。リアルゲト<5532>[東証Ｇ]　　★今期経常は35％増で8期連続最高益更新へ◆25年9月期の経常利益(非連結)は前の期比31.5％増の8.2億円に伸びて着地。続く26年9月期も前期比35.1％増の11.1億円に拡大し、8期連続で過去最高益を更新する見通しとなった。今期は既存運営物件の高稼働率を維持し、安定的なストック型収入の積み上げを継続するほか、フロー型収益では2件の保有物件を売却する計画。併せて、28年9月期に営業利益25億円(25年9月期実績は10.4億円)を目指す中期経営計画を発表。テセック<6337>[東証Ｓ]　　★今期経常を2.2倍上方修正◆26年3月期の連結経常利益を従来予想の1億4000万円→3億1000万円に2.2倍上方修正。減益率が79.2％減→54.0％減に縮小する見通しとなった。テスタ分野における部材高騰の影響解消や研究開発費が想定を下回ることに加え、為替水準が想定より円安で推移していることが上振れの要因。一方、テスタの軟調な引き合いや受注状況を踏まえ、売上高は下方修正した。併せて、発行済み株式数の3.46％にあたる20万株を11月13日付で消却すると発表。日金銭<6418>[東証Ｐ]　　★上期経常を2倍上方修正◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益を従来予想の5億円→10億円に2.0倍上方修正。減益率が83.3％減→66.6％減に縮小する見通しとなった。為替相場が想定より円安に推移し、為替差益が発生することが利益を押し上げる。日車両<7102>[東証Ｐ]　　★今期経常を一転18％増益に上方修正◆26年3月期の連結経常利益を従来予想の70億円→86億円に22.9％上方修正。従来の減益予想から一転して17.9％増益見通しとなった。各事業の売上高が想定より堅調に推移することに加え、製品構成の変化などで利益率が向上することを反映した。ムサシ<7521>[東証Ｓ]　　★上期経常を58％上方修正、通期も増額、配当も10円増額◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益を従来予想の15億円→23.7億円に57.8％上方修正。東京都議会議員選挙や参議院議員選挙向けに、自社開発商品である選挙システム機材の販売が好調に推移したことが要因。上期業績の好調に伴い、通期の同利益も従来予想の19.2億円→27.4億円に42.6％上方修正。減益率が59.4％減→42.1％減に縮小する見通しとなった。併せて、上期配当を従来計画の18円→28円(前年同期は30円)に大幅増額し、年間配当は46円になる。
main_content_en: Among the stocks that announced their financial results after the market close on October 28, we have highlighted those with strong performance or increased dividends that are likely to be highly regarded by the market. Advantest <6857> [TSE Prime] Revised current fiscal year's net profit up 24%, raised record high profit forecast, and announced share buyback. Consolidated net profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) surged 2.4 times year-on-year to 169.8 billion yen. Against the backdrop of rising demand for HPC devices and AI-related semiconductors, and as semiconductor complexity and performance improvements progress, sales of test equipment for high-performance SoC semiconductors grew significantly. Due to strong performance, the full-year profit forecast was revised upward by 24.2% from the previous forecast of 221.5 billion yen to 275.0 billion yen. The growth rate expanded from a 37.4% increase to a 70.6% increase, further raising its forecast for a record high profit for two consecutive periods. Concurrently, the company announced a share buyback program with an upper limit of 18 million shares, representing 2.5% of outstanding shares, or 150 billion yen. Kinden <1944> [TSE Prime] Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit up 24%, raised record high profit forecast, and increased dividend by 20 yen. Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) surged 2.4 times year-on-year to 34.0 billion yen, exceeding the previous forecast of 24.0 billion yen. The improvement in project profitability, backed by a favorable market environment, coupled with progress in productivity improvements, led to the upward revision. Concurrently, the full-year profit forecast was revised upward by 23.6% from the previous forecast of 70.0 billion yen to 86.5 billion yen. The growth rate expanded from an 8.4% increase to a 34.0% increase, further raising its forecast for a record high profit for two consecutive periods. Due to strong performance, the annual dividend was revised upward from the previous plan of 100 yen to 120 yen (90 yen in the previous fiscal year). Toenec <1946> [TSE Prime] Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit up 18%, raised record high profit forecast, and increased dividend by 13 yen. Consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward by 17.6% from the previous forecast of 17.0 billion yen to 20.0 billion yen. The growth rate expanded from a 10.7% increase to a 30.2% increase, further raising its forecast for a record high profit for two consecutive periods. This revision incorporates factors such as profitability improvements exceeding expectations, as numerous existing indoor wiring construction projects progress smoothly. Concurrently, the annual dividend was revised upward from the previous plan of 52 yen to 65 yen. The dividend policy was changed, raising the dividend payout ratio to 40% or more (previously 30% or more). WOWOW <4839> [TSE Prime] Revised first-half ordinary profit to a 31% increase, reversing previous forecast. Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was revised upward 3.5 times from the previous forecast of 0.6 billion yen to 2.1 billion yen. This reversed the previous forecast of a profit decrease, now projecting a 30.8% profit increase. Factors contributing to the upward revision include other income exceeding expectations, as well as the deferral of some expenses, such as program costs, to the third quarter and beyond. Realgate <5532> [TSE Growth] Current fiscal year's ordinary profit to increase 35%, marking 8 consecutive periods of record high profits. Non-consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ended September 2025 increased 31.5% from the previous period to 0.82 billion yen. For the subsequent fiscal year ending September 2026, it is expected to expand by 35.1% year-on-year to 1.11 billion yen, marking a record high profit for the eighth consecutive period. For the current fiscal year, the company plans to maintain high occupancy rates for existing managed properties, continue to accumulate stable stock-type revenue, and sell two owned properties for flow-type revenue. Concurrently, the company announced a medium-term management plan aiming for an operating profit of 2.5 billion yen by the fiscal year ending September 2028 (actual result for the fiscal year ended September 2025 was 1.04 billion yen). TSEC <6337> [TSE Standard] Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit up 2.2 times. Consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward 2.2 times from the previous forecast of 140 million yen to 310 million yen. The rate of profit decrease is expected to shrink from 79.2% to 54.0%. Factors contributing to the upward revision include the resolution of the impact of soaring material costs in the tester field, research and development expenses being lower than expected, and the yen's exchange rate remaining weaker than anticipated. On the other hand, sales were revised downward due to sluggish inquiries and order conditions for testers. Concurrently, the company announced that it will cancel 200,000 shares, representing 3.46% of outstanding shares, on November 13. Nippon Coinco <6418> [TSE Prime] Revised first-half ordinary profit up 2 times. Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was revised upward 2.0 times from the previous forecast of 0.5 billion yen to 1.0 billion yen. The rate of profit decrease is expected to shrink from 83.3% to 66.6%. The yen's exchange rate remaining weaker than anticipated, leading to foreign exchange gains, will boost profits. Nippon Sharyo <7102> [TSE Prime] Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit to an 18% increase, reversing previous forecast. Consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward by 22.9% from the previous forecast of 7.0 billion yen to 8.6 billion yen. This reversed the previous forecast of a profit decrease, now projecting a 17.9% profit increase. This reflects factors such as sales in each business segment performing more robustly than expected, and improved profit margins due to changes in product mix. Musashi <7521> [TSE Standard] Revised first-half ordinary profit up 58%, increased full-year forecast, and increased dividend by 10 yen. Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half of the fiscal year ending March 2026 (April-September) was revised upward by 57.8% from the previous forecast of 1.5 billion yen to 2.37 billion yen. The reason for this is strong sales of the company's proprietary election system equipment for the Tokyo Metropolitan Assembly election and the House of Councillors election. Due to strong first-half performance, the full-year profit forecast was also revised upward by 42.6% from the previous forecast of 1.92 billion yen to 2.74 billion yen. The rate of profit decrease is expected to shrink from 59.4% to 42.1%. Concurrently, the first-half dividend was significantly increased from the previous plan of 18 yen to 28 yen (30 yen in the same period last year), making the annual dividend 46 yen.

headline: [Analyst Rating] Advantest: Rating Maintained as "Overweight", Target Price Raised to 21,100 Yen (Major US Brokerage)
description: ADVANTEST CORP maintained an "Overweight" rating from a major US brokerage, which also raised its target price from 19,500 yen to 21,100 yen.
key_takeaways: A major US brokerage maintained an "Overweight" rating for Advantest.;The target price for Advantest was raised from 19,500 yen to 21,100 yen.;The new target price of 21,100 yen is substantially above the consensus target price of 13,811 yen.;The consensus rating from 14 analysts was 4.21, indicating a "slightly bullish" sentiment prior to this update.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports a specific, new event: a major US brokerage firm raised its target price for ADVANTEST CORP on October 28th. This constitutes a new rating change, which is considered new information likely not fully priced in yet.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports that a major US brokerage maintained an 'Overweight' rating for Advantest and significantly raised its target price. Crucially, the new target price of 21,100 yen is substantially higher than the current analyst consensus of 13,811 yen. This divergence from consensus, coming from a major brokerage, provides specific and actionable intelligence that could influence trading decisions, suggesting a potential upside not yet fully reflected in the broader market sentiment.
news_worthy_key_factors: Major US brokerage raised target price for Advantest.;New target price (21,100 yen) is significantly above the analyst consensus (13,811 yen).;Maintained 'Overweight' rating reinforces positive sentiment.;Specific and recent event with clear financial implications.
actionable_intelligence: Traders might consider initiating or increasing long positions in Advantest, anticipating that the stock price could move towards the higher target price set by the major brokerage, especially given its significant divergence from the consensus.
original_headline: 【アナリスト評価】アドバンテスト、レーティング強気を継続、目標株価21,100円に引上げ（米系大手証券）
main_content: 米系大手証券が10月28日、アドバンテスト<6857>のレーティングを強気（Overweight）に据え置いた。一方、目標株価は19,500円から21,100円に引き上げた。因みに前日（10月27日）時点のレーティングコンセンサスは4.21（アナリスト数14人）で「やや強気」の水準、目標株価コンセンサスは13,811円（アナリスト数14人）となっている。
main_content_en: A major US brokerage maintained its "Overweight" rating for Advantest <6857> on October 28. Meanwhile, it raised its target price from 19,500 yen to 21,100 yen. Incidentally, as of the previous day (October 27), the consensus rating was 4.21 (based on 14 analysts), indicating a "slightly bullish" level, and the consensus target price was 13,811 yen (based on 14 analysts).

headline: Nikkei 225 up by about 980 yen; top gainers among constituent stocks include Advantest, Lasertec, and Tokuyama
description: ADVANTEST CORP was listed among the top gainers of Nikkei 225 constituent stocks as the index reached a new all-time high. This occurred during a period of strong market performance.
key_takeaways: The Nikkei 225 stock average rose by about 980 yen, reaching approximately 51,200 yen.;The index updated its all-time high, reaching 51,270 yen and 46 sen.;Top gainers included Advantest, Lasertec, Tokuyama, Fujikura, and Mitsui Mining & Smelting.;Top decliners included Nidec, SHIFT, BayCurrent Consulting, Daiichi Sankyo, and Olympus.;The dollar-yen exchange rate showed a slight depreciation of the yen, trading around 151.90 yen per dollar.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is an intra-day market update, summarizing the Nikkei 225's performance and listing top gainers and losers for the current day. While ADVANTEST CORP is mentioned as a top gainer, this is an observation of its stock performance within a broader market context, not a new corporate event or announcement from the company itself. This constitutes a daily market recap of events that are already occurring and likely priced in.
source: ウエルスアドバイザー
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a broad market summary reporting on the Nikkei 225's performance and lists Advantest as one of several top gainers. It does not provide any specific, company-focused news, events, or fundamental reasons for Advantest's stock movement that would constitute actionable intelligence for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation: Advantest is one of many companies mentioned in a general market report.;Lack of specific events: No underlying reason or specific event for Advantest's stock movement is provided.;Derivative content: The article is a market summary, not a dedicated analysis of Advantest.;No actionable intelligence: Simply reporting past price movement without context or cause is not actionable for future trading decisions.
original_headline: 日経平均は９８０円程度高、採用銘柄の値上がり率上位はアドバンテス、レーザーテク、トクヤマなど
main_content: ２９日午前１１時１分すぎの日経平均株価は、前日比９８０円程度高い５万１２００円近辺にある。午前１０時５６分には、同１０５１円２８銭高の５万１２７０円４６銭と、２７日に付けた取引時間中の史上最高値を更新した。その後も高値圏での値動きが続いている。ドル・円相場は、１ドル＝１５１円９０銭台で朝方の水準からはやや円安方向にある。日経平均採用銘柄では、値上がり率の上位には、アドバンテス<6857>、レーザーテク<6920>、トクヤマ<4043>、フジクラ<5803>、三井金属<5706>がランクイン。一方、値下がり率上位に、ニデック<6594>、ＳＨＩＦＴ<3697>、ベイカレント<6532>、第一三共<4568>、オリンパス<7733>が入っている。
main_content_en: As of slightly past 11:01 AM on the 29th, the Nikkei 225 stock average is at around 51,200 yen, up by about 980 yen from the previous day's close. At 10:56 AM, it rose by 1,051 yen and 28 sen, reaching 51,270 yen and 46 sen, updating the all-time high set during trading hours on the 27th. Since then, price movements have continued in the high range. The dollar-yen exchange rate is in the 151.90 yen range per dollar, showing a slight depreciation of the yen compared to morning levels. Among Nikkei 225 constituent stocks, the top gainers include Advantest <6857>, Lasertec <6920>, Tokuyama <4043>, Fujikura <5803>, and Mitsui Mining & Smelting <5706>. On the other hand, the top decliners include Nidec <6594>, SHIFT <3697>, BayCurrent Consulting <6532>, Daiichi Sankyo <4568>, and Olympus <7733>.

headline: Advantest Hits Daily Limit High / IPO Stocks: Texcend Starts Smoothly, But... / Nikkei Average at Record High [Today's Featured Stocks & Japanese Stock Market Outlook] "Daily ZAi" October 29th Issue
description: ADVANTEST CORP announced strong H1 results and significantly revised its full-year operating profit forecast upward, fueled by expanding AI demand. This led to its stock hitting a daily limit high and contributing substantially to the Nikkei Average's rise.
key_takeaways: The Nikkei Average surpassed 51,000 yen for the first time, largely driven by Advantest, which hit its daily limit high after announcing strong H1 results and an upward revision to its full-year operating profit forecast.;Advantest and Kindai Corporation both reported significantly improved H1 operating profits and revised their full-year forecasts upward, underscoring the strong performance of AI-related and data center-benefiting stocks.;The October IPO market showed mixed results; while Texcend Photomask had a fairly smooth start, three out of nine listed companies opened below their offering prices, and several others were postponed, indicating increased investor selectivity.;Upcoming key events include the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) results and earnings announcements from major tech companies like Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft in the U.S.;Investors are becoming more cautious and selective regarding IPOs, especially larger ones, due to concerns about price fluctuation risks and the balance between stock supply and demand.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports on ADVANTEST CORP's newly announced earnings, an upward revision of its full-year operating profit forecast, an increased interim dividend, and a new share buyback plan, all released 'after the close of trading on the 28th'. It also describes the immediate market reaction 'in today's Tokyo market', indicating new, impactful information.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports that Advantest hit its daily limit high due to well-received earnings and an upward revision of its full-year operating profit forecast. This is a concrete, recent, and highly positive development directly impacting the company's stock price and is explicitly stated as a major driver for the overall market, providing clear actionable intelligence.
news_worthy_key_factors: Advantest hit daily limit high;Upward revision of earnings forecast;Strong performance in AI-related stocks;Directly pushed up the Nikkei Stock Average
actionable_intelligence: The news indicates strong positive momentum and improved fundamentals for Advantest, suggesting potential for continued upward movement or a strong entry point for investors. Traders could consider buying or holding based on this positive earnings revision and market reaction.
original_headline: アドバンテストがストップ高/IPO株、テクセンド順調発進も…/日経平均最高値【今日の注目株＆日本株市場見通し】「デイリーZAi」10月29日号
main_content: ◆今日の内容を10秒でチェック！ ・日経平均は初の5万1000円台！ アドテストが1077円押し上げ ・アドテストやきんでんが業績上方修正、AI関連の好調際立つ ・IPO株…テクセンドまずまず順調発進も、不調・中止ちらほら ●【1】今日の株式相場＆話題株 早わかり！ 初の5万1000円台！ アドテストが1077円押し上げ 【今日の相場】 日経平均株価は大幅反発！ 初めて5万1000円台に乗せた。28日の米国市場ではハイテク株に買いが入り、NYダウなどの主要株価指数が連日で過去最高値を更新。エヌビディアは開発者会議「GTC」でのジェンスン・ファンCEO(最高経営責任者)の講演を受けて+4.98％となった。また、今日の東京市場でもアドバンテストの決算が好感され、同社株は売買代金トップでストップ高。1銘柄で日経平均株価を約1077円押し上げた。もっとも、東証プライムの約86％の銘柄が値下がりし、東証株価指数(TOPIX)は-0.23％。AI(人工知能)普及の恩恵を受ける銘柄の好調ぶりが際立つ一方、その他企業の決算に対する株価反応は必ずしも良好ではなかった。 決算を受けて株価の強弱がより鮮明になりそうだが、有望なテーマや銘柄についてX(旧ツイッター)の音声チャット「スペース」で解説しているので参考にしてほしい。なお、今晩の米国では連邦公開市場委員会(FOMC)の結果とともに、アルファベットやメタ・プラットフォームズ、マイクロソフトといったハイテク大手の決算に注目したい。 【日経平均】51307.65円↑↑(+1088.47円) 【グロース250】703.43↓↓(-18.95) 【NYダウ】47706.37ドル↑(+161.78ドル、28日) 【ナスダック】23827.493↑(+190.037、28日) 【今日の話題株】 ◆アドバンテスト(6857) 2万2120円(+4000円) 半導体検査装置を手掛け、AI(人工知能)向けの需要が拡大。28日の取引終了後に2026年3月期の上期(4〜9月)決算を発表し、営業利益が前年同期比2.5倍の2324億円となった。また、通期の営業利益予想を従来の3000億円から3740億円(前期比63.9％増)に上方修正。1株あたり中間配当は前期より10円多い29円とし、最大1500億円の自社株買いを実施する。2027年3期までの中期経営計画に掲げた経営指標も上方修正した。 ◆きんでん(1944) 6158円(+1000円) 関西電力系の電気設備工事大手。2026年3月期の上期(4〜9月)営業利益は前年同期比2.5倍の318億円となり、従来予想(230億円)を大幅に上回った。また、通期の営業利益予想を670億円から810億円(前期比32.8％増)に上方修正し、年間配当予想も1株あたり100円から120円(中間・期末とも60円)に増額した。データセンターの新増設などが追い風になっているとみられる。 ◆オービック(4684) 4693円(-260円) 2026年3月期の上期(4〜9月)決算を発表し、営業利益は前年同期比13.0％増の436億円だった。主力の統合業務ソフトウェア(ERP)「OBIC7シリーズ」が引き続き堅調に推移した。良好な決算との声が聞かれたものの、市場予想や事前の観測報道並みの利益水準だったことから、サプライズなしと受け止められて売りが出たようだ。 ●【2】水曜コーナー「ザイアナリスト小林大純『IPO株ココだけの話』」 テクセンドはまずまず順調発進も、不調・中止ちらほら 今日は10月のIPO(新規株式公開)結果を確認していこう(事前の銘柄紹介については9月17日号や10月1日号参照)。 10月は9社が上場したが、28日に上場予定だったBJCは延期となった。また、11月5日に上場予定だったファイントゥデイホールディングスは昨年に続き2度目の延期。延期を決める直前には、国内政治をめぐって株式相場が乱高下していたことから、単にタイミングが悪かっただけかもしれない。ただ、株式相場の好調ぶりとは裏腹に、IPO株をめぐっては投資家の銘柄選別色が強まっている、あるいは価格変動リスクによりシビアになっている可能性もあるだろう。 上場にこぎつけた9社の初値も、全体的に好調だったとは言いづらい。大型IPOとして注目されたテクセンドフォトマスク(公募・売出規模1566億円)こそ公開価格比+19.0％とまずまず順調な出足だったが、9社中3社は公開価格割れスタートを強いられた。オーバーラップホールディングス(売出規模165億円)やインフキュリオン(公募・売出規模130億円)はやや大型のIPO(=換金売りが出やすい)だったのでやむを得ない面もあるが、上場までの過程で公開株数を積み増すなど強気な姿勢が見られただけに、少々残念な結果だ。当面、このサイズのIPOは株式需給(売りと買いのバランス)への警戒感が強まる可能性もある。 一方、公募・売出規模が数十億円程度のIPOはおおむね公開価格の2〜4割高、10億円あまりのライオン事務器は+75.6％という初値になった。初値後の値動きが比較的良好なのはユーソナーで、公開価格2000円に対し初値2350円(+17.5％)を付けると、24日に一時3450円まで上昇した。上場直後とあってやや荒い値動きだが、成長期待は高そうだ。 なお、来週は11月4日にNE、5日にクラシコが上場する予定。ともに公募・売出規模4億円あまりという小型IPO(=換金売りが出にくい)で、初値が大きく上昇しやすいタイプだ。その他の11月の上場予定については、別の機会に紹介したい。また、SBI新生銀行が12月中旬の上場を目指しているなどと報じられた。11月中にもIPOの詳細が明らかになるとのことなので注目しておこう。 【銘柄ピックアップ】 ユーソナー(431A) 10月17日に東証グロース上場。公開価格2000円を17.5％上回る2350円で初値を付けた。独自に構築した法人データベースを活用し、顧客の保有するデータベースを整備・統合・継続更新するクラウドサービスを提供している。2025年12月期の業績予想は、売上高が前期比13.3％増の68億8000万円、営業利益が38.5％増の12億6100万円。 (ザイIPO株アナリスト 小林大純) 小林大純 ダイヤモンド・ザイ アナリスト早稲田大学法学部卒、早稲田大学大学院ファイナンス研究科(現経営管理研究科)修了(MBA)。金融情報サービス会社などを経て現職。日本株アナリストとして各種メディアで活動中。
main_content_en: ◆Check Today's Content in 10 Seconds! ・Nikkei Average breaks 51,000 yen for the first time! Advantest pushes it up by 1,077 yen ・Advantest and Kindai Corporation revise earnings forecasts upward, strong performance in AI-related stocks stands out ・IPO stocks... Texcend starts fairly smoothly, but some underperformances and cancellations are seen ●[1] Today's Stock Market & Hot Stocks at a Glance! Breaks 51,000 yen for the first time! Advantest pushes it up by 1,077 yen [Today's Market] The Nikkei Stock Average rebounded sharply! It surpassed the 51,000 yen level for the first time. In the U.S. market on the 28th, technology stocks were bought, and major stock indices such as the NY Dow updated their record highs for consecutive days. Nvidia rose +4.98% following CEO Jensen Huang's speech at the 'GTC' developer conference. Furthermore, in today's Tokyo market, Advantest's earnings were well-received, and its stock hit the daily limit high with the highest trading value. This single stock pushed up the Nikkei Stock Average by approximately 1,077 yen. However, approximately 86% of stocks on the TSE Prime market declined, and the Tokyo Stock Price Index (TOPIX) fell by -0.23%. While the strong performance of stocks benefiting from the spread of AI (Artificial Intelligence) stood out, stock reactions to the earnings of other companies were not necessarily favorable. The strengths and weaknesses of stocks are likely to become clearer after earnings announcements, so please refer to the explanations on promising themes and stocks in X (formerly Twitter)'s audio chat 'Spaces'. Furthermore, tonight in the U.S., attention will be on the results of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) as well as the earnings of major tech companies such as Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft. [Nikkei Average] 51,307.65 yen ↑↑ (+1,088.47 yen) [Growth 250] 703.43 ↓↓ (-18.95) [NY Dow] 47,706.37 dollars ↑ (+161.78 dollars, 28th) [Nasdaq] 23,827.493 ↑ (+190.037, 28th) [Today's Hot Stocks] ◆Advantest (6857) 22,120 yen (+4,000 yen) Engages in semiconductor test equipment, with expanding demand for AI (Artificial Intelligence). After the close of trading on the 28th, the company announced its H1 (April-September) results for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with operating profit reaching 232.4 billion yen, 2.5 times higher than the same period last year. Furthermore, it revised its full-year operating profit forecast upward from the previous 300 billion yen to 374 billion yen (a 63.9% increase year-on-year). The interim dividend per share was set at 29 yen, 10 yen higher than the previous fiscal year, and the company plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 150 billion yen. Management indicators outlined in the medium-term management plan up to the fiscal year ending March 2027 were also revised upward. ◆Kindai Corporation (1944) 6,158 yen (+1,000 yen) A major electrical equipment construction company affiliated with Kansai Electric Power. Operating profit for H1 (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 reached 31.8 billion yen, 2.5 times higher than the same period last year, significantly exceeding the previous forecast (23 billion yen). Furthermore, it revised its full-year operating profit forecast upward from 67 billion yen to 81 billion yen (a 32.8% increase year-on-year) and increased its annual dividend forecast from 100 yen to 120 yen per share (60 yen for both interim and year-end). The new construction and expansion of data centers are believed to be a tailwind. ◆Obic (4684) 4,693 yen (-260 yen) The company announced its H1 (April-September) results for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with operating profit increasing by 13.0% year-on-year to 43.6 billion yen. Its core integrated business software (ERP) 'OBIC7 Series' continued to perform strongly. Although the results were described as good, the profit level was in line with market expectations and prior reports, so it seems to have been perceived as lacking surprise, leading to selling. ●[2] Wednesday Corner: ZAi Analyst Hirozumi Kobayashi's 'IPO Stock Insider Story' Texcend Starts Fairly Smoothly, But Some Underperformances and Cancellations Are Seen Today, let's review the results of October's IPOs (Initial Public Offerings) (for prior stock introductions, refer to the September 17th and October 1st issues). Nine companies were listed in October, but BJC, which was scheduled to be listed on the 28th, was postponed. Furthermore, Fine Today Holdings, scheduled for listing on November 5th, was postponed for the second time, following last year. Just before the decision to postpone, the stock market was volatile due to domestic politics, so it might have simply been bad timing. However, contrary to the strong performance of the overall stock market, investors may be becoming more selective about IPO stocks, or more severe about price fluctuation risks. The initial prices of the nine companies that managed to list were also not generally strong. While Texcend Photomask (public offering/secondary offering size of 156.6 billion yen), which attracted attention as a large IPO, had a fairly smooth start with a +19.0% increase from its offering price, three out of the nine companies were forced to start below their offering prices. Although Overlap Holdings (secondary offering size of 16.5 billion yen) and Infcurion (public offering/secondary offering size of 13 billion yen) were somewhat large IPOs (meaning they are prone to cash-out selling), which might be unavoidable to some extent, the aggressive stance seen in increasing the number of shares offered during the listing process makes the outcome somewhat disappointing. For the time being, there is a possibility that caution regarding stock supply and demand (balance between selling and buying) for IPOs of this size may strengthen. On the other hand, IPOs with a public offering/secondary offering size of several billion yen generally saw initial prices 20-40% higher than their offering prices, and Lion Office Products, with a size of just over 1 billion yen, had an initial price of +75.6%. The stock with relatively good price movement after its initial price was Usonar, which opened at 2,350 yen (+17.5%) against an offering price of 2,000 yen, and temporarily rose to 3,450 yen on the 24th. Although the price movement is somewhat volatile immediately after listing, growth expectations appear high. Next week, NE is scheduled to be listed on November 4th, and Classico on November 5th. Both are small IPOs with a public offering/secondary offering size of just over 400 million yen (meaning they are less prone to cash-out selling), and are the type whose initial prices tend to rise significantly. Other scheduled listings for November will be introduced on another occasion. It was also reported that SBI Shinsei Bank is aiming for a mid-December listing. Since details of the IPO are expected to be revealed within November, let's keep an eye on it. [Stock Pick] Usonar (431A) Listed on TSE Growth on October 17th. It opened at 2,350 yen, 17.5% above its offering price of 2,000 yen. It provides cloud services that utilize its proprietary corporate database to organize, integrate, and continuously update customer-owned databases. For the fiscal year ending December 2025, the company forecasts sales of 6.88 billion yen, a 13.3% increase year-on-year, and operating profit of 1.261 billion yen, a 38.5% increase. (ZAi IPO Stock Analyst Hirozumi Kobayashi) Hirozumi Kobayashi, Diamond ZAi Analyst Graduated from Waseda University Faculty of Law, completed Waseda University Graduate School of Finance (currently Graduate School of Business and Finance) (MBA). After working at financial information service companies, among others, he is now in his current position. He is active in various media as a Japanese stock analyst.

headline: Featured Stocks Pick-up [Evening Edition] (1): Advantest, TOENEC, Kinden
description: ADVANTEST CORP revised its consolidated earnings forecast upward for the fiscal year ending March 2026, driven by strong demand for AI-related semiconductor testers. The company also announced a share repurchase program and raised its medium-term management plan targets.
key_takeaways: Advantest, TOENEC, Kinden, Shikoku Chemicals Holdings, Nippon Sharyo, Tochigi Bank, Takasago Thermal Engineering, and NIPPON GAS all revised their full-year earnings forecasts upward.;Advantest, TOENEC, Kinden, Tochigi Bank, and Takasago Thermal Engineering announced increased dividend forecasts, signaling a strong commitment to shareholder returns.;Advantest and NIPPON GAS initiated share repurchase programs, further boosting investor confidence and capital efficiency.;Advantest raised its medium-term management plan targets, anticipating continued robust demand for high-performance computing (HPC) and AI semiconductor testing solutions.;Ai Robotics experienced a stock surge following the announcement of a brand ambassador contract with V of K-POP group BTS, aiming for global market expansion.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports several new, significant corporate announcements for ADVANTEST CORP, including an upward revision of its earnings forecast, a new interim dividend forecast, a share buyback program, and raised medium-term management plan targets. These events were announced 'after the close of trading on the 28th,' indicating they are fresh information likely impacting the market today.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article provides highly specific and actionable intelligence for Advantest, detailing significant upward revisions to its earnings forecasts, an increased dividend payout, a substantial share repurchase program, and raised medium-term management plan targets. These are concrete, recent developments that directly impact the company's valuation and investor sentiment. Although the article covers multiple companies, the section dedicated to Advantest is comprehensive and detailed, not a brief or generic mention.
news_worthy_key_factors: Significant upward revision of consolidated earnings forecasts for FY2026.;Announcement of a substantial share repurchase program (150 billion JPY, 2.47% of shares).;Raised medium-term management plan targets for FY2027, indicating strong future growth.;Increased interim dividend forecast.
actionable_intelligence: The combination of strong financial performance, commitment to shareholder returns (dividends, buyback), and optimistic future guidance provides a strong positive signal for Advantest's stock. Traders could consider initiating or increasing long positions, or re-evaluating existing holdings based on this highly favorable outlook.
original_headline: 話題株ピックアップ【夕刊】（1）：アドテスト、トーエネク、きんでん
main_content: ■アドバンテスト<6857>22,120円  +4,000 円 (+22.1％) ストップ高 　　本日終値　 東証プライム 上昇率トップアドバンテスト<6857>がストップ高し上場来高値を更新。２８日の取引終了後、２６年３月期の連結業績予想について、売上高を８３５０億円から９５００億円（前期比２１．８％増）へ、営業利益を３０００億円から３７４０億円（同６３．９％増）へ、純利益を２２１５億円から２７５０億円（同７０．６％増）へ上方修正し、あわせて未定としていた中間配当予想を２９円（前年同期１９円）としたことが好感された。ＡＩ関連向け半導体の更なる複雑化や性能向上及び生産数量の増加などを背景に、高性能半導体向けテスタ需要の拡大が続く見通し。なお、９月中間期決算は、売上高５２６７億３３００万円（前年同期比６０．０％増）、営業利益２３２４億３５００万円（同２．５倍）、純利益１６９８億１３００万円（同２．４倍）だった。同時に、上限を１８００万株（自己株式を除く発行済み株数の２．４７％）、または１５００億円とする自社株買いを実施すると発表しており、これも好材料視された。取得期間は１１月４日から来年１０月２８日までで、株主還元と資本効率の向上を目的としている。また、２７年３月期を最終年度とする中期経営計画の数値目標を売上高で５６００億～７０００億円から８３５０億～９３００億円へ、営業利益率で２２～２８％から３３～３６％へそれぞれ引き上げた。ＨＰＣ（ハイパフォーマンス・コンピューティング）／ＡＩ半導体の試験ソリューションに対する力強い需要が継続し、策定時に掲げた目標を超過する可能性が高まったことが要因としている。■トーエネック<1946>1,771円  +300 円 (+20.4％) ストップ高 　　本日終値　 東証プライム 上昇率2位トーエネック<1946>はストップ高。２８日の取引終了後、２６年３月期第２四半期累計（４～９月）の連結決算の発表にあわせて、通期業績予想を修正した。営業利益予想を前回予想の１８０億円から２００億円（前期比２４．７％増）、最終利益予想を１２０億円から１５０億円（同３９．３％増）に引き上げた。同時に年間配当予想は中間２２円・期末３０円の年５２円から中間２８円・期末３７円の年６５円に増額した。利益予想の引き上げと株主還元姿勢を評価する買いが流入した。９月中間期は配電線工事の工事量や一部の子会社の完成工事案件が予想を下回ったものの、屋内線工事を中心に採算性の向上が想定を上回った。子会社からの受取配当金や持ち分法投資利益の増加、保有株式の売却益なども収益に貢献し、売上高は１２４７億１４００万円（前年同期比１．７％減）、営業利益は８５億６６００万円（同３２．５％増）、最終利益が７２億１６００万円（同２．５倍）になった。なお、通期の売上高予想は据え置き。配電線工事の工事量が回復していることに加え、屋内線工事の手持ち工事が豊富で、かつ好調に進捗していることを踏まえた。９月中間期時点での受注高は計１２５５億２６００万円（同１８．３％増）に上った。年間配当の６５円は２４年１０月１日付で実施した１株につき５株の割合での株式分割後ベースで実質１５円増配となる。また、同社は配当方針の変更も発表。連結配当性向の基準について、これまでの「３０％以上」から「４０％を目安」に改めた。■きんでん<1944>6,158円  +1,000 円 (+19.4％) ストップ高 　　本日終値　 東証プライム 上昇率3位きんでん<1944>がストップ高の水準となる６１５８円に買われ、上場来高値を更新した。２８日の取引終了後、２６年３月期第２四半期累計（４～９月）の連結決算の発表にあわせて、通期業績予想を上方修正した。売上高予想を従来予想の７３００億円から７４２０億円（前期比５．２％増）、営業利益予想を６７０億円から８１０億円（同３２．８％増）に引き上げた。同時に年間配当予想は中間・期末各５０円の年１００円から中間・期末各６０円の年１２０円（前期は９０円）に増額した。好業績と株主還元姿勢を好感した買いが集まっている。９月中間期は良好な市場環境を背景とした採算性の向上に加え、生産性を改善する取り組みが奏功し予想を上回る業績で着地。売上高が３２１３億７８００万円（前年同期比７．８％増）、営業利益が３１８億８７００万円（同２．５倍）になった。配電工事や情報通信工事、環境関連工事など各完成工事高が増えた。通期業績予想は下期について良好な市場環境に加え、手持ち工事の状況を織り込んだ。中間期時点で個別の受注工事高は４６０８億８９００万円（同２１．６％増）に上った。事務所ビルなどが増加した一般電気工事をはじめ、各工事で受注高が前年同期を超えた。■四国化ＨＤ<4099>2,773円  +366 円 (+15.2％)　　本日終値　 東証プライム 上昇率4位四国化成ホールディングス<4099>は後場急騰し、上場来高値を更新。２９日正午ごろ、２５年１２期第３四半期累計（１～９月）の連結決算の発表にあわせて、通期業績予想を修正した。営業利益予想を従来予想の９４億円から１００億円（前期比２．７％増）、最終利益予想を６５億円から７０億円（同２０．６％減）に引き上げた。営業利益は減益予想から一転、前期に続き過去最高を更新する見通しとなり、評価された。売上高予想は据え置き。化学品事業の有機化成品や建材事業がこれまでの想定を下回る見通しになったものの、ファインケミカルが計画を上回ると見込む。ファインケミカルは収益性が高く、同商材の増収が各利益の上振れにつながった。一方、為替差損の発生や前期にあった投資有価証券売却益の反動などにより、引き続き最終利益は減益での着地を予想している。１～９月期は売上高が５２４億７３００万円（前年同期比１．０％減）、営業利益が８２億７５００万円（同９．５％増）、最終利益は６０億２２００万円（同１１．０％減）だった。■日本車輌製造<7102>3,480円  +445 円 (+14.7％)　　本日終値　 東証プライム 上昇率5位日本車輌製造<7102>が大口の買い注文が流入。前日は全体地合い悪に流され、大陰線を引いて７日ぶりに反落したが、きょうは動きを一変させ一気に切り返す展開に。２８日取引終了後、同社は２６年３期業績予想の修正を発表、営業利益は従来計画の６６億円から８２億円（前期比１８％増）に増額した。なお、期中２度目の上方修正であり、期初の営業利益予想は５６億円だった。鉄道車両、輸送用機器・鉄構事業の各事業の売り上げが会社側想定以上に伸び、収益押し上げに貢献した。これを材料視する形で上値を見込んだ投資資金が流入した。■関電工<1942>4,885円  +452 円 (+10.2％)　　本日終値　 東証プライム 上昇率6位関電工<1942>やクラフティア<1959>（旧九電工）が急騰し上場来高値を更新。２８日の取引終了後、きんでん<1944>とトーエネック<1946>が２６年３期第２四半期累計（４～９月）の連結決算の発表にあわせて、２６年３期の通期業績予想を修正した。両社とも通期業績予想を引き上げ、これを受け翌２９日の株価は急騰した。■栃木銀行<8550>550円  +44 円 (+8.7％)　　本日終値　 東証プライム 上昇率8位栃木銀行<8550>が後場終盤になって急上昇。午後３時ごろに２６年３期連結業績予想について、最終利益を５８億円から７８億円（前期２２３億２８００万円の赤字）へ上方修正し、あわせて配当予想を中間・期末各７円の年１４円から中間・期末各１２円の年２４円へ引き上げたことが好感された。単独業績において貸出金利息、預け金利息など資金利益の増加が計画を上回る見通しという。■Ａｉロボティクス<247A>1,928円  +135 円 (+7.5％)　　本日終値Ａｉロボティクス<247A>が大幅高で４日続伸し実質上場来高値を更新。この日、展開するスキンケアブランド「Ｙｕｎｔｈ（ユンス）」が、Ｋ－ＰＯＰグループ「ＢＴＳ」のＶ氏とブランドアンバサダー契約を締結したと発表しており、好材料視された。今回の取り組みは、Ｖ氏の除隊後初の日本での広告出演で、スキンケアブランドとしては日本初の単独契約となる。２１世紀のポップアイコンともいわれる「ＢＴＳ」のＶ氏をブランドアンバサダーに迎えることで、プレゼンス向上と海外市場への展開を見据えたグローバル戦略を本格的に始動するとしている。■高砂熱学工業<1969>4,588円  +312 円 (+7.3％)　　本日終値高砂熱学工業<1969>は大幅反発し実質上場来高値を更新。この日の寄り前に２６年３期連結業績予想について、売上高を４１００億円から４２１０億円（前期比１０．３％増）へ、営業利益を３６０億円から４３３億円（同３３．６％増）へ、純利益を２８７億円から３４３億円（同２４．１％増）へ上方修正し、あわせて期末配当予想を４４円から６２円へ引き上げたことが好感された。一部工事の工程見直しなどを行った結果、単体売上高は前回予想を下回る見込みとなったものの、効率的な施工体制などによる工事進捗とともに収益性の改善を見込むことから、連結では売上高・利益を押し上げる見通しという。■日本瓦斯<8174>2,821円  +139 円 (+5.2％)　　本日終値日本瓦斯<8174>は急反発した。同社は２８日の取引終了後、２６年３期第２四半期累計（４～９月）の連結決算を発表。売上高は前年同期比２．５％増の８８１億９５００万円、最終利益は同２．１倍の３４億３９００万円だった。大幅な増益となったことに加え、自社株買いの実施も発表しており、好感されたようだ。電気事業で顧客の増加により販売量が伸長。燃料価格の動向も利幅を拡大させる要因となった。自社株買いは総数４００万株（自己株式を除く発行済み株式総数の３．７％）、総額９０億円を上限とし、１０月２９日から来年３月３１日の間に実施する。
main_content_en: ■Advantest <6857> 22,120 yen +4,000 yen (+22.1%) Limit high Today's closing price TSE Prime Top gainer Advantest <6857> hit its daily limit high and updated its all-time high. After the close of trading on the 28th, the company revised upward its consolidated earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with net sales from 835 billion yen to 950 billion yen (up 21.8% year-on-year), operating income from 300 billion yen to 374 billion yen (up 63.9% year-on-year), and net income from 221.5 billion yen to 275 billion yen (up 70.6% year-on-year). In addition, the interim dividend forecast, which had been undecided, was set at 29 yen (19 yen in the same period of the previous year), which was well received. Against the backdrop of further complexity, performance improvement, and increased production volume of AI-related semiconductors, demand for testers for high-performance semiconductors is expected to continue to expand. For the interim period ending September, net sales were 526.733 billion yen (up 60.0% year-on-year), operating income was 232.435 billion yen (2.5 times year-on-year), and net income was 169.813 billion yen (2.4 times year-on-year). At the same time, the company announced a share repurchase program with an upper limit of 18 million shares (2.47% of outstanding shares excluding treasury stock) or 150 billion yen, which was also viewed as positive news. The acquisition period is from November 4 to October 28 next year, with the aim of shareholder returns and improving capital efficiency. Furthermore, the company raised the numerical targets of its medium-term management plan, with the fiscal year ending March 2027 as the final year, increasing net sales from 560 billion-700 billion yen to 835 billion-930 billion yen, and operating profit margin from 22-28% to 33-36%. The reason cited is the continued strong demand for testing solutions for HPC (High-Performance Computing)/AI semiconductors, which has increased the likelihood of exceeding the targets set at the time of formulation. ■TOENEC <1946> 1,771 yen +300 yen (+20.4%) Limit high Today's closing price TSE Prime 2nd highest gainer TOENEC <1946> hit its daily limit high. After the close of trading on the 28th, the company revised its full-year earnings forecast in conjunction with the announcement of its consolidated financial results for the second quarter (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026. The operating income forecast was raised from the previous forecast of 18 billion yen to 20 billion yen (up 24.7% year-on-year), and the net income forecast was raised from 12 billion yen to 15 billion yen (up 39.3% year-on-year). At the same time, the annual dividend forecast was increased from 52 yen per year (22 yen interim, 30 yen year-end) to 65 yen per year (28 yen interim, 37 yen year-end). Buying flowed in, evaluating the upward revision of the earnings forecast and the company's stance on shareholder returns. For the interim period ending September, although the volume of power distribution line construction and some completed construction projects of subsidiaries fell below expectations, profitability improvements, mainly in indoor wiring construction, exceeded expectations. Increased dividends received from subsidiaries, equity method investment income, and gains on sale of investment securities also contributed to earnings, with net sales of 124.714 billion yen (down 1.7% year-on-year), operating income of 8.566 billion yen (up 32.5% year-on-year), and net income of 7.216 billion yen (2.5 times year-on-year). The full-year net sales forecast was left unchanged. This was based on the recovery in the volume of power distribution line construction, as well as the abundant backlog of indoor wiring construction projects and their favorable progress. Order backlog as of the interim period ending September totaled 125.526 billion yen (up 18.3% year-on-year). The annual dividend of 65 yen represents an effective increase of 15 yen based on the 1-for-5 stock split implemented on October 1, 2024. The company also announced a change in its dividend policy, revising the consolidated dividend payout ratio target from "30% or more" to "approximately 40%." ■Kinden <1944> 6,158 yen +1,000 yen (+19.4%) Limit high Today's closing price TSE Prime 3rd highest gainer Kinden <1944> was bought up to 6,158 yen, hitting its daily limit high and updating its all-time high. After the close of trading on the 28th, the company revised upward its full-year earnings forecast in conjunction with the announcement of its consolidated financial results for the second quarter (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026. The net sales forecast was raised from the previous forecast of 730 billion yen to 742 billion yen (up 5.2% year-on-year), and the operating income forecast was raised from 67 billion yen to 81 billion yen (up 32.8% year-on-year). At the same time, the annual dividend forecast was increased from 100 yen per year (50 yen interim, 50 yen year-end) to 120 yen per year (60 yen interim, 60 yen year-end) (previous year was 90 yen). Buying gathered, favoring the strong performance and the company's stance on shareholder returns. For the interim period ending September, the company achieved better-than-expected results, driven by improved profitability due to a favorable market environment and successful initiatives to enhance productivity. Net sales were 321.378 billion yen (up 7.8% year-on-year), and operating income was 31.887 billion yen (2.5 times year-on-year). Completed construction work increased in various categories, including power distribution work, information and communication work, and environmental-related work. The full-year earnings forecast incorporates a favorable market environment for the second half of the year, as well as the status of projects on hand. As of the interim period, individual order backlog totaled 460.889 billion yen (up 21.6% year-on-year). Order backlog exceeded the previous year's same period for all types of work, including general electrical work, which saw an increase in office building projects. ■Shikoku Chemicals Holdings <4099> 2,773 yen +366 yen (+15.2%) Today's closing price TSE Prime 4th highest gainer Shikoku Chemicals Holdings <4099> surged in the afternoon session, updating its all-time high. Around noon on the 29th, the company revised its full-year earnings forecast in conjunction with the announcement of its consolidated financial results for the third quarter (January-September) of the fiscal year ending December 2025. The operating income forecast was raised from the previous forecast of 9.4 billion yen to 10 billion yen (up 2.7% year-on-year), and the net income forecast was raised from 6.5 billion yen to 7 billion yen (down 20.6% year-on-year). The operating income, which was initially forecast to decline, is now expected to update its record high for the second consecutive year, which was positively evaluated. The net sales forecast was left unchanged. Although organic chemical products in the chemicals business and the building materials business are expected to fall below previous assumptions, fine chemicals are anticipated to exceed plans. Fine chemicals have high profitability, and increased sales of these products led to an upward revision of each profit. On the other hand, due to foreign exchange losses and the reversal of gains on the sale of investment securities recorded in the previous fiscal year, net income is still expected to decline. For the January-September period, net sales were 52.473 billion yen (down 1.0% year-on-year), operating income was 8.275 billion yen (up 9.5% year-on-year), and net income was 6.022 billion yen (down 11.0% year-on-year). ■Nippon Sharyo <7102> 3,480 yen +445 yen (+14.7%) Today's closing price TSE Prime 5th highest gainer Nippon Sharyo <7102> saw a large influx of buy orders. The previous day, the stock fell for the first time in seven days, drawing a large bearish candlestick due to the overall negative market sentiment, but today it completely changed course and rebounded sharply. After the close of trading on the 28th, the company announced a revision to its earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, increasing operating income from the previous plan of 6.6 billion yen to 8.2 billion yen (up 18% year-on-year). This is the second upward revision during the fiscal year; the initial operating income forecast at the beginning of the fiscal year was 5.6 billion yen. Sales in the railway rolling stock, transportation equipment, and steel structure businesses grew more than the company's expectations, contributing to the increase in earnings. Investment funds flowed in, viewing this as a positive factor and anticipating further upside. ■Kandenko <1942> 4,885 yen +452 yen (+10.2%) Today's closing price TSE Prime 6th highest gainer Kandenko <1942> and Craftia <1959> (formerly Kyudenko) surged, updating their all-time highs. After the close of trading on the 28th, Kinden <1944> and TOENEC <1946> revised their full-year earnings forecasts for the fiscal year ending March 2026 in conjunction with the announcement of their consolidated financial results for the second quarter (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026. Both companies raised their full-year earnings forecasts, and in response, their stock prices surged on the following day, the 29th. ■Tochigi Bank <8550> 550 yen +44 yen (+8.7%) Today's closing price TSE Prime 8th highest gainer Tochigi Bank <8550> surged sharply in the late afternoon session. Around 3 PM, the company revised upward its consolidated earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, increasing net income from 5.8 billion yen to 7.8 billion yen (compared to a loss of 22.328 billion yen in the previous fiscal year). In addition, the dividend forecast was raised from 14 yen per year (7 yen interim, 7 yen year-end) to 24 yen per year (12 yen interim, 12 yen year-end), which was well received. In its non-consolidated results, an increase in funding profits, such as interest on loans and interest on deposits, is expected to exceed plans. ■Ai Robotics <247A> 1,928 yen +135 yen (+7.5%) Today's closing price Ai Robotics <247A> rose sharply for the fourth consecutive day, updating its effective all-time high. On this day, the company announced that its skincare brand "Yunth" had signed a brand ambassador contract with V of K-POP group "BTS," which was viewed as positive news. This initiative marks V's first advertising appearance in Japan after his military discharge and is the first exclusive contract for a skincare brand in Japan. By welcoming V of "BTS," often called a 21st-century pop icon, as a brand ambassador, the company aims to significantly enhance its presence and fully launch its global strategy with an eye on overseas market expansion. ■Takasago Thermal Engineering <1969> 4,588 yen +312 yen (+7.3%) Today's closing price Takasago Thermal Engineering <1969> rebounded sharply, updating its effective all-time high. Before the market opened on this day, the company revised upward its consolidated earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, increasing net sales from 410 billion yen to 421 billion yen (up 10.3% year-on-year), operating income from 36 billion yen to 43.3 billion yen (up 33.6% year-on-year), and net income from 28.7 billion yen to 34.3 billion yen (up 24.1% year-on-year). In addition, the year-end dividend forecast was raised from 44 yen to 62 yen, which was well received. As a result of reviewing the progress of some construction projects, non-consolidated net sales are expected to fall below the previous forecast. However, due to improved profitability through efficient construction systems and progress in projects, consolidated net sales and profits are expected to be pushed upward. ■NIPPON GAS <8174> 2,821 yen +139 yen (+5.2%) Today's closing price NIPPON GAS <8174> rebounded sharply. After the close of trading on the 28th, the company announced its consolidated financial results for the second quarter (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026. Net sales were 88.195 billion yen (up 2.5% year-on-year), and net income was 3.439 billion yen (2.1 times year-on-year). In addition to the significant increase in profits, the company also announced a share repurchase program, which seems to have been well received. Sales volume increased in the electricity business due to a rise in customers. Trends in fuel prices also contributed to expanding profit margins. The share repurchase program will be conducted between October 29 and March 31 next year, with an upper limit of 4 million shares (3.7% of outstanding shares excluding treasury stock) or 9 billion yen.

headline: [Analyst Rating] Advantest: Rating Maintained at Sell, Target Price Raised to 12,800 Yen (Major European Securities Firm)
description: A European securities firm maintained its "Underperform (Sell)" rating on ADVANTEST CORP, while raising its target price from 9,000 yen to 12,800 yen. This specific rating contrasts with the broader analyst consensus of "slightly bullish" and a 13,811 yen target price.
key_takeaways: A major European securities firm maintained an 'Underperform (Sell)' rating on Advantest.;The target price for Advantest was raised from 9,000 yen to 12,800 yen by the firm.;The broader analyst consensus rating for Advantest is 'slightly bullish' (4.21 based on 14 analysts).;The consensus target price from 14 analysts is 13,811 yen, higher than the firm's revised target.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports a specific, new analyst action by a major European securities firm on October 28th, which includes maintaining a 'Sell' rating but significantly raising the target price for ADVANTEST CORP. This constitutes a new rating change, which is explicitly defined as 'breaking' information.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports a specific, recent analyst rating and target price revision for Advantest from a major European securities firm. It also highlights a divergence between this firm's view and the broader market consensus. This type of information directly impacts market sentiment and can influence trading decisions, making it actionable.
news_worthy_key_factors: Specific analyst rating (Underperform/Sell) and target price revision (raised from 9,000 to 12,800 yen).;Timely information (October 27/28).;Divergence from broader analyst consensus (slightly bullish, 13,811 yen target).;Directly company-focused on ADVANTEST CORP.
actionable_intelligence: Traders could use this information to assess the conflicting signals from analysts, potentially influencing decisions on short-term positions, re-evaluating their own price targets, or considering contrarian strategies given the divergence in sentiment. For example, a trader might interpret the raised target price despite a maintained 'Sell' rating as a nuanced view, or use the consensus target as a benchmark.
original_headline: 【アナリスト評価】アドバンテスト、レーティング弱気を継続、目標株価12,800円に引上げ（欧州系大手証券）
main_content: 欧州系大手証券が10月28日、アドバンテスト<6857>のレーティングを弱気（Sell）に据え置いた。一方、目標株価は9,000円から12,800円に引き上げた。因みに前日（10月27日）時点のレーティングコンセンサスは4.21（アナリスト数14人）で「やや強気」の水準、目標株価コンセンサスは13,811円（アナリスト数14人）となっている。
main_content_en: A major European securities firm on October 28 maintained its rating on Advantest <6857> at Underperform (Sell). Meanwhile, the target price was raised from 9,000 yen to 12,800 yen. Incidentally, as of the previous day (October 27), the consensus rating was 4.21 (based on 14 analysts), indicating a "slightly bullish" level, and the consensus target price was 13,811 yen (based on 14 analysts).

headline: Individual Stock Strategy: Focus on Kindai and Advantest
description: ADVANTEST CORP revised upward its FY2026 March earnings forecast, announced a share buyback program up to 2.5% of outstanding shares, and updated its medium-term management plan. These positive developments are expected to make the company sought after in the market.
key_takeaways: U.S. stock markets (NY Dow, Nasdaq) closed higher, and Chicago Nikkei 225 futures also rose.;Companies like Nichigas, Advantest, Toenec, Kindai, and Komeri are highlighted for positive developments such as increased profits, share buybacks, or upward revised forecasts.;Advantest revised its FY2026 March earnings forecast upward and announced a share buyback, while Kindai also revised its FY2026 March earnings and dividend forecasts upward.;Companies including Nomura, Ines, PCA, Hokuetsu Corporation, and Nippon Chuzo are expected to show weak performance due to downward revisions of earnings or dividend forecasts.;Several companies announced share buyback programs, indicating a focus on shareholder returns.

These are new, forward-looking financial and strategic developments likely to impact the market.

While it mentions specific positive developments for Advantest (upward earnings forecast revision, share buyback, revised medium-term plan), this information is diluted among news for many other companies, making it less actionable as a standalone 'significant' article for a trader specifically tracking Advantest.

original_headline: 個別銘柄戦略:きんでんやアドバンテストに注目
main_content: 昨日28日の米株式市場でNYダウは161.78ドル高の47,706.37ドル、ナスダック総合指数は190.04pt高の23,827.50pt、シカゴ日経225先物は大阪日中比235円高の50,695円。為替は1ドル＝152.00-10円。今日の東京市場では、上期営業利益が前年同期比2.1倍と第1四半期の同75.05増から増益率が拡大し発行済株式数の3.7％上限の自社株買いも発表した日瓦斯<8174>、上期調整後営業利益が15.7％減と第1四半期の31.9％減から減益幅が縮小した日立建機<6305>、26年3月期業績予想を上方修正し発行済株式数の2.5％上限の自社株買いと中期経営計画の上方修正も発表したアドバンテスト<6857>、26年3月期利益と配当予想を上方修正し配当方針の変更も発表したトーエネック<1946>、26年3月期業績と配当予想を上方修正したきんでん<1944>、26年3月期業績予想を上方修正した日車輌<7102>、JPYCとステーブルコイン事業での業務提携で基本合意したと発表したips<4390>、発行済株式数の1.25％上限の自社株買いと0.48％上限の買付け委託・1.10％の自社株消却を発表したコメリ<8218>、東証スタンダードでは、26年5月期上期利益予想を上方修正した毎コムネット<8908>などが物色されそうだ。一方、上期税引前利益が25.8％増と第1四半期の55.7％増から増益率が縮小した野村<8604>、26年3月期業績予想を下方修正したアイネス<9742>、26年3月期業績予想を下方修正したピーシーエー<9629>、26年3月期業績予想を下方修正した北越コーポ<3865>、東証スタンダードでは、26年3月期業績と配当予想を下方修正した日鋳造<5609>などは軟調な展開が想定される。《CS》
main_content_en: In the U.S. stock market yesterday, the 28th, the NY Dow rose by $161.78 to $47,706.37, the Nasdaq Composite Index rose by 190.04 points to 23,827.50 points, and the Chicago Nikkei 225 futures rose by 235 yen compared to the Osaka daytime session to 50,695 yen. The exchange rate was 1 dollar = 152.00-10 yen. In today's Tokyo market, companies likely to be sought after include Nichigas <8174>, whose first-half operating profit increased 2.1 times year-on-year, with the growth rate expanding from a 75.05% increase in the first quarter, and which also announced a share buyback program up to 3.7% of outstanding shares; Hitachi Construction Machinery <6305>, whose first-half adjusted operating profit decreased by 15.7%, narrowing the decline from a 31.9% decrease in the first quarter; Advantest <6857>, which revised upward its FY2026 March earnings forecast and also announced a share buyback program up to 2.5% of outstanding shares and an upward revision to its medium-term management plan; Toenec <1946>, which revised upward its FY2026 March profit and dividend forecasts and also announced a change in its dividend policy; Kindai <1944>, which revised upward its FY2026 March earnings and dividend forecasts; Nippon Sharyo <7102>, which revised upward its FY2026 March earnings forecast; ips <4390>, which announced a basic agreement for a business alliance with JPYC in the stablecoin business; and Komeri <8218>, which announced a share buyback program up to 1.25% of outstanding shares, a commissioned purchase up to 0.48% of outstanding shares, and cancellation of 1.10% of its own shares. On the TSE Standard market, companies like Mycom Net <8908>, which revised upward its FY2026 May first-half profit forecast, are likely to be sought after. On the other hand, a weak performance is expected for companies such as Nomura <8604>, whose first-half pre-tax profit increased by 25.8%, with the growth rate narrowing from a 55.7% increase in the first quarter; Ines <9742>, which revised downward its FY2026 March earnings forecast; PCA <9629>, which revised downward its FY2026 March earnings forecast; Hokuetsu Corporation <3865>, which revised downward its FY2026 March earnings forecast; and on the TSE Standard market, companies like Nippon Chuzo <5609>, which revised downward its FY2026 March earnings and dividend forecasts.《CS》

headline: Today's [Updated All-Time Highs]: 31 Stocks Including Advantest and SBG
description: ADVANTEST CORP's stock updated an all-time high, driven by its upward revision of the fiscal year ending March 2026 earnings forecast and the announcement of a share buyback. These developments contributed to its favorable market performance.
