headline: Komatsu Revises Upward This Fiscal Year's Pre-tax Profit by 5% [Earnings Flash Report]
description: KOMATSU LTD reported a 7.3% decrease in its cumulative second-quarter pre-tax profit. However, the company revised its full-year pre-tax profit forecast upward by 5.0% to 464.0 billion yen, narrowing the projected profit decline for the fiscal year.
key_takeaways: Komatsu increased its full-year pre-tax profit forecast by 5.0% to 464.0 billion yen, suggesting improved expectations for the fiscal year ending March 2026.;The company's consolidated pre-tax profit for the cumulative second quarter (April-September) decreased by 7.3% year-on-year to 258.3 billion yen.;The projected year-on-year profit decline for the full fiscal year is now expected to be 23.3%, an improvement from the previous forecast of 26.9%.;Consolidated pre-tax profit for the July-September quarter (Q2) was 127.0 billion yen, a slight 0.8% decrease year-on-year, with the sales operating profit margin declining to 13.9% from 14.5%.;The second half (October-March) is projected to see a 37.0% year-on-year fall in consolidated pre-tax profit to 205.6 billion yen, indicating continued challenges.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly states that KOMATSU LTD announced its financial results and, crucially, revised its full-year profit guidance upward on October 29th. This is a new earnings release and guidance update, which are fresh developments likely not yet fully priced into the market.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports Komatsu's upward revision of its full-year pre-tax profit forecast, despite a weaker first half. This is a direct and timely update on the company's financial outlook, providing actionable intelligence for traders regarding future earnings expectations.
news_worthy_key_factors: Upward revision of full-year pre-tax profit forecast by 5.0%;Announcement of recent Q2 financial results and projections for the second half;Specific financial figures and percentages provided directly from company disclosure;Direct impact on future earnings expectations and stock valuation
actionable_intelligence: Traders could interpret the upward revision of the full-year profit forecast as a positive indicator, potentially leading to increased buying interest in Komatsu's stock, despite the mixed Q2 results. This information could influence short-to-medium term trading decisions based on improved future earnings outlook.
original_headline: 【決算速報】コマツ、今期税引き前を5％上方修正
main_content: コマツ < 6301 > [東証Ｐ] が10月29日後場(14:30)に決算(米国会計基準)を発表。26年3月期第2四半期累計(4-9月)の連結税引き前利益は前年同期比7.3％減の2583億円に減った。しかしながら、併せて通期の同利益を従来予想の4420億円→4640億円(前期は6048億円)に5.0％上方修正し、減益率が26.9％減→23.3％減に縮小する見通しとなった。会社側が発表した上期実績と通期計画に基づいて、当社が試算した10-3月期(下期)の連結税引き前利益は前年同期比37.0％減の2056億円に落ち込む計算になる。直近3ヵ月の実績である7-9月期(2Q)の連結税引き前利益は前年同期比0.8％減の1270億円となり、売上営業利益率は前年同期の14.5％→13.9％に低下した。株探ニュース（minkabu PRESS）※この記事は企業が公開した数値データを基に作成しています。投資に際しては下記の【決算短信.pdf】をご確認いただきますようお願いします。
main_content_en: Komatsu <6301> [TSE Prime] announced its financial results (U.S. GAAP) on the afternoon of October 29 (14:30). Its consolidated pre-tax profit for the cumulative second quarter (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 decreased by 7.3% year-on-year to 258.3 billion yen. However, at the same time, its full-year pre-tax profit was revised upward by 5.0% from the previous forecast of 442.0 billion yen to 464.0 billion yen (604.8 billion yen in the previous fiscal year), and the expected rate of profit decline is projected to narrow from a 26.9% decrease to a 23.3% decrease. Based on the first-half results and full-year plan announced by the company, our company's calculations show that the consolidated pre-tax profit for the October-March period (second half) is projected to fall by 37.0% year-on-year to 205.6 billion yen. For the most recent three-month period, the July-September quarter (Q2), the consolidated pre-tax profit was 127.0 billion yen, a 0.8% decrease year-on-year, and the sales operating profit margin declined from 14.5% in the same period last year to 13.9%. Kabutan News (minkabu PRESS) *This article is based on numerical data disclosed by the company. When making investment decisions, please refer to the [Financial Results Briefing.pdf] below.

headline: Featured Stocks [Evening Edition] (3): INES, Hokuetsu Corp, Komatsu
description: KOMATSU LTD revised its consolidated financial forecast for FY2026 upwards, increasing projections for sales, operating profit, and net profit. Despite this positive revision, the company's stock declined as the market perceived the good news as already priced in.
key_takeaways: INES, Hokuetsu Corporation, and PCA all announced significant downward revisions to their fiscal year 2026 financial forecasts and/or interim results, leading to sharp declines in their stock prices.;Digital Holdings implemented an emergency acquisition defense policy against a tender offer from Silvercape Investments, citing concerns over shareholder treatment and transparency.;Komatsu revised its fiscal year 2026 financial forecast upwards but still experienced a stock decline, suggesting the positive news was already factored into its price.;Tokyo Gas announced an upward revision to its fiscal year 2026 forecast, increased its dividend, outlined a new shareholder return policy, and initiated a substantial share buyback program, causing its stock to temporarily rise.;Trading in Sumitomo Corporation and SCSK shares was suspended following reports that Sumitomo Corporation plans to make SCSK a wholly owned subsidiary through a tender offer.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports that KOMATSU LTD announced an upward revision to its earnings forecast and simultaneously released its interim financial results 'around 2:30 PM', indicating new, time-sensitive market information.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company consolidation, with Komatsu being only one of many companies briefly mentioned. Although it notes an upward financial forecast revision for Komatsu, it immediately states that this was met with selling pressure, implying the news was already factored into the stock price. The article provides minimal specific details about Komatsu's revision, making it difficult for a trader to derive fresh, actionable intelligence.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, not focused on Komatsu.;Komatsu is a minor mention with limited specific details about its financial revision.;The article explicitly states the positive news (upward revision) was 'met with selling pressure' and 'already factored in', indicating no new actionable insight.;Lack of specific financial figures or detailed analysis for Komatsu's forecast revision.
original_headline: 話題株ピックアップ【夕刊】（3）：アイネス、北越コーポ、コマツ
main_content: アイネスが急落。２８日の取引終了後に、２６年３月期の連結業績予想について、売上高を４３０億円から３９０億円（前期比３．９％減）へ、営業利益を４０億円から１４億円（同６０．４％減）へ、最終利益を２８億円から１０億円（同５９．０％減）へ下方修正し、配当予想を年６０円（中間・期末未定）から年５５円（中間２５円・期末３０円）へ引き下げたことが嫌気された。地方公共団体情報システムの標準化対応の移行方法の見直しにより売上高が減少することが要因。また、同件の原価率の悪化も響くとしている。なお、同時に発表した９月中間期決算は、売上高１６４億８６００万円（前年同期比１１．５％減）、営業損益９億２０００万円の赤字（前年同期８億７６００万円の黒字）、最終損益６億１００万円の赤字（同５億３７００万円の黒字）だった。北越コーポレーションは大幅続落。２８日取引終了後、２６年３月期連結業績予想について売上高を３０３０億円から２９２０億円（前期比４．５％減）へ、営業利益を１８０億円から８０億円（同５９．４％減）へ下方修正すると発表した。海外市場におけるパルプ販売数量の減少や販売価格の下落、洋紙・板紙の販売数量減少が要因。円安も響く見通し。これを嫌気した売りが優勢となっている。デジタルホールディングスは大幅安。２８日取引終了後、投資会社シルバーケイプ・インベストメンツから受けているＴＯＢを巡り、有事導入型の買収対応方針を導入すると発表した。会社側ではシルバーケイプのＴＯＢについて、スクイーズアウトに至るか不透明な条件設定がなされており、一般株主が少数株主として取り残される恐れがあるという。ＴＯＢに応募させるような「事実上の圧力（強圧性）」が生じる可能性が高く、これを回避するために導入するとした。なお、現在実施中の博報堂ＤＹホールディングスから受けているＴＯＢについては引き続き賛同意見と応募中立意見を維持するとしている。不動テトラは大幅安。この日午後２時４５分ごろ、１０月下旬をメドに活動を終了する見込みだった「架空発注等の再発防止に関する特別委員会」に関し、調査の過程で新たな調査・確認を要する事項が生じたと発表した。調査委から１０月中に調査を終えることが不可能であるとの報告を受けたという。これに伴い、現在の委員３人に加え、新たに委員１人を追加する。調査終了（報告書受領）は現時点で１１月下旬の予定。先行き不透明感を嫌気した売りが出ている。ピー・シー・エーは大幅続落。２８日取引終了後、２６年３月期連結業績予想について売上高を１７６億８９００万円から１７５億３９００万円（前期比８．０％増）へ、営業利益を２８億２４００万円から２５億４３００万円（同３．６％減）へ下方修正すると発表した。ＰＣＡクラウドなどの新規契約獲得について上期見込みを達成できなかったため。これが売り材料となった。コマツが後場下げ幅を拡大。午後２時３０分ごろに２６年３月期の連結業績予想について、売上高を３兆７４５０億円から３兆８８８０億円（前期比５．３％減）へ、営業利益を４７８０億円から５０００億円（同２３．９％減）へ、純利益を３０９０億円から３２００億円（同２７．２％減）へ上方修正したが、目先の材料出尽くし感から売られたようだ。為替が想定より円安に推移していることに加えて、米国関税による影響額や最新の市場見通しなどを織り込んだ。また、下期の想定為替レートを１ドル＝１４０．０円（前回通期平均予想１３５．０円）、１ユーロ１６３．０円（同１５０．０円）、１オーストラリアドル＝９１．０円（同８４．０円）に見直したことも織り込んだ。同時に発表した９月中間期連結決算は、売上高１兆８９１５億円（前年同期比３．９％減）、営業利益２７７０億６１００万円（同８．７％減）、純利益１７５７億１００万円（同１２．９％減）と減収減益となった。主力の建設機械・車両部門で、販売価格の改善に努めたものの、前年同期に比べて円高となった影響やアジアにおける販売量が減少したことが響いた。三井不動産や三菱地所、住友不動産が軟調推移。日経平均株価は前日比で１０００円を超す上昇となるなかで、東証の業種別指数である不動産業は２％を超す下げとなっている。この日、ベッセント米財務長官がＳＮＳへの投稿を通じ、日本政府が日銀に金融政策の余地を与えようとする意欲は、インフレ期待の安定化と為替レートの過度な変動を回避するカギとなるだろう、との考えを示した。日銀の金融政策決定会合を巡っては、１０月は政策現状維持がコンセンサスとなっている。株式市場では次回会合以降の利上げの可能性が意識され、金利上昇が事業環境にネガティブな影響をもたらすとの連想で不動産株への売り圧力が高まった。東京証券取引所は２９日、住友商事とＳＣＳＫの株式売買を同日午後２時９分から停止すると発表した。理由は「公開買付に関する報道の真偽等の確認のため」。日本経済新聞電子版は２９日、「住友商事が５０．６％を出資するシステム開発企業のＳＣＳＫを完全子会社にする方針を固めた」と報じた。ＴＯＢなどを通じて、全株式の取得を目指すとしている。東京ガスは一時７％高の５７５６円まで上昇した。この日午後１時３０分ごろ、２６年３月期連結業績予想について売上高を２兆７５４０億円から２兆８３９０億円（前期比７．７％増）へ、営業利益を１５９０億円から１６６０億円（同２４．７％増）へ上方修正すると発表した。配当予想も８０円から１００円（前期８０円）に増額した。あわせて、従来の総還元性向に基づく株主還元方針を見直し、中期のキャッシュフロー計画の中で成長投資と株主還元に柔軟に配分する方針を明らかにした。これに基づき、同時に公表した中期経営計画（２０２６～２８年度）において２０００億円以上の株主還元と２８年度に向けた１４０円までの増配を掲げた。なお、あわせて取得上限２０００万株（発行済み株数の５．４％）、または８００億円とする自社株買いの実施を発表した。期間は１１月１０日～来年３月３１日。これら発表が好感され買いを集めたものの、その後は利益確定売りに押される展開となった。●ストップ高銘柄アウンコンサルティング484円 +80 円 (+19.8％) ストップ高 本日終値ジェネレーションパス672円 +100 円 (+17.5％) ストップ高 本日終値など、5銘柄●ストップ安銘柄なし
main_content_en: INES plunged. After the close of trading on the 28th, the consolidated financial forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised downwards, with sales from 43 billion yen to 39 billion yen (down 3.9% year-on-year), operating profit from 4 billion yen to 1.4 billion yen (down 60.4% year-on-year), and net profit from 2.8 billion yen to 1 billion yen (down 59.0% year-on-year). The dividend forecast was also lowered from 60 yen per year (interim/year-end undecided) to 55 yen per year (25 yen interim, 30 yen year-end), which was met with disfavor. The reason for the decrease in sales is a review of the transition method for standardizing local government information systems. Additionally, the deterioration of the cost ratio for this project is also expected to have an impact. The interim financial results for September, announced simultaneously, showed sales of 16.486 billion yen (down 11.5% year-on-year), an operating loss of 920 million yen (compared to a profit of 876 million yen in the same period last year), and a net loss of 601 million yen (compared to a profit of 537 million yen in the same period last year). Hokuetsu Corporation continued its sharp decline. After the close of trading on the 28th, it announced a downward revision to its consolidated financial forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with sales from 303 billion yen to 292 billion yen (down 4.5% year-on-year) and operating profit from 18 billion yen to 8 billion yen (down 59.4% year-on-year). The reasons are a decrease in pulp sales volume and a decline in sales prices in overseas markets, as well as a decrease in sales volume of paper and paperboard. The depreciation of the yen is also expected to have an impact. Selling pressure, disliking these factors, is dominant. Digital Holdings fell sharply. After the close of trading on the 28th, it announced the introduction of an emergency-type acquisition defense policy regarding the tender offer (TOB) it is receiving from investment firm Silvercape Investments. The company stated that the conditions set for Silvercape's TOB are opaque regarding whether it will lead to a squeeze-out, and there is a risk that general shareholders may be left behind as minority shareholders. It is highly likely that "de facto pressure (coercion)" to tender shares in the TOB will arise, and this policy was introduced to avoid this. Regarding the ongoing TOB from Hakuhodo DY Holdings, the company maintains its supportive opinion and neutral opinion on tendering shares. Fudo Tetra fell sharply. Around 2:45 PM on this day, it announced that new matters requiring investigation and confirmation arose during the course of the investigation by the "Special Committee on Preventing Recurrence of Fictitious Orders, etc.," which was expected to conclude its activities by late October. It received a report from the investigation committee that it would be impossible to complete the investigation within October. Consequently, one new committee member will be added to the current three members. The investigation is currently scheduled to conclude (report received) in late November. Selling pressure, disliking the uncertainty about the future, is emerging. PCA continued its sharp decline. After the close of trading on the 28th, it announced a downward revision to its consolidated financial forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with sales from 17.689 billion yen to 17.539 billion yen (up 8.0% year-on-year) and operating profit from 2.824 billion yen to 2.543 billion yen (down 3.6% year-on-year). This is because the company failed to achieve its first-half targets for new contract acquisitions, such as PCA Cloud. This became a selling factor. Komatsu's decline widened in the afternoon session. Around 2:30 PM, it announced an upward revision to its consolidated financial forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with sales from 3.745 trillion yen to 3.888 trillion yen (down 5.3% year-on-year), operating profit from 478 billion yen to 500 billion yen (down 23.9% year-on-year), and net profit from 309 billion yen to 320 billion yen (down 27.2% year-on-year). However, it seems to have been sold off due to a sense of "all good news priced in." The revision incorporated the yen's depreciation exceeding expectations, the impact of US tariffs, and the latest market outlook. It also incorporated a revision of the assumed exchange rates for the second half: 140.0 yen to the dollar (previous full-year average forecast 135.0 yen), 163.0 yen to the euro (previous 150.0 yen), and 91.0 yen to the Australian dollar (previous 84.0 yen). The consolidated interim financial results for September, announced simultaneously, showed a decrease in both revenue and profit: sales of 1.8915 trillion yen (down 3.9% year-on-year), operating profit of 277.061 billion yen (down 8.7% year-on-year), and net profit of 175.701 billion yen (down 12.9% year-on-year). In the core construction machinery and vehicles segment, despite efforts to improve sales prices, the impact of the yen's appreciation compared to the same period last year and a decrease in sales volume in Asia had an effect. Mitsui Fudosan, Mitsubishi Estate, and Sumitomo Realty & Development traded weakly. While the Nikkei 225 index rose by over 1,000 yen from the previous day, the real estate sector index on the Tokyo Stock Exchange fell by over 2%. On this day, US Treasury Secretary Yellen, through a post on social media, expressed her view that the Japanese government's willingness to give the Bank of Japan room for monetary policy would be key to stabilizing inflation expectations and avoiding excessive exchange rate volatility. Regarding the Bank of Japan's Monetary Policy Meeting, the consensus for October is to maintain the current policy. In the stock market, the possibility of an interest rate hike after the next meeting is being considered, and selling pressure on real estate stocks increased due to the association that rising interest rates would have a negative impact on the business environment. The Tokyo Stock Exchange announced on the 29th that trading of shares in Sumitomo Corporation and SCSK would be suspended from 2:09 PM on the same day. The reason is "to confirm the veracity of reports regarding a tender offer." The Nikkei Shimbun Digital Edition reported on the 29th that "Sumitomo Corporation has decided to make SCSK, a system development company in which it holds a 50.6% stake, a wholly owned subsidiary." It aims to acquire all shares through a TOB or other means. Tokyo Gas temporarily rose 7% to 5,756 yen. Around 1:30 PM on this day, it announced an upward revision to its consolidated financial forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with sales from 2.754 trillion yen to 2.839 trillion yen (up 7.7% year-on-year) and operating profit from 159 billion yen to 166 billion yen (up 24.7% year-on-year). The dividend forecast was also increased from 80 yen to 100 yen (80 yen in the previous fiscal year). Additionally, it announced a review of its shareholder return policy based on the conventional total return ratio, revealing a policy to flexibly allocate cash flow to growth investments and shareholder returns within its medium-term cash flow plan. Based on this, its simultaneously announced medium-term management plan (FY2026-2028) outlined shareholder returns of 200 billion yen or more and a dividend increase to 140 yen by FY2028. Furthermore, it announced a share buyback of up to 20 million shares (5.4% of outstanding shares) or 80 billion yen. The period is from November 10 to March 31 next year. Although these announcements were well-received and attracted buying, profit-taking sales subsequently pushed the stock down. Stocks hitting daily limit high: AUN Consulting 484 yen +80 yen (+19.8%) daily limit high, closing price today; Generation Pass 672 yen +100 yen (+17.5%) daily limit high, closing price today; and 5 other stocks. Stocks hitting daily limit low: None.

headline: Nikkei Average up by about 1,000 yen; Advantest, SoftBank G, Lasertec among top trading values
description: ADVANTEST CORP was identified as one of the top trading value stocks on the Prime Market slightly past 2:00 PM on the 29th. The company was among the most actively traded by value during the afternoon session.
key_takeaways: The Nikkei Stock Average increased by approximately 1,000 yen, reaching around 51,220 yen.;The market maintained high trading levels in the afternoon session on the 29th.;The yen-dollar exchange rate was stable at approximately 152 yen to the dollar.;Top trading value stocks included Advantest, SoftBank G, Lasertec, Kioxia, and Fujikura.;Top volume stocks included JDI, NTT, Nidec, TEPCO HD, and Sony FG.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article provides a real-time snapshot of overall market performance and lists top-traded stocks, including ADVANTEST CORP, at a specific time during the trading day. It does not announce any new corporate events, releases, or developments specific to ADVANTEST CORP, but rather summarizes its current market activity as part of a broader market update.
source: ウエルスアドバイザー
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a general market summary that mentions Advantest as one of several companies with high trading value on a particular day. It does not provide any specific company-related news, events, or developments (such as earnings, new products, partnerships, or management changes) that would constitute actionable intelligence for a trader. Its inclusion is merely descriptive of market activity, not indicative of a fundamental change or event within the company.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation: The article covers multiple companies and market trends, not solely focused on Advantest.;Lack of company-specific news: No new product launches, financial results, strategic partnerships, or other specific events related to Advantest are reported.;Descriptive, not causative: It merely states Advantest was a 'top trading value stock' without providing any underlying reason or new information about the company itself.;No actionable intelligence: The information provided does not offer a basis for a trading decision beyond observing past market activity.

The afternoon session began trading near the closing price of the morning session, and has continued to trade at high levels since then. The exchange rate is consolidating around 152 yen to the dollar. headline: Advantest, TOENEC, Kinden, etc. / Today's Featured Individual Stocks
description: ADVANTEST CORP announced strong Q2 operating profit growth of 70.7% and significantly raised its full-year forecast to 374 billion yen, exceeding market consensus. This positive outlook is supported by an updated tester market outlook and a new share buyback program of up to 150 billion yen.
key_takeaways: Advantest, Kinden, and TOENEC reported strong financial results, leading to significant stock price surges, upward revisions of forecasts, and increased dividends.;Hitachi Construction Machinery and Tokuyama also showed improved performance and/or upward revisions, contributing to positive stock movements.;INES, Hokuetsu Corp., and Shimano experienced declines or downward revisions in their earnings forecasts, resulting in negative stock reactions.;Factors influencing performance include the weaker yen, cost reduction efforts, construction progress, and varying market conditions for specific products.;Advantest's strong performance was further supported by an updated medium-term management plan and a substantial share buyback program.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports that ADVANTEST CORP announced its Q2 results, revised its full-year forecast upwards, updated its mid-term management plan targets, and announced a share buyback 'yesterday'. These are all new, specific events and fresh guidance likely to impact the market immediately.
news_worthy_reasoning: Despite being a multi-company article, it provides highly specific and actionable intelligence for ADVANTEST CORP. The article highlights a substantial profit increase, an announced share buyback program, and an updated medium-term management plan, all of which are concrete, recent developments with direct implications for the stock price.
news_worthy_key_factors: Substantial profit increase reported;Announcement of a share buyback program;Updated medium-term management plan;Positive stock performance linked to these announcements
actionable_intelligence: Traders could consider a long position or adjust existing positions based on the positive financial results, share buyback, and strategic outlook, anticipating a positive impact on stock price.
original_headline: アドバンテス、トーエネック、きんでんなど／本日の注目個別銘柄
main_content: < 6305 > 日立建機 5168 +138 大幅反発。前日に第2四半期の決算を発表、7-9月期営業利益は456億円で前年同期比 20.2％増となり、第1四半期の同32.7％減から急改善している。通期予想も従来の12 80億円から1300億円、前期比16.0％減に上方修正、ほぼコンセンサス水準にまで引 き上げている。構造改革費用は上振れるようだが、為替の円安効果や補償金の計 上、関税の価格転嫁などを織り込んでいるもよう。なお、27年4月からの社名変更も 発表している。< 4043 > トクヤマ 3872 +188 大幅反発。本日上半期の決算を発表している。営業利益は192億円で前年同期比37. 2％増となり、第1四半期の同5.1％増から増益率は大幅に拡大している。据え置きの 通期予想415億円、前期比38.5％増に対しても順調な進捗となっている。塩ビ関連製 品の海外市況下落などで売上高は減収となっているが、製造コストの改善が進んだ ことなどから収益率は高まる方向のようだ。セグメントの別では電子先端材料部門 が好調。< 9742 > アイネス 1671 -289 大幅続落。前日に上半期の決算を発表、営業損益は9.2億円の赤字となり、前年同期 比では18億円の損益悪化となっている。通期営業利益予想は従来の40億円から14億 円、前期比60.4％減にまで下方修正。年間配当金も60円計画から55円に引き下げ。 地方公共団体情報システムの標準化対応の移行方法の見直しによる売上高の下振 れ、原価率の悪化などが背景となっているようだ。< 3865 > 北越コーポ 836 -127 大幅続落。前日に業績予想の下方修正を発表している。上半期営業利益は従来予想 の80億円から20億円、前年同期比77.8％減に、通期では180億円から80億円、前期比 59.4％減にそれぞれ引き下げ。海外市場におけるパルプ販売数量の減少や販売価格 の下落、洋紙・板紙の販売数量減少、円安の進行などが下方修正の背景に。第1四半 期は営業増益決算決算であったため、大幅下方修正にはネガティブなインパクト。< 1969 > 高砂熱 4588 +312 大幅反発。前日に業績予想の上方修正を発表している。営業利益は従来予想の360億 円から433億円、前期比33.6％増にまで引き上げ。効率的な施工体制等による工事進 捗とともに、収益性の改善を見込んでいるもよう。また、受注高も従来予想の4300 億円から4580億円、前期比10.1％増にまで引き上げ。さらに、期末配当金も従来計 画の44円から62円に引き上げ、前期比では22円の増配となる。< 4684 > オービック 4693 -260 大幅続落。前日に上半期の決算を発表している。営業利益は437億円で前年同期比1 3.0％増、7-9月期も同11.0％増と2ケタ増基調を継続する形になっている。システム サポート、システムインテグレーションとも順調に売り上げを拡大させている。通 期予想は862億円、前期比10.0％増を据え置き。セクター内でも業績の安定性は強 く、なおかつ、直近では業績観測報道も伝わっていたためにサプライズは限定的。 短期的な出尽くし感が先行のようだ。< 7309 > シマノ 16250 -1300 大幅反落。前日に第3四半期の決算を発表、7-9月期営業利益は84億円で前年同期比5 7.1％減となり、会社計画線とは見られるものの、市場予想は15億円ほど下振れてい る。自転車部品、釣具ともにセグメント減益となっている。通期予想の460億円、前 期比29.3％減益は据え置き、第4四半期も減収減益の継続が見込まれている。想定は されていたものの、厳しい決算状況が確認されたことからネガティブな反応が先 行。< 1944 > きんでん 6158 +1000 ストップ高。前日に上半期の決算を発表、営業利益は319億円で前年同期比2.5倍と 大幅増益、通期予想は従来の670億円から810億円、前期比32.8％増に上方修正して いる。通期コンセンサスは750億円レベルであったとみられる。上半期受注高も、市 場想定を大きく上回る水準に。年間配当金も従来計画の100円から120円に引き上 げ。同社やトーエネックなどの相次ぐ上方修正を受けて、関電工など他の電力設備 装置関連にも連想買い向かう。< 1946 > トーエネック 1771 +300 ストップ高。前日に上半期の決算を発表、営業利益は85.7億円で前年同期比32.5％ 増となり、従来予想の78億円を上振れる着地に。つれて、通期予想は従来の180億円 から200億円、前期比24.7％増に上方修正している。配電線工事の工事量増加に加え て、屋内線工事の進捗も好調に推移しているようだ。また、配当方針の変更を発 表、配当性向をこれまでの30％以上から40％目安に引き上げ、年間配当金も52円か ら65円に引き上げへ。< 6857 > アドバンテス 22120 +4000 ストップ高。前日に第2四半期の決算を発表、7-9月期営業利益は1085億円で前年同 期比70.7％増となり、市場予想を小幅に上振れたとみられる。一方、通期予想は従 来の3000億円から3740億円、前期比63.9％増に上方修正。3300億円程度のコンセン サスを大幅に上振れ。テスタ市場見通しのアップデートに伴うものとなっている。 中期経営計画の目標値上方修正、上限1500億円の自社株買い発表なども買い材料に つながっている。
main_content_en: < 6305 > Hitachi Construction Machinery 5168 +138 Strong rebound. The company announced its second-quarter financial results yesterday, with operating profit for the July-September quarter at 45.6 billion yen, a 20.2% increase year-on-year, showing a sharp improvement from the 32.7% decrease in the first quarter. The full-year forecast was also revised upward from the previous 128 billion yen to 130 billion yen, a 16.0% decrease year-on-year, raising it to almost the consensus level. Although structural reform costs are expected to be higher, the revision seems to incorporate the effects of the weaker yen, recognition of compensation, and passing on tariff costs. Additionally, a company name change starting April 2027 was announced. < 4043 > Tokuyama 3872 +188 Strong rebound. The company announced its first-half financial results today. Operating profit was 19.2 billion yen, a 37.2% increase year-on-year, with the profit growth rate significantly expanding from the 5.1% increase in the first quarter. Progress is steady towards the unchanged full-year forecast of 41.5 billion yen, a 38.5% increase year-on-year. Although sales decreased due to factors such as a decline in overseas market conditions for PVC-related products, profitability seems to be improving due to progress in manufacturing cost reduction. By segment, the advanced electronic materials division performed well. < 9742 > INES 1671 -289 Significant continued decline. The company announced its first-half financial results yesterday, with operating income/loss resulting in a 920 million yen deficit, a deterioration of 1.8 billion yen year-on-year. The full-year operating profit forecast was revised downward from the previous 4 billion yen to 1.4 billion yen, a 60.4% decrease year-on-year. The annual dividend was also reduced from the planned 60 yen to 55 yen. Lower-than-expected sales due to a review of the migration method for standardization of local government information systems and a worsening cost of sales ratio seem to be the background. < 3865 > Hokuetsu Corp. 836 -127 Significant continued decline. The company announced a downward revision to its earnings forecast yesterday. First-half operating profit was reduced from the previous forecast of 8 billion yen to 2 billion yen, a 77.8% decrease year-on-year, and the full-year forecast was reduced from 18 billion yen to 8 billion yen, a 59.4% decrease year-on-year, respectively. A decrease in pulp sales volume and decline in selling prices in overseas markets, a decrease in sales volume of paper and paperboard, and the progression of the weaker yen are behind the downward revision. Since the first quarter results showed an increase in operating profit, the significant downward revision has a negative impact. < 1969 > Takasago Thermal Engineering 4588 +312 Strong rebound. The company announced an upward revision to its earnings forecast yesterday. Operating profit was raised from the previous forecast of 36 billion yen to 43.3 billion yen, a 33.6% increase year-on-year. Along with construction progress due to efficient construction systems, etc., profitability is expected to improve. Also, the order backlog was raised from the previous forecast of 430 billion yen to 458 billion yen, a 10.1% increase year-on-year. Furthermore, the year-end dividend was raised from the previous plan of 44 yen to 62 yen, an increase of 22 yen year-on-year. < 4684 > OBIC 4693 -260 Significant continued decline. The company announced its first-half financial results yesterday. Operating profit was 43.7 billion yen, a 13.0% increase year-on-year, and the July-September quarter also saw an 11.0% increase, continuing a double-digit growth trend. Both system support and system integration are steadily expanding sales. The full-year forecast remains unchanged at 86.2 billion yen, a 10.0% increase year-on-year. Earnings stability is strong even within the sector, and since recent reports had already indicated strong performance, the surprise was limited. A short-term sense of having exhausted all positive news seems to be prevailing. < 7309 > Shimano 16250 -1300 Significant decline. The company announced its third-quarter financial results yesterday, with operating profit for the July-September quarter at 8.4 billion yen, a 57.1% decrease year-on-year. Although it is seen as in line with the company's plan, market expectations were undershot by about 1.5 billion yen. Both bicycle components and fishing tackle saw a decrease in segment profit. The full-year forecast of 46 billion yen, a 29.3% decrease year-on-year, remains unchanged, and a continuation of declining revenue and profit is expected for Q4. Although it was anticipated, negative reactions are prevailing as the severe financial results were confirmed. < 1944 > Kinden 6158 +1000 Limit up. The company announced its first-half financial results yesterday, with operating profit at 31.9 billion yen, a significant increase of 2.5 times year-on-year. The full-year forecast was revised upward from the previous 67 billion yen to 81 billion yen, a 32.8% increase year-on-year. The full-year consensus was estimated to be around 75 billion yen. The first-half order backlog also reached a level significantly exceeding market expectations. The annual dividend was also raised from the previous plan of 100 yen to 120 yen. Following successive upward revisions by the company and TOENEC, etc., associative buying is also directed towards other power equipment-related companies such as Kandenko. < 1946 > TOENEC 1771 +300 Limit up. The company announced its first-half financial results yesterday, with operating profit at 8.57 billion yen, a 32.5% increase year-on-year, exceeding the previous forecast of 7.8 billion yen. Consequently, the full-year forecast was revised upward from the previous 18 billion yen to 20 billion yen, a 24.7% increase year-on-year. In addition to an increase in the volume of power distribution line construction, progress in indoor wiring construction also seems to be strong. Also, the company announced a change in dividend policy, raising the dividend payout ratio from the previous 30% or more to a target of 40%, and increasing the annual dividend from 52 yen to 65 yen. < 6857 > Advantest 22120 +4000 Limit up. The company announced its second-quarter financial results yesterday, with operating profit for the July-September quarter at 108.5 billion yen, a 70.7% increase year-on-year, and is believed to have slightly exceeded market expectations. Meanwhile, the full-year forecast was revised upward from the previous 300 billion yen to 374 billion yen, a 63.9% increase year-on-year, significantly exceeding the consensus of around 330 billion yen. This is due to an update in the tester market outlook. An upward revision of target values in the medium-term management plan and the announcement of a share buyback program up to 150 billion yen are also contributing to buying factors.

headline: Komatsu continues to fall, profit misses average market forecast despite upward revision of full-year earnings outlook
description: KOMATSU LTD revised its consolidated earnings forecast for FY2026 upward, but the new operating profit projection of 500.0 billion yen fell short of the average market forecast, leading to disappointment and a stock price decline. The revision reflects yen depreciation, U.S. tariffs, and the latest market outlook.
key_takeaways: Komatsu revised its full-year earnings forecast upward for the fiscal year ending March 2026, increasing net sales to 3,888.0 billion yen and operating profit to 500.0 billion yen.;Despite the revision, the new operating profit forecast of 500.0 billion yen fell short of the average market forecast of approximately 548.0 billion yen, leading to a stock price decline.;The upward revision was attributed to the yen's depreciation, the impact of U.S. tariffs, and an updated market outlook, with assumed exchange rates of 1 dollar = 140 yen and 1 euro = 163 yen.;Komatsu's stock fell by 291 yen to 5,498 yen at one point, and closed at 5,550 yen, down 239 yen from the previous day.;For the cumulative second quarter (April-September 2025), net sales were 1,891.587 billion yen (down 3.9% year-on-year) and operating profit was 277.061 billion yen (down 8.7% year-on-year).
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports on a newly announced earnings forecast revision for KOMATSU LTD that occurred 'on the 29th' at 2:30 PM. It details the updated guidance and the immediate negative market reaction, indicating new information hitting the market.
source: ウエルスアドバイザー
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports on Komatsu's upward revision of its full-year earnings forecast, which, despite being an increase, still fell short of average market expectations. This discrepancy led to a significant drop in the company's stock price on the day of the announcement, providing clear, actionable intelligence for traders regarding immediate market reaction to financial performance updates.
news_worthy_key_factors: Upward revision of full-year earnings forecast (Net Sales and Operating Profit);Revised operating profit forecast missed average market expectations;Immediate and significant negative stock price reaction following the announcement;Specific financial figures and reasons for the revision are provided
actionable_intelligence: Traders could have reacted to the news of the missed market expectation by selling or shorting the stock, anticipating further downward pressure, or by adjusting their positions based on the new financial outlook and market sentiment.
original_headline: コマツが続落、通期業績予想を上方修正も利益が市場予想平均に届かず
main_content: コマツが続落、２９１円安の５４９８円を付けた。２９日の午後２時３０分、２６年３期の連結業績予想（米国会計基準）を上方修正したが、利益が市場予想の平均に届かず、嫌気された。２６年３期の業績予想では、売上高を３兆７４５０億円から３兆８８８０億円（前期比５．３％減）に、営業利益を４７８０億円から５０００億円（同２３．９％減）に引き上げた。前提となる為替レートは、１ドル＝１４０円、１ユーロ＝１６３円、１豪ドル＝９１．０円に見直した。為替レートが想定よりも円安で推移していたことや、米国関税による影響額および最新の市場見通しを反映した。営業利益の市場予想平均は５４８０億円程度だった。第２四半期累計（２５年４－９月）の決算は、売上高が１兆８９１５億８７００万円（前年同期比３．９％減）、営業利益が２７７０億６１００万円（同８，７％減）だった。２９日の終値は、前日比２３９円安の５５５０円。提供：ウエルスアドバイザー社
main_content_en: Komatsu continued to fall, hitting 5,498 yen, down 291 yen. At 2:30 PM on the 29th, Komatsu revised upward its consolidated earnings forecast (U.S. GAAP) for the fiscal year ending March 2026, but its profit fell short of the average market forecast, leading to disappointment. In the earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026, net sales were raised from 3,745.0 billion yen to 3,888.0 billion yen (down 5.3% year-on-year), and operating profit was raised from 478.0 billion yen to 500.0 billion yen (down 23.9% year-on-year). The assumed exchange rates were revised to 1 dollar = 140 yen, 1 euro = 163 yen, and 1 Australian dollar = 91.0 yen. This revision reflects the yen's depreciation against expectations, the impact of U.S. tariffs, and the latest market outlook. The average market forecast for operating profit was approximately 548.0 billion yen. For the cumulative second quarter (April-September 2025), net sales were 1,891.587 billion yen (down 3.9% year-on-year), and operating profit was 277.061 billion yen (down 8.7% year-on-year). The closing price on the 29th was 5,550 yen, down 239 yen from the previous day. Provided by Wealth Advisor Inc.

headline: Fine Sinter achieves an unbroken streak of 8 consecutive rises, with its technical capabilities in electric vehicle-related parts for Toyota-affiliated companies being evaluated and expectations for upward earnings revision
description: TOYOTA MOTOR CORP's largest shareholder, Fine Sinter, is seeing strong performance and earnings contributions from its reactor cores for Toyota's hybrid vehicle inverter components. This highlights the success of a key supplier in the EV-related parts sector.
key_takeaways: Fine Sinter's stock has achieved an unbroken streak of 8 consecutive rises, renewing its year-to-date high.;The company's technical capabilities in electric vehicle-related parts, specifically reactor cores for Toyota's hybrid vehicle inverter components, are driving earnings.;Fine Sinter forecasts an operating profit of 900 million yen for the fiscal year ending March 2026, with high probability of a significant upward revision due to improving profit margins.;Despite high technology, the company's PBR is remarkably low, below 0.5x, suggesting a strong potential for valuation correction.;Toyota Motor is Fine Sinter's largest shareholder, and automotive applications constitute the majority of its business.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article's primary focus is on Fine Sinter (5994), detailing its stock performance and financial outlook. While TOYOTA MOTOR CORP is mentioned as a major shareholder and customer, the article does not announce any new events, releases, or developments directly from or about TOYOTA MOTOR CORP itself, making it a background or interpretive piece rather than breaking news for the target company.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article primarily focuses on the stock performance and earnings forecast of Fine Sinter, a supplier and affiliate of Toyota. While Fine Sinter's success is linked to its supply of parts for Toyota's hybrid vehicles, the article does not contain specific, direct, or new actionable intelligence regarding Toyota Motor Corp's own operations, financials, or strategic developments that would directly impact its stock price in the near term. The information is indirect and primarily concerns the supplier's performance.
news_worthy_key_factors: Article primarily focuses on Fine Sinter, not Toyota Motor Corp.;Information about Toyota is indirect (supplier's success related to Toyota's products).;No specific new events or financial data directly pertaining to Toyota Motor Corp.;Does not provide direct actionable intelligence for trading TM.
original_headline: ファインシンが破竹の８連騰、トヨタ系で電動関連部品の技術力評価と収益上振れ期待◇
main_content: ファインシンター<5994>が地合い悪に抗し、一時６％を超える大幅高で年初来高値更新。きょうで８連騰と破竹の勢いをみせている。トヨタ自動車<7203>を筆頭株主とする粉末冶金部品メーカーで現状は自動車向けが大部分を占めている。駆動系以外に電動関連部品で優位性を発揮しており、そのなかトヨタ向けハイブリッド車用インバーター部品のリアクトルコアが好調で収益に貢献。２６年３月期は営業利益段階で前期比３２％増の９億円を見込んでいるが、製品価格引き上げの動きなどで利益率改善が急であり、大幅増額の公算が大きい。また、高技術を売りものとする有配企業にもかかわらず、ＰＢＲが際立って低く、時価換算で依然として０．５倍未満と解散価値の半値以下の水準にあることで、純粋な水準訂正期待も買い人気を助長している。
main_content_en: Fine Sinter <5994> defied the weak market sentiment, temporarily surging over 6% to renew its year-to-date high. Today marks its eighth consecutive day of gains, showing an unbroken momentum. It is a powder metallurgy parts manufacturer with Toyota Motor <7203> as its largest shareholder, and currently, automotive applications account for the majority of its business. Beyond powertrain components, it demonstrates superiority in electric vehicle-related parts, with reactor cores for Toyota's hybrid vehicle inverter components performing strongly and contributing to earnings. For the fiscal year ending March 2026, the company forecasts an operating profit of 900 million yen, a 32% increase from the previous period. However, with rapid improvements in profit margins due to product price increases and other factors, there is a high probability of a significant upward revision. Furthermore, despite being a dividend-paying company boasting high technology, its PBR (Price-to-Book Ratio) is remarkably low, still below 0.5x in market value terms, which is less than half of its liquidation value. This pure expectation for a valuation correction is also fueling buying interest.

headline: Advantest Announces Share Buyback
description: ADVANTEST CORP announced a decision regarding matters related to the acquisition of its treasury stock. This flash news report was released by Advantest itself.
key_takeaways: Advantest has decided to acquire its own treasury stock.;This announcement indicates a share buyback program.;The news was reported by Kabutan News (minkabu PRESS).
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly states it is 'フラッシュニュース' (flash news) and announces a '自己株式の取得に係る事項の決定' (decision regarding the acquisition of treasury stock). This indicates a new corporate action announcement, which is fresh, market-moving information.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports a direct announcement from Advantest regarding a share buyback program. Share buybacks are a significant corporate action that typically signals management confidence, reduces the number of outstanding shares, and can lead to an increase in earnings per share and stock price, thus providing actionable intelligence for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: Announcement of a share buyback program;Direct corporate action by Advantest;Potential positive impact on shareholder value and stock price;Timely and specific event
actionable_intelligence: Traders might consider buying or holding Advantest stock, anticipating a positive market reaction due to the share buyback, which typically boosts EPS and signals management's confidence in the company's valuation.
original_headline: アドテスト、自社株買いの実施を発表
main_content: アドバンテスト<6857>のフラッシュニュースです。自己株式の取得に係る事項の決定に関するお知らせ 株探ニュース（minkabu PRESS）
main_content_en: This is a flash news report from Advantest<6857>. Announcement Regarding the Decision on Matters Related to the Acquisition of Treasury Stock. Kabutan News (minkabu PRESS)

headline: SoftBank Group, Advantest Show Balanced Strength and Weakness; Further Nikkei Average Upside Depends on Movements of Both Stocks
description: ADVANTEST CORP is currently experiencing profit-taking pressure despite a tailwind from record highs in US tech and semiconductor indices. Its stock movements, alongside SoftBank Group, are crucial for the Nikkei Stock Average's future upside, given their combined significant weighting.
key_takeaways: SoftBank Group and Advantest's stock movements are closely tied to US AI and semiconductor-related stocks.;Both companies experienced a tailwind from record-high Nasdaq Composite and Philadelphia Semiconductor (SOX) indices but are now facing profit-taking.;SoftBank Group and Advantest collectively account for approximately 20% of the Nikkei Average's weighting.;The future upside potential of the Nikkei Average, particularly breaking the 50,000 yen mark, largely depends on the performance of these two stocks.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article describes current market movements and sentiment for ADVANTEST CORP, linking them to yesterday's US market performance and general market trends. It does not announce any new corporate events, releases, or developments specific to ADVANTEST CORP, but rather interprets existing information and market dynamics.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company market analysis, discussing both SoftBank Group and Advantest. It lacks specific, actionable news or events directly related to Advantest's operations, financials, or strategic developments. The content focuses on general market trends, correlations with US tech stocks, and their combined impact on the Nikkei Average, rather than company-specific catalysts for Advantest.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company focus (SoftBank Group and Advantest);Absence of specific, company-focused events for Advantest;General market commentary (correlation with US tech, profit-taking);Focus on macro market impact (Nikkei Average weighting) rather than Advantest's internal developments
original_headline: ソフトバンクＧ、アドテストは強弱拮抗、日経平均一段の上値追いは両銘柄の値動き次第に◇
main_content: ソフトバンクグループ<9984>が売り買い交錯のなかも徐々に買い優勢の展開となっているほか、アドバンテスト<6857>はやや売り優勢ながら１万８０００円台近辺で強弱拮抗の様相を示している。いずれも米国株市場のＡＩ・半導体関連の値動きに連動しやすく、前日の米国株市場でハイテク株比率の高いナスダック総合株価指数や半導体銘柄で構成されるフィラデルフィア半導体株指数（ＳＯＸ指数）が最高値街道を走っていることは追い風材料として意識される。一方、前日の反動で足もと利食い圧力にも晒されている。また、ソフトバンクＧとアドテストの２銘柄は日経平均株価への影響度で突出しており、日経平均構成比率は２銘柄合計で約２０％に達している。したがって、この２銘柄が日経平均５万円大台突入の立役者といえるが、今後更なる上値追いが見込めるかどうかも両銘柄の株価動向に委ねられている部分が大きい。
main_content_en: SoftBank Group <9984> is gradually seeing buying dominance despite mixed buying and selling, while Advantest <6857> is showing a balanced strength and weakness around the 18,000 yen level, despite a slight selling dominance. Both stocks tend to correlate with the movements of AI and semiconductor-related stocks in the US market. The fact that the Nasdaq Composite Index, which has a high proportion of tech stocks, and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOX Index), composed of semiconductor stocks, were on a record-high streak in the US stock market the previous day is seen as a tailwind. On the other hand, they are currently exposed to profit-taking pressure due to a reaction from the previous day's movements. Furthermore, SoftBank G and Advantest are prominent in their impact on the Nikkei Stock Average, with their combined weighting in the Nikkei Average reaching approximately 20%. Therefore, these two stocks can be said to be the key players in the Nikkei Average breaking through the 50,000 yen mark. However, whether further upside can be expected in the future largely depends on the stock price movements of these two companies.

headline: [Analyst Forecast] Komatsu Ltd., FY2026 March Ordinary Income Forecast. Up 0.1% from previous week.
description: KOMATSU LTD's ordinary income forecast consensus increased by 0.1% to 521,986 million yen. This revised consensus is considered bullish compared to the company's own forecast of 442,000 million yen.
key_takeaways: Komatsu Ltd.'s ordinary income forecast consensus for FY2026 March increased by 0.1% week-over-week.;The new consensus forecast stands at 521,986 million yen, up from 521,483 million yen.;The analyst consensus forecast is significantly more bullish than Komatsu's internal forecast of 442,000 million yen.;The overall rating consensus for Komatsu remains unchanged at 3.6.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports a minor 0.1% increase in Komatsu's consensus profit forecast compared to the previous week's value. This is an update on an evolving metric, not a new, immediate event or announcement from the company itself, and lacks language indicating a breaking development.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article provides an updated analyst consensus for Komatsu's FY2026 ordinary income, which is notably bullish compared to the company's own forecast and has seen a slight week-over-week increase. This indicates positive sentiment from analysts regarding future financial performance, offering actionable intelligence for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: Bullish analyst consensus significantly above company's own forecast;Week-over-week increase in the consensus forecast (0.1%);Focus on future financial performance (FY2026 March);Specific financial figures provided for substantiation
actionable_intelligence: Traders could interpret the consistently bullish and slightly increasing analyst consensus as a positive indicator for Komatsu's future earnings, potentially influencing a decision to buy or hold the stock, especially if they believe the market will eventually price in the higher analyst expectations.
original_headline: 【アナリスト予想】小松製作所、26年3月期経常予想。対前週0.1%上昇。
main_content: 現在値 ＤＭＧ森精 2,578.5 -104 コマツ 4,959 -51 日立建機 4,571 -20 ＴＨＫ 4,075 -107 ファナック 5,708 -367 小松製作所 < 6301 > の経常利益予想コンセンサスは、前週値の521,483百万円から0.1%上昇し、521,986百万円となった。会社予想値442,000百万円と比較すると、現在のコンセンサス予想は強気の見方となっている。因みにレーティングコンセンサスは3.6で変わらずのまま。
main_content_en: Current Price: DMG Mori Seiki 2,578.5 -104, Komatsu 4,959 -51, Hitachi Construction Machinery 4,571 -20, THK 4,075 -107, FANUC 5,708 -367. The ordinary income forecast consensus for Komatsu Ltd. <6301> increased by 0.1% from the previous week's value of 521,483 million yen to 521,986 million yen. Compared to the company's forecast of 442,000 million yen, the current consensus forecast is bullish. Incidentally, the rating consensus remains unchanged at 3.6.

headline: Earnings Revisions (After Market Close) - Advantest, Kinden, Nippon Sharyo, Hitachi Construction Machinery, etc.

key_takeaways: A wide range of Japanese companies have revised their earnings forecasts, impacting various income metrics like net income, ordinary income, and operating income.;WOWOW<4839> reported the most dramatic positive revision, with its interim net income forecast increasing by 1300%.;Major companies like Advantest<6857>, Kinden<1944>, and Nippon Sharyo<7102> also announced positive revisions to their ordinary or net income, ranging from 24% to 25%.;Several companies, including INES<9742>, Hokuetsu Corporation<3865>, and Japan Casting & Forging Corp.<5609>, experienced substantial negative revisions, with some income forecasts dropping by over 60%.;The revisions primarily pertain to fiscal periods ending in March, May, or December.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article presents a list of companies with revised financial forecasts, including a 25% increase in the ordinary profit forecast for ADVANTEST CORP. This constitutes new financial guidance or a revised outlook, which is considered new, market-moving information.

news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company consolidation of earnings revisions, covering numerous Japanese companies. While it mentions a positive earnings revision for Advantest, the company is not the primary focus, and the information is diluted by a large volume of other company news, both positive and negative. This format makes it 'too noisy' and not 'company-focused' enough to be considered significant for trading purposes according to the defined criteria.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation format;Advantest is one of many companies listed, not the primary focus;Information is diluted by other company news, making it 'too noisy'

headline: [Earnings Flash Report] Advantest, Interim Pre-tax Profit of 230,517 Million. Approximately in line with analyst forecasts
description: ADVANTEST CORP reported an interim pre-tax profit of 230,517 million yen, which was largely in line with analyst forecasts. The company also revised its full-year pre-tax profit forecast upward to 371,500 million yen, a 65.3% increase from the previous year.
key_takeaways: Advantest's interim pre-tax profit of 230,517 million yen for the fiscal year ending March 2026 met the IFIS consensus.;The company revised its full-year pre-tax profit forecast upward to 371,500 million yen from the previous 297,000 million yen.;This new full-year forecast indicates a 65.3% increase in profit compared to the previous projection.;The revised full-year profit projection is 12.3% higher than the IFIS consensus.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is a '決算速報' (financial results flash report) explicitly stating that ADVANTEST CORP 'announced on October 28th' its interim results and, crucially, 'revised upward' its full-year earnings forecast on the same day. This constitutes new financial guidance and a recent corporate announcement.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports Advantest's interim pre-tax profit and, more importantly, a significant upward revision of its full-year pre-tax profit forecast. The new forecast is substantially higher than both the previous projection and the IFIS consensus, providing concrete, timely, and company-specific financial news with clear positive implications for future performance and stock valuation.
news_worthy_key_factors: Significant upward revision of full-year pre-tax profit forecast;New full-year forecast exceeds IFIS consensus by 12.3%;Direct reporting of recent financial results and future guidance;Company-specific and timely information
actionable_intelligence: Traders could interpret the significant upward revision of the full-year profit forecast, which also exceeds analyst consensus, as a strong positive indicator for Advantest's future performance. This information could lead to an upward re-evaluation of the stock price, potentially prompting buying activity or a re-assessment of existing positions based on improved earnings outlook.
original_headline: 【決算速報】アドバンテスト、中間税引前230,517百万。アナリスト予想とほぼ同水準
main_content: 【決算速報】アドバンテスト、中間税引前230,517百万。アナリスト予想とほぼ同水準【業績予想/決算速報】アドバンテスト < 6857 > が10月28日に発表した2026年3月期中間決算の税引前損益は230,517百万円、直近のIFISコンセンサス(230,179百万円)とほぼ変わらずの水準だった。また同日発表された業績予想によると通期の税引前損益は前回予想(297,000百万円)から上方修正され、65.3%増益の371,500百万円を予想、IFISコンセンサスを12.3%上回る水準となっている。
main_content_en: [Earnings Flash Report] Advantest, Interim Pre-tax Profit of 230,517 Million. Approximately in line with analyst forecasts. [Earnings Forecast/Financial Results Flash] Advantest < 6857 > announced on October 28 that its pre-tax profit/loss for the interim period of the fiscal year ending March 2026 was 230,517 million yen, which was almost unchanged from the latest IFIS consensus (230,179 million yen). Furthermore, according to the earnings forecast announced on the same day, the full-year pre-tax profit/loss was revised upward from the previous forecast (297,000 million yen) and is now projected to be 371,500 million yen, a 65.3% increase in profit, which is 12.3% above the IFIS consensus.

headline: [Analyst Rating] Komatsu Ltd., Rating Maintained as Overweight, Target Price Raised to 5,400 Yen (Major US Brokerage Firm)
description: KOMATSU LTD received a maintained "Overweight" rating from a major US brokerage firm. The firm also raised its target price for KOMATSU LTD from 5,100 yen to 5,400 yen.
key_takeaways: Komatsu Ltd. received a maintained "Overweight" rating from a major US brokerage firm.;The target price for Komatsu Ltd. was raised from 5,100 yen to 5,400 yen.;The new target price of 5,400 yen is above the current analyst consensus target price of 5,231 yen.;The consensus rating for Komatsu Ltd. is 3.6 (based on 10 analysts), indicating a "slightly bullish" outlook.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports a specific, recent event: a major US-based securities firm raised KOMATSU LTD's target price on October 24th. This constitutes a new rating change/target price revision, which is fresh market information.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports a major US brokerage firm maintaining an 'Overweight' rating and raising its target price for Komatsu Ltd. to 5,400 yen, which is above the current consensus target price. This is a specific, recent, and company-focused event that provides positive sentiment and could influence trading decisions, making it actionable intelligence.
news_worthy_key_factors: Target price raised by a major US brokerage firm;New target price (5,400 yen) is above the consensus target price (5,231 yen);Maintained 'Overweight' rating indicates continued positive sentiment;Timely and specific event directly related to Komatsu Ltd.
actionable_intelligence: Traders may interpret the raised target price and maintained 'Overweight' rating from a major brokerage as a positive signal, potentially leading to increased buying interest or a decision to hold existing positions, anticipating a short-term price increase towards the new target.
original_headline: 【アナリスト評価】小松製作所、レーティング強気を継続、目標株価5,400円に引上げ（米系大手証券）
main_content: 米系大手証券が10月24日、小松製作所<6301>のレーティングを強気（Overweight）に据え置いた。一方、目標株価は5,100円から5,400円に引き上げた。因みに前日（10月23日）時点のレーティングコンセンサスは3.6（アナリスト数10人）で「やや強気」の水準、目標株価コンセンサスは5,231円（アナリスト数10人）となっている。
main_content_en: A major US brokerage firm on October 24 maintained its rating on Komatsu Ltd. <6301> as "Overweight". Meanwhile, it raised its target price from 5,100 yen to 5,400 yen. Incidentally, as of the previous day (October 23), the consensus rating was 3.6 (based on 10 analysts), indicating a "slightly bullish" level, and the consensus target price was 5,231 yen (based on 10 analysts).

headline: ★Today's [Featured Earnings] Advantest, Kinden, TOENEC (October 28)
description: ADVANTEST CORP revised its current fiscal year net profit forecast upward by 24.2% to a record high, driven by strong demand for HPC and AI-related semiconductors. The company also announced a share buyback program for up to 18 million shares or 150 billion yen.
key_takeaways: Multiple companies, including Advantest, Kinden, and TOENEC, revised their current fiscal year profit forecasts significantly upward on October 28.;Advantest raised its net profit forecast by 24% to a new record high and announced a share buyback program of up to 150 billion yen.;Kinden and TOENEC both increased their ordinary profit forecasts to record highs and raised annual dividends by 20 yen and 13 yen respectively.;Other companies like WOWOW, Realgate, Tosec, Japan Cash Machine, Nippon Sharyo, and Musashi also reported strong performance and upward profit revisions.;A comprehensive list of companies scheduled to announce earnings on October 29 is provided, including notable firms like Komatsu, Disco, and NEC.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly states that ADVANTEST CORP's earnings revision and share buyback were '本日（10月28日）引け後に発表された' (announced after market close today, October 28). This indicates a new earnings release, updated guidance, and a new transaction (share buyback), which are all fresh, market-moving developments.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article reports Advantest's significant upward revision of its current fiscal year net profit forecast to a record high and the announcement of a substantial share buyback program. These are strong positive indicators for the company's financial health and shareholder value, providing clear actionable intelligence.
news_worthy_key_factors: Significant upward revision of current fiscal year net profit forecast by 24% to a new record high.;Announcement of a substantial share buyback program (up to 150 billion yen or 2.5% of outstanding shares).;Strong performance driven by increasing demand for HPC devices and AI-related semiconductors.;Timely and specific financial data directly from the company's recent announcement (October 28).
actionable_intelligence: The news suggests a positive outlook for Advantest's stock price due to improved financial performance and a commitment to returning value to shareholders through a share buyback. Traders might consider a long position or increasing their existing holdings.
original_headline: ★本日の【イチオシ決算】 アドテスト、きんでん、トーエネク (10月28日)
main_content: ※決算発表の集中期間(10月24日～11月14日)は、『決算特報』を毎日3本配信します。１．★本日の【サプライズ決算】 速報　　＜16時40分＞２．★本日の【サプライズ決算】 続報　　＜18時00分＞３．★本日の【イチオシ決算】 　　　　　＜20時00分＞――――――――――――――――――――――――――――【株探プレミアム】会員向けには、より早い“超速報”を毎日2本配信します。１．★本日の【サプライズ決算】 超速報　　　　＜15時40分＞２．★本日の【サプライズ決算】 超速報・続報　＜16時10分＞ご注目ください。なお、配信時間は多少前後します。１）本日（10月28日）引け後に発表された決算・業績修正●イチオシ決算【アドテスト < 6857 > [東証Ｐ]】　★今期最終を24％上方修正・最高益予想を上乗せ、自社株買いも発表◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結最終利益は前年同期比2.4倍の1698億円に急拡大して着地。HPCデバイスやAI関連半導体の需要の高まりを背景に、半導体の複雑化や性能向上などが進む中、高性能SoC半導体向け検査装置の販売が大きく伸びた。業績好調に伴い、通期の同利益を従来予想の2215億円→2750億円に24.2％上方修正。増益率が37.4％増→70.6％増に拡大し、従来の2期連続での過去最高益予想をさらに上乗せした。併せて、発行済み株式数の2.5％にあたる1800万株または1500億円を上限に自社株買いを実施すると発表。●サプライズな決算発表・業績修正きんでん < 1944 > [東証Ｐ]　　★今期経常を24％上方修正・最高益予想を上乗せ、配当も20円増額◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益は前年同期比2.4倍の340億円に急拡大し、従来予想の240億円を上回って着地。良好な市場環境を背景とした工事採算の向上に加え、生産性向上を進めたことが上振れにつながった。併せて、通期の同利益を従来予想の700億円→865億円に23.6％上方修正。増益率が8.4％増→34.0％増に拡大し、従来の2期連続での過去最高益予想をさらに上乗せした。業績好調に伴い、年間配当を従来計画の100円→120円(前期は90円)に増額修正した。トーエネク < 1946 > [東証Ｐ]　　★今期経常を18％上方修正・最高益予想を上乗せ、配当も13円増額◆26年3月期の連結経常利益を従来予想の170億円→200億円に17.6％上方修正。増益率が10.7％増→30.2％増に拡大し、従来の2期連続での過去最高益予想をさらに上乗せした。屋内線工事の豊富な手持ち案件が順調に進捗する中、採算性の向上が想定を上回ることなどを織り込んだ。併せて、年間配当を従来計画の52円→65円に増額修正した。配当方針を変更し、配当性向を40％以上(従来は30％以上)に引き上げる。ＷＯＷＯＷ < 4839 > [東証Ｐ]　　★上期経常を一転31％増益に上方修正◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益を従来予想の6億円→21億円に3.5倍上方修正。従来の減益予想から一転して30.8％増益見通しとなった。その他収入が想定を上回ったことに加え、番組費などの一部費用の発生が第3四半期以降へずれ込むことなどが上振れの要因。リアルゲイト < 5532 > [東証Ｇ]　　★今期経常は35％増で8期連続最高益更新へ◆25年9月期の経常利益(非連結)は前の期比31.5％増の8.2億円に伸びて着地。続く26年9月期も前期比35.1％増の11.1億円に拡大し、8期連続で過去最高益を更新する見通しとなった。今期は既存運営物件の高稼働率を維持し、安定的なストック型収入の積み上げを継続するほか、フロー型収益では2件の保有物件を売却する計画。併せて、28年9月期に営業利益25億円(25年9月期実績は10.4億円)を目指す中期経営計画を発表。テセック < 6337 > [東証Ｓ]　　★今期経常を2.2倍上方修正◆26年3月期の連結経常利益を従来予想の1億4000万円→3億1000万円に2.2倍上方修正。減益率が79.2％減→54.0％減に縮小する見通しとなった。テスタ分野における部材高騰の影響解消や研究開発費が想定を下回ることに加え、為替水準が想定より円安で推移していることが上振れの要因。一方、テスタの軟調な引き合いや受注状況を踏まえ、売上高は下方修正した。併せて、発行済み株式数の3.46％にあたる20万株を11月13日付で消却すると発表。日金銭 < 6418 > [東証Ｐ]　　★上期経常を2倍上方修正◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益を従来予想の5億円→10億円に2.0倍上方修正。減益率が83.3％減→66.6％減に縮小する見通しとなった。為替相場が想定より円安に推移し、為替差益が発生することが利益を押し上げる。日車両 < 7102 > [東証Ｐ]　　★今期経常を一転18％増益に上方修正◆26年3月期の連結経常利益を従来予想の70億円→86億円に22.9％上方修正。従来の減益予想から一転して17.9％増益見通しとなった。各事業の売上高が想定より堅調に推移することに加え、製品構成の変化などで利益率が向上することを反映した。ムサシ < 7521 > [東証Ｓ]　　★上期経常を58％上方修正、通期も増額、配当も10円増額◆26年3月期上期(4-9月)の連結経常利益を従来予想の15億円→23.7億円に57.8％上方修正。東京都議会議員選挙や参議院議員選挙向けに、自社開発商品である選挙システム機材の販売が好調に推移したことが要因。上期業績の好調に伴い、通期の同利益も従来予想の19.2億円→27.4億円に42.6％上方修正。減益率が59.4％減→42.1％減に縮小する見通しとなった。併せて、上期配当を従来計画の18円→28円(前年同期は30円)に大幅増額し、年間配当は46円になる。２）10月29日の決算発表銘柄（予定）　★は注目決算■取引時間中の発表◆第2四半期決算：< main_content_en: *During the intensive earnings announcement period (October 24 - November 14), "Earnings Special Reports" will be distributed three times daily. 1. ★Today's [Surprise Earnings] Flash Report <16:40> 2. ★Today's [Surprise Earnings] Follow-up Report <18:00> 3. ★Today's [Featured Earnings] <20:00> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- For "Kabutan Premium" members, two "Super Flash Reports" will be distributed daily at an earlier time. 1. ★Today's [Surprise Earnings] Super Flash Report <15:40> 2. ★Today's [Surprise Earnings] Super Flash Report - Follow-up <16:10> Please pay attention. Please note that delivery times may vary slightly. 1) Earnings and performance revisions announced after market close today (October 28) ●Featured Earnings [Advantest <6857> [TSE Prime]] ★Revised current fiscal year's net profit upward by 24%, raising record high profit forecast, also announced share buyback ◆Consolidated net profit for the first half (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 surged 2.4 times year-on-year to 169.8 billion yen. Amid increasing demand for HPC devices and AI-related semiconductors, and the advancement of semiconductor complexity and performance, sales of inspection equipment for high-performance SoC semiconductors grew significantly. Due to strong performance, the company revised its full-year net profit forecast upward by 24.2% from the previous forecast of 221.5 billion yen to 275.0 billion yen. The growth rate expanded from a 37.4% increase to a 70.6% increase, further raising the previous forecast for a record high profit for two consecutive periods. Additionally, the company announced a share buyback program, acquiring up to 18 million shares or 150 billion yen, representing 2.5% of outstanding shares. ●Surprise Earnings Announcements/Performance Revisions Kinden <1944> [TSE Prime] ★Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit upward by 24%, raising record high profit forecast, also increased dividend by 20 yen ◆Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 surged 2.4 times year-on-year to 34.0 billion yen, exceeding the previous forecast of 24.0 billion yen. This upward revision was driven by improved project profitability due to a favorable market environment, in addition to enhanced productivity. Concurrently, the company revised its full-year ordinary profit forecast upward by 23.6% from the previous forecast of 70.0 billion yen to 86.5 billion yen. The growth rate expanded from an 8.4% increase to a 34.0% increase, further raising the previous forecast for a record high profit for two consecutive periods. Due to strong performance, the annual dividend was revised upward from the planned 100 yen to 120 yen (90 yen in the previous fiscal year). TOENEC <1946> [TSE Prime] ★Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit upward by 18%, raising record high profit forecast, also increased dividend by 13 yen ◆Consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward by 17.6% from the previous forecast of 17.0 billion yen to 20.0 billion yen. The growth rate expanded from a 10.7% increase to a 30.2% increase, further raising the previous forecast for a record high profit for two consecutive periods. This revision incorporates better-than-expected improvements in profitability, among other factors, as numerous ongoing indoor wiring projects progress smoothly. Concurrently, the annual dividend was revised upward from the planned 52 yen to 65 yen. The company also changed its dividend policy, raising the dividend payout ratio to 40% or more (previously 30% or more). WOWOW <4839> [TSE Prime] ★Revised first half ordinary profit upward to a 31% increase ◆Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward 3.5 times from the previous forecast of 600 million yen to 2.1 billion yen. This turned the previous forecast of a profit decrease into an expected 30.8% profit increase. Factors contributing to this upward revision include higher-than-expected other income and the deferral of some expenses, such as program costs, to the third quarter and beyond. Realgate <5532> [TSE Growth] ★Current fiscal year's ordinary profit expected to increase by 35%, marking 8 consecutive periods of record high profits ◆Non-consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending September 2025 increased by 31.5% year-on-year to 820 million yen. For the subsequent fiscal year ending September 2026, it is expected to expand by 35.1% year-on-year to 1.11 billion yen, marking a record high profit for the eighth consecutive period. For the current fiscal year, the company plans to maintain high occupancy rates for existing managed properties, continuing to accumulate stable stock-type revenue, and in terms of flow-type revenue, plans to sell two owned properties. Concurrently, the company announced a medium-term management plan aiming for an operating profit of 2.5 billion yen by the fiscal year ending September 2028 (actual operating profit for the fiscal year ending September 2025 was 1.04 billion yen). Tosec <6337> [TSE Standard] ★Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit upward by 2.2 times ◆Consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward 2.2 times from the previous forecast of 140 million yen to 310 million yen. The rate of profit decrease is expected to narrow from 79.2% to 54.0%. Factors contributing to this upward revision include the resolution of the impact of rising material costs in the tester segment, lower-than-expected research and development expenses, and a weaker yen exchange rate than anticipated. On the other hand, sales were revised downward due to sluggish inquiries and order conditions for testers. Additionally, the company announced that it will cancel 200,000 shares, representing 3.46% of outstanding shares, on November 13. Japan Cash Machine <6418> [TSE Prime] ★Revised first half ordinary profit upward by 2 times ◆Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward 2.0 times from the previous forecast of 500 million yen to 1.0 billion yen. The rate of profit decrease is expected to narrow from 83.3% to 66.6%. The weaker-than-expected yen exchange rate, leading to foreign exchange gains, is boosting profits. Nippon Sharyo <7102> [TSE Prime] ★Revised current fiscal year's ordinary profit upward to an 18% increase ◆Consolidated ordinary profit for the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward by 22.9% from the previous forecast of 7.0 billion yen to 8.6 billion yen. This turned the previous forecast of a profit decrease into an expected 17.9% profit increase. This reflects stronger-than-expected sales in each business segment, as well as improved profit margins due to changes in product mix, among other factors. Musashi <7521> [TSE Standard] ★Revised first half ordinary profit upward by 58%, also increased full-year forecast and dividend by 10 yen ◆Consolidated ordinary profit for the first half (April-September) of the fiscal year ending March 2026 was revised upward by 57.8% from the previous forecast of 1.5 billion yen to 2.37 billion yen. This was due to strong sales of election system equipment, a proprietary product, for the Tokyo Metropolitan Assembly election and the House of Councillors election. Following the strong first-half performance, the full-year ordinary profit forecast was also revised upward by 42.6% from the previous forecast of 1.92 billion yen to 2.74 billion yen. The rate of profit decrease is expected to narrow from 59.4% to 42.1%. Concurrently, the first-half dividend was significantly increased from the planned 18 yen to 28 yen (30 yen in the same period last year), making the annual dividend 46 yen. 2) Scheduled earnings announcements for October 29 ★ indicates notable earnings ■Announcements during trading hours ◆Second Quarter Earnings: <1930> Hokuriku Electric Industry [TSE Prime] <1934> Yurtec [TSE Prime] <2664> Kawachi Yakuhin [TSE Prime] <3969> Eightred [TSE Standard] <4043> Tokuyama [TSE Prime] <4113> Taoka Chemical [TSE Standard] <4229> Gun-ei Chemical [TSE Prime] <4832> JFE Systems [TSE Standard] <4956> Konishi [TSE Prime] <5834> SBI Leasing [TSE Growth] <6161> Estic [TSE Standard] ★<6301> Komatsu [TSE Prime] <6436> Amano [TSE Prime] <6955> FDK [TSE Standard] <8628> Matsui Securities [TSE Prime] <8697> Japan Exchange Group [TSE Prime] <9474> Zenrin [TSE Prime] <9932> Sugimoto & Co.
