headline: Toyota Surges, Hits New Year-to-Date High; U.S. GM's Significant Rise After Earnings Announcement Stimulates Auto Stocks ◇(Minkabu) - Yahoo! Finance
description: TOYOTA MOTOR CORP surged to a new year-to-date high, stimulated by a positive market reaction to General Motors' better-than-expected earnings and upward full-year outlook revision. This development contributed to a broader rise across auto stocks.
key_takeaways: Toyota Motor reached a new year-to-date high, driving up other Japanese auto stocks.;General Motors (GM) announced Q3 2025 earnings with adjusted EPS exceeding market expectations.;GM revised its full-year outlook upward, contributing to a nearly 15% rise in its stock.;The strong performance of GM shares after its earnings announcement acted as a significant stimulus for the broader auto stock market.;The earnings forecast revision by GM assumed a smaller-than-expected impact from tariffs.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports on Toyota's current surge to a new year-high, directly attributing it to General Motors' recent earnings announcement and upward guidance revision from the previous day. This constitutes new market information and its immediate impact on Toyota's stock price, indicating a breaking development rather than a recap of past events.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article attributes Toyota's stock surge to the positive market reaction following General Motors' earnings announcement, rather than any specific news or development related to Toyota itself. It covers multiple auto companies, making Toyota's mention part of a broader market trend analysis.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation, covering GM, Honda, Subaru, Nissan, and Mazda.;Toyota's stock movement is presented as a consequence of GM's earnings, not its own specific news.;Lacks specific, actionable intelligence directly pertaining to Toyota's operations, financials, or strategy.;Derivative content for Toyota, as its performance is linked to another company's news.
original_headline: トヨタが急伸し年初来高値更新、決算発表の米ＧＭ大幅高が自動車株の刺激材料に◇(みんかぶ) - Yahoo!ファイナンス
main_content:
トヨタが急伸し年初来高値更新、決算発表の米ＧＭ大幅高が自動車株の刺激材料に◇
トヨタ自動車 < 7203 > がマドを開けて急伸し、年初来高値を更新。ホンダ < 7267 > やＳＵＢＡＲＵ < 7270 > など自動車株が軒並み高となっている。米自動車大手のゼネラル・モーターズ <GM> が２１日に発表した２５年７～９月期（第３四半期）の決算は、減益ながら調整後１株利益は市場予想を上回った。あわせて通期の見通しを上方修正しており、同日の米株式市場でＧＭ株は１５％近く上昇して取引を終えた。決算発表後のＧＭ株の好反応が、自動車株の刺激材料となったようだ。ＧＭは関税影響が見込みよりも小さいものとなるなどと想定して今回、業績予想の修正に踏み切った。日産自動車 < 7201 > やマツダ < 7261 > も高い。
（注）タイトル末尾の「◇」は本文中に複数の銘柄を含む記事を表しています。
出所：MINKABU PRESS
みんなの株式（minkabu PRESS）
みんかぶ
最終更新: 10/22(水) 9:32
みんかぶ
main_content_en: Toyota surges, updates year-to-date high; U.S. GM's significant rise after earnings announcement stimulates auto stocks ◇Toyota Motor <7203> surged with a gap up, updating its year-to-date high. Auto stocks such as Honda <7267> and SUBARU <7270> are all rising. U.S. auto giant General Motors <GM> announced on the 21st its financial results for the July-September 2025 period (third quarter), which, while showing a decrease in profit, had adjusted earnings per share exceeding market expectations. In conjunction, it revised its full-year outlook upward, and GM shares finished trading up nearly 15% in the U.S. stock market on the same day. The positive reaction of GM shares after the earnings announcement appears to have become a stimulus for auto stocks. GM proceeded with the earnings forecast revision this time, assuming that the impact of tariffs would be smaller than expected, among other factors. Nissan Motor <7201> and Mazda <7261> are also up.(Note) The "◇" at the end of the title indicates an article containing multiple stock issues in the main text.Source: MINKABU PRESSMinna no Kabushiki (minkabu PRESS)MinkabuLast updated: 10/22 (Wed) 9:32Minkabu

headline: Featured Stocks Pick-up [Evening Edition] (2): Teijin, SBG, Advantest
description: ADVANTEST CORP experienced selling pressure due to weak performance in major US semiconductor stocks and a disappointing outlook from Texas Instruments. This occurred despite a stronger dollar and weaker yen, which typically supports stock prices.
key_takeaways: Aeon Kyushu plans to acquire Tokiwa Industry by early 2026 to enhance corporate value and strengthen its presence in Oita Prefecture.;Effissimo Capital Management increased its shareholding in Teijin to 12.12%, triggering speculative buying in the stock.;SoftBank Group experienced a substantial decline, largely due to algorithmic selling after a rapid price increase, significantly contributing to the Nikkei Average's fall.;Gold ETFs plunged, with gold futures seeing a historic single-day decline, driven by profit-taking, US-China trade talk expectations, a stronger dollar, and a shift to risk assets.;Advantest faced selling pressure following weak performance in major US semiconductor stocks and a lower-than-expected outlook from Texas Instruments for the October-December quarter.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explains ADVANTEST CORP's stock movement today by referencing events that occurred 'yesterday' in the broader semiconductor market and an earnings outlook from Texas Instruments. It does not report any new, specific announcements or developments directly from ADVANTEST CORP itself.
news_worthy_reasoning: This article is a multi-company market summary, with Advantest mentioned briefly in the context of broader semiconductor sector weakness and a peer's (Texas Instruments) disappointing outlook. It does not contain specific, direct, or new actionable intelligence from Advantest itself that would warrant a significant trading decision.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, diluting focus on Advantest.;Advantest's mention is brief and contextualized within broader market trends and a peer's performance, not company-specific news.;Lack of direct, company-focused actionable intelligence for Advantest.;Content is derivative, summarizing market reactions rather than reporting new company events.
original_headline: 話題株ピックアップ【夕刊】（2）：帝人、ＳＢＧ、アドテスト
main_content: 帝人　＜日足＞　「株探」多機能チャートより現在値イオン九州2,883+11帝人1,304-12ｉスタイル451-2Ｐアルファ2,406+74応用地質2,725-61■イオン九州<2653>3,020円　  +75 円 (+2.6％)　　本日終値イオン九州<2653>が反発している。２１日の取引終了後、大分県でスーパーマーケットなど２３店舗を運営するトキハインダストリー（大分県大分市）の全株式を２６年１月末日の予定で取得し子会社化すると発表しており、好材料視された。今回の子会社化は、新規顧客の獲得に加えて、大分県における強固なドミナント形成によりグループの企業価値向上を図るのが狙い。取得価額は非開示。なお、２６年２月期業績への影響は軽微としている。■帝人<3401>1,355円　  +29.5 円 (+2.2％)　　本日終値帝人<3401>は３日続伸している。旧村上ファンド関係者が設立したシンガポール拠点の投資ファンド、エフィッシモ・キャピタル・マネージメントは２１日の取引終了後、関東財務局に変更報告書を提出した。同報告書によると、株式保有比率が従来の１１．０８％から１２．１２％に上昇しており、思惑的な買いが入った。報告義務発生日は１０月１４日。保有目的は純投資としている。■応用地質<9755>2,984円　  +58 円 (+2.0％)　　本日終値応用地質<9755>が反発している。この日、宇宙航空研究開発機構（ＪＡＸＡ）が公募した「宇宙戦略基金事業」（第２期）の「技術開発テーマ／探査等（月面インフラ構築に資する要素技術）」に、同社が参加する共同研究チームが採択されたと発表しており、好材料視された。採択された技術開発課題「月面拠点建設を実現するための測量・地盤調査技術の確立」は、立命館大学を代表機関とし、月面環境分析（アセスメント）及び重要技術の早期実証を目指すもの。同社は、地球上で培ってきた先進的な地盤の可視化技術と、それに必要な計測技術を有していることから、月面インフラ構築に不可欠な月面地盤の状況把握や地盤調査技術の確立に貢献するとしている。■アイスタイル<3660>478円　  +7 円 (+1.5％)　　本日終値アイスタイル<3660>は３日続伸。２１日取引終了後、海外初のフラッグシップショップ「＠ｃｏｓｍｅ　ＨＯＮＧ　ＫＯＮＧ」を１２月５日にオープンすると発表した。東京、大阪、名古屋に次ぐ、４つ目の旗艦店になるという。これが手掛かりとなったようだ。■ＰＡコンサル<4071>2,430円　  +31 円 (+1.3％)　　本日終値プラスアルファ・コンサルティング<4071>は３日続伸。２１日取引終了後、タレントマネジメントシステム「Ｔａｌｅｎｔ　Ｐａｌｅｔｔｅ」について三井住友信託銀行が導入したと発表した。また、２２日朝方には対話力向上支援サービス「ＡＩトークトレ」を提供開始すると発表。実際の顧客応対に近いリアルなペルソナを生成ＡＩが生成し、実践的な応対練習を可能にするという。リリースが相次ぎ材料視されたようだ。■明星工業<1976>1,675円　  +20 円 (+1.2％)　　本日終値明星工業<1976>が３日続伸している。２１日の取引終了後、集計中の９月中間期連結業績について、営業利益が従来予想の３３億円から２７億５０００万円（前年同期比２９．９％減）へ、純利益が２４億円から１８億５０００万円（同３７．１％減）へ下振れて着地したようだと発表。これを受けて朝方は安く始まったものの、織り込み済みとの見方からプラスに転じている。売上高は２８０億円（同１１．３％減）の従来予想を据え置いたものの、一部案件の追加原価発生による影響や人件費負担の増加などにより、利益は計画を下振れたとしている。■ＫＤＤＩ<9433>2,444.5円　  +2.5 円 (+0.1％)　　本日終値ＫＤＤＩ<9433>がしっかり。この日、欧州現地法人テレハウス・ヨーロッパ社が、英国ロンドン市内のデータセンター６棟目として、高電力のＧＰＵサーバーに対応可能なデータセンター「Ｔｅｌｅｈｏｕｓｅ　Ｗｅｓｔ　２」の建設を開始したと発表しており、好材料視された。同データセンターは、総工費約６００億円を投じ２７年度に開業を予定。高品質な通信インフラ、テレハウス最大のＩＴ電力容量（供給電力容量）となる２２．４メガワットを備え、高性能ＧＰＵの放出熱でも冷却可能な水冷方式に対応する。また、再生可能エネルギー１００％で稼働することで環境負荷を低減し、社会の持続的成長へつなげるとしている。■ソフトバンクグループ<9984>23,700円　  -1,220 円 (-4.9％)　　本日終値　 東証プライム 下落率3位ソフトバンクグループ<9984>が急落、一時１０％を超える急落となり、ここまで上昇相場のサポートラインとなっていた５日移動平均線を大陰線で下放れる格好となった。同社の株価は今月に入ってから上げ足を強め、前日につけた最高値２万５７３５円まで３週間で４割強も株価水準を切り上げていたが、足もとでその反動が出ている。日経平均の構成比率ではソフトバンクＧは２２５銘柄の中でアドバンテスト<6857>を凌ぎトップに位置している。きょうは日経平均が一時７００円あまりの下落をみせるなど波乱含みの値動きとなったが、その下げ分の８割強をソフトバンクＧが１銘柄で占める状況となっており、「（同社株固有の）悪材料に反応しているということではないが、ＡＩアルゴリズムの機械的な売りが下げを助長している」（中堅証券ストラテジスト）という指摘が聞かれる。株式需給面では直近１７日現在で信用買い残が増勢となる一方、売り残は減少しているが、信用倍率は１．３倍台と引き続きタイト感がある。また、日証金の貸借倍率は２１日現在で１．０２倍と売り買い拮抗した状態にある。■ＳＰＤＲ<1326>57,880円　  -2,480 円 (-4.1％)　　本日終値金ＥＴＦが急落。ＳＰＤＲゴールド・シェア<1326>が一時、前日に比べ７％超安に売られたほか、ＮＥＸＴ　ＦＵＮＤＳ　金価格連動型上場投信<1328>や純金上場信託（現物国内保管型）<1540>が大幅安となっている。２１日のニューヨーク商品取引所（ＣＯＭＥＸ）の金先物相場は、１２月限が前日比２５０．３ドル（５．７％）安の１トロイオンス＝４１０９．１ドルと急落した。一日の下落幅としては過去最大とみられている。年初から大幅な上昇を演じ、前日には最高値を更新していたが、利益確定やポジション調整の売りが膨らんだ。米中通商協議の進展期待やドル高が金価格には逆風になったとの見方も出ている。２１日にＮＹダウが最高値を更新したことも、資金がリスク資産の株式に向かい、安全資産の金から離散したとみられている。■アドバンテスト<6857>17,100円　  -300 円 (-1.7％)　　本日終値アドバンテスト<6857>が売り優勢。前日の米国株市場ではエヌビディアやアドバンスト・マイクロ・デバイシズ、マイクロン・テクノロジーなど半導体の主力銘柄が軟調に推移しフィラデルフィア半導体株指数（ＳＯＸ指数）も反落した。ＳＯＸ指数は最高値圏での推移が続いているが、足もとで上値がやや重くなっている状況だ。また、前日の米株市場取引終了後に発表された半導体大手テキサス・インスツルメンツの１０～１２月期見通しが市場コンセンサスを下回る内容で、時間外で急落していることもネガティブ視される。一方、外国為替市場で足もとドル高・円安方向に振れていることは株価の下支え材料として意識される。アドテストや東エレクは日経平均構成比で上位に位置しており、日経平均株価への影響力も大きいだけに、その値動きが注目される。
main_content_en: Teijin <Daily Chart> From "Kabutan" Multifunction Chart Current Price: Aeon Kyushu 2,883 +11, Teijin 1,304 -12, i-Style 451 -2, P-Alpha 2,406 +74, OYO Corporation 2,725 -61. Aeon Kyushu <2653> 3,020 yen +75 yen (+2.6%) Today's closing price. Aeon Kyushu <2653> is rebounding. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that it plans to acquire all shares of Tokiwa Industry (Oita City, Oita Prefecture), which operates 23 supermarkets and other stores in Oita Prefecture, by the end of January 2026, making it a subsidiary. This was viewed as positive news. The aim of this acquisition is to enhance the group's corporate value by acquiring new customers and establishing a strong dominant presence in Oita Prefecture. The acquisition price is undisclosed. The impact on the fiscal year ending February 2026 performance is stated to be minor. Teijin <3401> 1,355 yen +29.5 yen (+2.2%) Today's closing price. Teijin <3401> has risen for three consecutive days. Effissimo Capital Management, a Singapore-based investment fund established by individuals associated with the former Murakami Fund, submitted an amendment report to the Kanto Local Finance Bureau after the close of trading on the 21st. According to the report, the shareholding ratio increased from the previous 11.08% to 12.12%, leading to speculative buying. The date of obligation to report was October 14. The purpose of holding is stated as pure investment. OYO Corporation <9755> 2,984 yen +58 yen (+2.0%) Today's closing price. OYO Corporation <9755> is rebounding. On this day, the company announced that a joint research team it participates in was selected for the "Technology Development Theme / Exploration, etc. (Elemental Technologies Contributing to Lunar Infrastructure Construction)" under the "Space Strategy Fund Project" (Phase 2) publicly solicited by the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), which was viewed as positive news. The adopted technology development theme, "Establishment of Surveying and Ground Investigation Technologies for Realizing Lunar Base Construction," aims for early demonstration of lunar environment analysis (assessment) and critical technologies, with Ritsumeikan University as the lead institution. The company states that, possessing advanced ground visualization technology cultivated on Earth and the necessary measurement technologies, it will contribute to understanding lunar ground conditions and establishing ground investigation technologies essential for lunar infrastructure construction. i-Style <3660> 478 yen +7 yen (+1.5%) Today's closing price. i-Style <3660> has risen for three consecutive days. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that it will open its first overseas flagship store, "@cosme HONG KONG," on December 5. This will be its fourth flagship store, following Tokyo, Osaka, and Nagoya. This appears to have been the catalyst. Plus Alpha Consulting <4071> 2,430 yen +31 yen (+1.3%) Today's closing price. Plus Alpha Consulting <4071> has risen for three consecutive days. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Bank had adopted its talent management system "Talent Palette." Additionally, on the morning of the 22nd, it announced the launch of "AI Talk Training," a service to support improved conversational skills. This service uses generative AI to create realistic personas similar to actual customer interactions, enabling practical response training. The series of releases appears to have been viewed as positive news. Myojo Industrial <1976> 1,675 yen +20 yen (+1.2%) Today's closing price. Myojo Industrial <1976> has risen for three consecutive days. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that its consolidated interim results for the September interim period, currently being compiled, appear to have fallen short of previous forecasts, with operating profit decreasing from 3.3 billion yen to 2.75 billion yen (down 29.9% year-on-year) and net profit decreasing from 2.4 billion yen to 1.85 billion yen (down 37.1% year-on-year). Following this announcement, the stock opened lower in the morning but turned positive, as the market viewed the news as already priced in. Although sales remained at the previously forecast 28 billion yen (down 11.3% year-on-year), profits fell below plan due to the impact of additional costs for some projects and increased personnel expenses. KDDI <9433> 2,444.5 yen +2.5 yen (+0.1%) Today's closing price. KDDI <9433> is firm. On this day, its European local subsidiary, Telehouse Europe, announced the start of construction of "Telehouse West 2," its sixth data center in London, UK, capable of supporting high-power GPU servers, which was viewed as positive news. This data center, with a total construction cost of approximately 60 billion yen, is scheduled to open in fiscal year 2027. It will feature high-quality communication infrastructure, Telehouse's largest IT power capacity (supply power capacity) of 22.4 megawatts, and support a water-cooling system capable of cooling even the heat emitted by high-performance GPUs. Furthermore, by operating on 100% renewable energy, it aims to reduce environmental impact and contribute to sustainable societal growth. SoftBank Group <9984> 23,700 yen -1,220 yen (-4.9%) Today's closing price. TSE Prime, 3rd largest decline rate. SoftBank Group <9984> plunged, temporarily falling by over 10%, breaking below the 5-day moving average, which had been a support line for the rising market, with a large bearish candlestick. The company's stock price had accelerated its ascent this month, rising by over 40% in three weeks to a high of 25,735 yen reached the previous day, but is now experiencing a reaction. In terms of Nikkei 225 constituent weighting, SoftBank Group surpasses Advantest <6857> to hold the top position among the 225 stocks. Today, the Nikkei Average saw volatile movements, temporarily falling by over 700 yen, with SoftBank Group alone accounting for over 80% of that decline. A mid-tier securities strategist commented, "It's not a reaction to negative news specific to the company's stock, but rather mechanical selling by AI algorithms exacerbating the decline." In terms of stock supply and demand, as of the 17th, margin buying has been increasing while short selling has decreased, but the margin ratio remains tight at around 1.3 times. Furthermore, the Japan Securities Finance Co. (JSF) loan-to-stock ratio was 1.02 times as of the 21st, indicating a balanced state of buying and selling. SPDR <1326> 57,880 yen -2,480 yen (-4.1%) Today's closing price. Gold ETFs plunged. SPDR Gold Shares <1326> was temporarily sold down by over 7% compared to the previous day, while NEXT FUNDS Gold Price Linked ETF <1328> and Pure Gold ETF (Physical Domestic Storage Type) <1540> also saw significant declines. On the New York Mercantile Exchange (COMEX) on the 21st, gold futures for December delivery plunged by $250.3 (5.7%) from the previous day to $4,109.1 per troy ounce. This is believed to be the largest single-day decline in history. After a significant rise since the beginning of the year and hitting a new high the previous day, profit-taking and position adjustment selling expanded. Expectations for progress in US-China trade talks and a stronger dollar are also seen as headwinds for gold prices. The Dow Jones Industrial Average hitting a new high on the 21st is also believed to have caused funds to shift from safe-haven gold to risk assets like stocks. Advantest <6857> 17,100 yen -300 yen (-1.7%) Today's closing price. Advantest <6857> saw selling pressure. In the US stock market the previous day, major semiconductor stocks such as Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices, and Micron Technology performed weakly, and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOX Index) also fell back. The SOX Index continues to trade near its all-time high, but its upside momentum has recently become somewhat heavy. Furthermore, the outlook for the October-December quarter announced by semiconductor giant Texas Instruments after the close of the US stock market the previous day fell below market consensus, causing a sharp drop in after-hours trading, which is also viewed negatively. On the other hand, the recent shift towards a stronger dollar and weaker yen in the foreign exchange market is seen as a factor supporting stock prices. Advantest and Tokyo Electron are among the top constituents of the Nikkei Average, and their movements are closely watched due to their significant influence on the Nikkei Stock Average.

headline: Stocks on the Move on the 21st: Hitachi, U.S. OpenAI Sign MoU for Strategic Partnership
description: HITACHI LTD signed a strategic partnership Memorandum of Understanding with OpenAI to build next-generation AI infrastructure and expand global data centers. The collaboration will also focus on minimizing data center power load, securing critical product supply, and enhancing Hitachi's Lumada solutions with OpenAI's LLM.
key_takeaways: Hitachi and U.S. OpenAI entered a strategic partnership via an MoU to build next-generation AI infrastructure and expand global data centers.;The partnership will focus on minimizing power grid load, achieving zero-emission data centers, and securing critical product supply for data centers.;Collaboration includes standardizing prefabricated and modular data center designs to shorten construction periods.;They will explore joint efforts on critical equipment design and supply, such as cooling and storage, for data center speed.;Hitachi plans to further integrate OpenAI's Large Language Models (LLM) to strengthen its Lumada solutions, including HMAX.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly states that Hitachi 'announced on the 21st' (２１日、...発表した) the signing of a strategic partnership MoU with OpenAI. This indicates a new public disclosure of a significant business development, making it new information for the market.
source: ウエルスアドバイザー
news_worthy_reasoning: The article details a strategic partnership between Hitachi and OpenAI, a major player in AI, focusing on next-generation AI infrastructure and data center expansion. This is a concrete, recent development with potential long-term implications for Hitachi's business and competitive position in high-growth sectors.
news_worthy_key_factors: Strategic partnership with a leading AI company (OpenAI);Focus on high-growth areas: next-generation AI infrastructure and global data centers;Integration of OpenAI's LLM technology into Hitachi's Lumada solutions;Potential for long-term impact on Hitachi's revenue and market share
actionable_intelligence: Traders could evaluate Hitachi's long-term growth potential in the AI and data center markets, considering this partnership as a positive catalyst. It might prompt further research into Hitachi's AI strategy and its competitors, and potentially influence investment decisions based on future growth prospects.
original_headline: ＜２１日の動意株＞日立、米ＯｐｅｎＡＩと戦略的パートナーシップで覚書
main_content: 日立<6501>は２１日、米ＯｐｅｎＡＩと、次世代ＡＩ（人工知能）インフラの構築とグローバルなデータセンターの拡大を軸とした、戦略的パートナーシップに関する覚書（ＭｏＵ）を２日に締結したと発表した。今回、データセンター外領域では、データセンターの送配電網への負荷の最小化と、将来的なゼロエミッション型データセンターの実現、データセンター向けの重要かつ長納期な製品の供給確保、工期短縮に向けた、プレファブ型・モジュール型のデータセンターの設計の標準化などを進める。データセンター内領域での協業では、冷却設備やストレージをはじめとした、データセンターの稼働までのスピードを支える重要機器の設計・供給に関する協業の可能性を探索する。また、ＨＭＡＸを含む同社のＬｕｍａｄａソリューションの強化に向けて、ＯｐｅｎＡＩのＬＬＭ（大規模言語モデル）のさらなる活用を検討する。２１日の終値は、前日比７８円安の４４９８円。
main_content_en: Hitachi <6501> announced on the 21st that it signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with U.S. OpenAI on the 2nd, regarding a strategic partnership focused on building next-generation AI (Artificial Intelligence) infrastructure and expanding global data centers. This time, in areas outside data centers, they will promote minimizing the load on data center power transmission and distribution networks, realizing future zero-emission data centers, securing the supply of critical and long-lead-time products for data centers, and standardizing the design of prefabricated and modular data centers to shorten construction periods. In collaboration within data center areas, they will explore possibilities for collaboration on the design and supply of critical equipment, including cooling equipment and storage, that supports the speed of data center operation. Additionally, to strengthen the company's Lumada solutions, including HMAX, they will consider further utilization of OpenAI's LLM (Large Language Model). The closing price on the 21st was 4,498 yen, down 78 yen from the previous day.

headline: Advantest, Tokyo Electron, etc. see dominant selling; US TI's after-hours sharp decline weighs heavily despite yen depreciation tailwind
description: ADVANTEST CORP is experiencing dominant selling pressure, influenced by broader semiconductor market weakness and a negative outlook from Texas Instruments, with its price movements drawing attention due to its significant Nikkei 225 position.
key_takeaways: Semiconductor manufacturing equipment stocks, including Advantest and Tokyo Electron, are facing dominant selling.;Weak performance in US semiconductor giants (Nvidia, AMD, Micron Technology) and a disappointing October-December outlook from Texas Instruments are primary drivers of the selling pressure.;The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOX Index) traded weakly, indicating a broader sector slowdown despite being near all-time highs.;A stronger dollar and weaker yen are providing a tailwind for Japanese stocks, but this is being overshadowed by semiconductor sector weakness.;Advantest and Tokyo Electron's significant weight in the Nikkei 225 means their price movements have a substantial impact on the overall index.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article primarily explains the current stock movement of ADVANTEST CORP based on events that occurred 'yesterday' in the US market, such as the weak performance of semiconductor stocks and Texas Instruments' Q4 outlook. It interprets the impact of these prior events and ongoing currency trends on ADVANTEST CORP, rather than announcing a new event or development directly from the company itself.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company market analysis that discusses broader semiconductor sector weakness, driven by external factors like US semiconductor stock performance and Texas Instruments' outlook. While Advantest is mentioned, it is primarily as an example of a company affected by these sector-wide trends, not as the subject of specific, company-focused news or actionable intelligence.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation, discussing several US and Japanese semiconductor firms.;Focus on broader sector trends and external market factors (US semiconductor performance, TI outlook) rather than Advantest-specific news.;Advantest is presented as an example of a company affected by these external trends, not as the primary subject of specific, actionable company developments.;The intelligence provided is about general market sentiment for the semiconductor sector, not specific to Advantest's internal operations or future prospects.
original_headline: アドテスト、東エレクなど売り優勢、円安追い風も米ＴＩの時間外急落が重荷◇
main_content: アドバンテスト < 6857 >、東京エレクトロン < 8035 > など半導体製造装置関連は売り優勢。前日の米国株市場ではエヌビディア <NVDA> やアドバンスト・マイクロ・デバイシズ <AMD> 、マイクロン・テクノロジー <MU> など半導体の主力銘柄が軟調に推移しフィラデルフィア半導体株指数（ＳＯＸ指数）も反落した。ＳＯＸ指数は最高値圏での推移が続いているが、足もとで上値がやや重くなっている状況だ。また、前日の米株市場取引終了後に発表された半導体大手テキサス・インスツルメンツ <T> の１０～１２月期見通しが市場コンセンサスを下回る内容で、時間外で急落していることもネガティブ視される。一方、外国為替市場で足もとドル高・円安方向に振れていることは株価の下支え材料として意識される。アドテストや東エレクは日経平均構成比で上位に位置しており、日経平均株価への影響力も大きいだけに、その値動きが注目される。
main_content_en: Advantest <6857>, Tokyo Electron <8035>, and other semiconductor manufacturing equipment-related stocks are seeing dominant selling. In the US stock market yesterday, leading semiconductor stocks such as Nvidia <NVDA>, Advanced Micro Devices <AMD>, and Micron Technology <MU> traded weakly, and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOX Index) also fell back. The SOX Index continues to trade near its all-time highs, but its upside has become somewhat heavy recently. Furthermore, the October-December outlook from semiconductor giant Texas Instruments <T>, announced after the close of the US stock market yesterday, fell below market consensus, and its sharp decline in after-hours trading is also viewed negatively. On the other hand, the recent shift towards a stronger dollar and weaker yen in the foreign exchange market is seen as a factor supporting stock prices. Advantest and Tokyo Electron hold high positions in the Nikkei 225's composition ratio, and their influence on the Nikkei 225 stock average is significant, thus their price movements are drawing attention.

headline: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, a Leader in Defense Stocks, Up +92% in One Year, but Will the Rise Pause with the "Realization" of a New Prime Minister Takaichi? Check the Stock Movement (October 21, 2025)
description: MITSUBISHI HEAVY INDUSTRIES' stock price reached an all-time high of 4,473 yen on October 21, 2025, driven by the election of Sanae Takaichi as Prime Minister and anticipation of her defense strengthening policies. This political development led to significant buying in the company's shares.
key_takeaways: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' stock price increased by 92.34% year-over-year as of October 21, 2025, closing at 4,268 yen.;The stock reached a new all-time high of 4,473 yen on October 21, 2025, coinciding with Sanae Takaichi's election as the 104th Prime Minister.;The sharpest single-day rise (+11.17%) occurred on October 6, 2025, following Takaichi's election as LDP president, due to anticipation of her pro-defense policies.;A previously announced 11.5% downward revision to the FY2026 earnings forecast had limited selling impact, attributed to the privatization of Mitsubishi Logisnext.;The stock experienced fluctuations due to political uncertainty but generally trended upwards as the likelihood of Takaichi becoming Prime Minister increased.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly states its purpose is to 'explain the stock price' of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries 'as of October 21, 2025' and review 'the past year's stock price trends'. It details historical stock movements and past events, including an earnings forecast revision from September 30 and political events up to October 21, all presented as already concluded. This content is a summary and interpretation of past market activity, not new information.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article provides a retrospective analysis of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' stock performance over the past year, explaining the reasons behind its significant surge (e.g., Sanae Takaichi's election, defense policies) and the limited impact of an earnings revision. While the events discussed are significant, they have already occurred and their impact is already reflected in the stock price as of the article's date (October 21, 2025). The article does not present new, unpriced information that could directly impact the stock price in the near term for a trader reading it at that time. It explains past movements rather than offering forward-looking actionable intelligence.
news_worthy_key_factors: Primarily retrospective analysis of past stock movements and their drivers.;Key events (Takaichi's election, earnings revision) have already occurred and their impact is priced into the stock.;Lack of new, unpriced information for future trading decisions.;The title poses a speculative question about future movement, but the article's content does not provide new data to answer it.
original_headline: 防衛関連株の雄・三菱重工、1年で+92%も高市新総理「実現」で上昇一服？値動きをチェック（2025年10月21日）
main_content: 本記事では三菱重工業<7011>の株価について解説します。2025年10月21日時点における過去1年間の株価の推移や最高値など、今後の投資判断や株価分析に役立つ情報をお届けするので、参考にしてください。※リターンなど％表記のものは小数第三位を四捨五入した結果を表示しています。※編集部注:外部配信先ではハイパーリンクや図表などの画像を全部閲覧できない場合があります。その際はLIMO内でご確認ください。2025年10月21日の三菱重工業の株価は4268円2025年10月21日時点、三菱重工業の株価（調整後終値）は4268円となっています。また、1年前（2024年10月21日）の株価は2219円です。仮に、2024年10月21日時点で三菱重工業の株を取得していた場合、リターンは+92.34％となります。※株式分割が実施された場合は、分割前の株価についても遡及して分割後の調整値を採用しています※リターン計算において配当、株主優待は考慮していません三菱重工業の株価推移（1年間）(出所：各種資料をもとに筆者作成)三菱重工業の株価推移（過去30営業日）(出所：各種資料をもとに筆者作成)三菱重工業の1年間の株価推移【2025年10月21日時点】三菱重工株の過去1年間の値動きをみていきましょう。2024年の10月から2025年2月にかけては2000円近辺で推移しました。3月に節目の3000円に迫りますが、米国の関税措置への警戒感が強まった4月7日に急落します。その後は騰落を繰り返しながらも右肩上がりで上昇し、8月13日に4124円の高値をつけますが、ここを天井に9月の終わりごろまで3000円台後半で推移しました。9月30日深夜に2026年3月期の連結業績予想の下方修正（最終利益で従来予想比▲11.5％）を発表しましたが、連結子会社でフォークリフト大手の三菱ロジスネクストを非公開化することに伴うもので、売りは限られました。急騰したのは10月6日（前日比+11.17％）で、4日に行われた自民党総裁選で高市早苗氏が新総裁に選出されたことが材料視されたためです。かねて防衛強化を主張してきた高市氏の政策実現に期待する買いが先行した形となり、一時は4251円の高値をつけました。その後は公明党の連立政権離脱により、政局の見通し不透明感からもみ合う場面があったものの、高市総裁が内閣総理大臣に選出される可能性が高まるにつれ、同社株も上昇し、10月15日から20日は4営業日続伸しました。21日午後に参院業院は本会議で首相指名選挙を実施し、自民党の高市総裁を第104代首相に選出しました。三菱重工の株価は11時前に4473円と上場来高値を更新したものの、午後に高市総理誕生が伝わると材料出尽くしから売りに転じ、結局前日比▲3.26％安の4268円で取引を終えました。※株価チャートは配信先によっては表示されていない可能性があるため、ご覧になりたい場合はLIMOにて記事をご参照ください。過去1年間における株価（終値ベース）の最高価格と最低価格は次のようになりました。・最高価格:4412円・最低価格:1987円仮に最低価格および最高価格で売買できた場合、過去1年間で実現できた最高リターンは+122.04％です。過去1年間における三菱重工業の株価の最大上昇日と最大下落日は？過去1年間、三菱重工業の株価が対前日比で最も上昇した（もしくは最も下落率が低かった）のは2025年4月10日でした。変化率は対前日比+12.95％です。また、最も下落した（もしくは最も上昇率が低かった）のは2025年4月7日でした。変化率は対前日比▲12.81％です。まとめにかえて今回は三菱重工業の株式のリターンや株価騰落について振り返りました。保有する銘柄、投資を検討している銘柄の旨味や魅力は、タイミングや状況によって変わります。気になる銘柄があれば、今回振り返ったような基礎情報を自分で調べてみることをおすすめします。
main_content_en: This article explains the stock price of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries <7011>. We will provide information useful for future investment decisions and stock price analysis, such as the stock price trend and highest price over the past year as of October 21, 2025, so please use it as a reference. *Percentages such as returns are displayed as results rounded to the third decimal place. *Editor's note: Hyperlinks and images such as charts may not be fully viewable on external distribution sites. In such cases, please check within LIMO. Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' stock price on October 21, 2025, was 4,268 yen. As of October 21, 2025, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' stock price (adjusted closing price) is 4,268 yen. Furthermore, the stock price one year ago (October 21, 2024) was 2,219 yen. If one had acquired Mitsubishi Heavy Industries shares as of October 21, 2024, the return would be +92.34%. *If a stock split was implemented, the adjusted value after the split is retroactively applied to the stock price before the split. *Dividends and shareholder benefits are not considered in the return calculation. Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Stock Price Trend (1 Year) (Source: Created by the author based on various materials) Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Stock Price Trend (Past 30 Business Days) (Source: Created by the author based on various materials) Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' Stock Price Trend Over One Year [As of October 21, 2025] Let's look at the stock movement of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries over the past year. From October 2024 to February 2025, it traded around 2,000 yen. In March, it approached the milestone of 3,000 yen, but on April 7, it sharply declined due to heightened caution regarding U.S. tariff measures. After that, it rose steadily while repeatedly fluctuating, reaching a high of 4,124 yen on August 13, but with this as a ceiling, it traded in the high 3,000 yen range until around the end of September. Late on September 30, the company announced a downward revision to its consolidated earnings forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2026 (final profit down 11.5% from the previous forecast), but this was due to the privatization of its consolidated subsidiary Mitsubishi Logisnext, a major forklift manufacturer, so selling was limited. The sharp rise occurred on October 6 (+11.17% from the previous day), as the election of Sanae Takaichi as the new president in the Liberal Democratic Party presidential election held on the 4th was seen as a positive factor. Buying in anticipation of the realization of policies by Ms. Takaichi, who has long advocated for strengthening defense, led the way, and the stock temporarily reached a high of 4,251 yen. Subsequently, there were periods of fluctuation due to uncertainty in the political outlook following Komeito's withdrawal from the coalition government, but as the possibility of President Takaichi being elected Prime Minister increased, the company's stock also rose, continuing to gain for four consecutive business days from October 15 to 20. On the afternoon of the 21st, the House of Councillors held a prime ministerial nomination election in its plenary session and elected LDP President Takaichi as the 104th Prime Minister. Although Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' stock price updated its all-time high to 4,473 yen before 11 AM, it turned to selling in the afternoon due to

headline: [Game & Entertainment Stocks Morning Session (10/22)] Wide Range of Stocks Bought Due to Sense of Being Undervalued; Square Enix and Bandai Namco Firm; AlphaPolis and KLab Also Sought After
description: BANDAI NAMCO HOLDINGS saw its stock rise in the morning session on October 22, as game and entertainment-related companies experienced a prevalence of buying despite a declining overall market. This positive movement occurred as the sector appeared relatively undervalued.
key_takeaways: The Nikkei Average fell by 238 yen 50 sen, closing at 49,077 yen 56 sen in the morning session.;Weakness in semiconductor stocks, triggered by a sell-off of US semiconductor company TI, weighed down the overall market.;Game and entertainment stocks showed resilience, with 71 out of 97 companies (73%) rising, attributed to a sense of being undervalued.;Key game companies like Bandai Namco HD, Square Enix HD, Capcom, and Koei Tecmo HD saw gains, while Sony G, Nintendo, Sega Sammy HD, and Konami G were down.;Top gainers included iole, AlphaPolis, KLab, and AXEL, indicating broad interest in specific entertainment-related firms.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article is a market recap detailing the morning's stock market performance for the overall market and the game/entertainment sector. While it mentions BANDAI NAMCO HOLDINGS' stock movement, it does not report any new corporate events, announcements, or developments specific to the company itself.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a broad market summary for the game and entertainment sector, mentioning numerous companies. While it notes Bandai Namco's stock was up, it attributes this to a general sector-wide perception of being undervalued, not to any specific company-focused event, financial report, or strategic development for Bandai Namco itself. It lacks specific actionable intelligence for a trader focused solely on Bandai Namco.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, not focused on Bandai Namco.;Bandai Namco is mentioned briefly as one of many companies that saw gains.;The reason for the stock movement is generic market sentiment ('sense of being undervalued') rather than a specific company event or catalyst.;No specific actionable intelligence related to Bandai Namco's operations, financials, or future prospects.
original_headline: 【ゲームエンタメ株前場(10/22)】出遅れ感から幅広い銘柄が買われる　スクエニやバンナム堅調　アルファポリスやKLabにも物色
main_content:
10月22日前場の東京株式市場は反落。日経平均株価は、前営業日比238円50銭安の4万9077円56銭で午前中の取引を終えた。高市早苗氏が首相就任という政治イベントが通過したことに加え、米半導体大手TIが時間外取引で売られたことを受けて、半導体関連を中心に軟調となったことが重しとなり、一時702円安まで売られる場面があった。
【主要指数】
・日経225: 49,077.56(-238.50)
・TOPIX: 3,260.15(+10.65)
・ドル/円: 151.66(-0.27)
・ダウ: 46,924.74(+218.16)
・ナスダック: 22,953.67(-36.88)
・SOX: 6,839.27(-45.76)
こうしたなか、ゲーム・エンタメ関連企業をみると、登録されている97銘柄のうち、上昇は71銘柄(73%)、下落は19銘柄(20%)、変わらずは7銘柄(7%)で、買い優勢だった。半導体やAI関連などとの比較で相対的な出遅れ感があり、幅広く物色されたもようだ。
大手ゲーム関連を見ると、バンダイナムコHD < 7832 > 、スクエニHD < 9684 > 、カプコン < 9697 > 、コーエーテクモHD < 3635 > が高く、ソニーG < 6758 > 、任天堂 < 7974 > 、セガサミーHD < 6460 > 、コナミG < 9766 > が安い。
その他ゲーム会社やディベロッパーは、ネクソン < 3659 > 、イマジニア < 4644 > 、トーセ < 4728 > 、エヌジェイHD < 9421 > が高く、日本一ソフト < 3851 > 、ユークス < 4334 > が変わらず、マーベラス < 7844 > が安い。
モバイルゲーム系の銘柄は、MIXI < 2121 > 、グリーHD < 3632 > 、ガンホー < 3765 > 、アカツキ < 3932 > 、コロプラ < 3668 > 、モバイルファクトリー < 3912 > が高く、ケイブ < 3760 > が変わらず、サイバーエージェント < 4751 > 、DeNA < 2432 > が安い。
アニメやホビーなどその他コンテンツ関連銘柄は、タカラトミー < 7867 > 、サンリオ < 8136 > 、東宝 < 9602 > 、IGポート < 3791 > 、GENDA < 9166 > 、東映アニメ < 4816 > 、エディア < 3935 > 、フリュー < 6238 > 、ブシロード < 7803 > が高く、KADOKAWA < 9468 > が安い。
最後に騰落ランキングを見ると、イオレ < 2334 > やアルファポリス < 9467 > 、KLab < 3656 > 、アクセル < 6730 > が値上がり率上位となり、サイバーステップ < 3810 > 、ポールトゥウィンHD < 3657 > 、セガサミーHD < 6460 > 、メガチップス < 6875 > が値下がり率上位となった。
※時価総額の単位は億円。
gamebiz
main_content_en: The Tokyo stock market's morning session on October 22 saw a decline. The Nikkei Average closed the morning session down 238 yen 50 sen from the previous business day, at 49,077 yen 56 sen. In addition to the political event of Sanae Takaichi's assumption of the prime ministership having passed, the market was weighed down by weakness, mainly in semiconductor-related stocks, after major US semiconductor company TI was sold off in after-hours trading, leading to a moment where it fell by as much as 702 yen.Key Indices:Nikkei 225: 49,077.56 (-238.50)TOPIX: 3,260.15 (+10.65)USD/JPY: 151.66 (-0.27)Dow: 46,924.74 (+218.16)Nasdaq: 22,953.67 (-36.88)SOX: 6,839.27 (-45.76)Amidst this, looking at game and entertainment-related companies, out of the 97 registered stocks, 71 stocks (73%) rose, 19 stocks (20%) fell, and 7 stocks (7%) remained unchanged, indicating a prevalence of buying. There seemed to be a relative sense of being undervalued compared to semiconductor and AI-related stocks, leading to a wide range of stocks being sought after.Looking at major game-related companies, Bandai Namco HD <7832>, Square Enix HD <9684>, Capcom <9697>, and Koei Tecmo HD <3635> were up, while Sony G <6758>, Nintendo <7974>, Sega Sammy HD <6460>, and Konami G <9766> were down.Other game companies and developers saw Nexon <3659>, Imagineer <4644>, Tose <4728>, and NJ HD <9421> up, Nippon Ichi Software <3851> and Yuke's <4334> unchanged, and Marvelous <7844> down.Mobile game-related stocks saw MIXI <2121>, GREE HD <3632>, GungHo <3765>, Akatsuki <3932>, COLOPL <3668>, and Mobile Factory <3912> up, CAVE <3760> unchanged, and CyberAgent <4751> and DeNA <2432> down.Other content-related stocks, such as anime and hobby, saw Takara Tomy <7867>, Sanrio <8136>, Toho <9602>, IG Port <3791>, GENDA <9166>, Toei Animation <4816>, Edia <3935>, FURYU <6238>, and Bushiroad <7803> up, while KADOKAWA <9468> was down.Finally, looking at the gainers and losers ranking, iole <2334>, AlphaPolis <9467>, KLab <3656>, and AXEL <6730> were among the top gainers, while CyberStep <3810>, Pole To Win HD <3657>, Sega Sammy HD <6460>, and MegaChips <6875> were among the top losers.*Market capitalization unit is 100 million yen.gamebiz

headline: Toyota - New High; US GM's Upward Revision and Yen Depreciation Favored, Buying in Auto Stocks
description: TOYOTA MOTOR CORP reached a new high, driven by the surge in US General Motors' stock price and the ongoing yen depreciation. These factors are positively impacting domestic auto stocks.
key_takeaways: Toyota Motor hit a new high, benefiting from external market factors.;General Motors (GM) raised its full-year outlook, leading to a nearly 15% stock gain, despite a Q3 net profit decrease.;The yen depreciated to 152 against the dollar, fueled by expectations of aggressive fiscal and monetary policies under the new Prime Minister.;The positive developments for GM and the weaker yen are driving buying interest across Japanese auto stocks, including Honda, SUBARU, Mazda, and Denso.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explains why Toyota stock reached a new high by referencing previously announced events, specifically GM's Q3 earnings announcement on the '21st' and the yen's depreciation 'overnight' due to a new prime minister. It interprets market reactions to these prior events rather than announcing new information from Toyota Motor Corp itself.
source: トレーダーズ・ウェブ
news_worthy_reasoning: The article discusses Toyota's stock performance as a result of broader market trends (GM's positive outlook, yen depreciation) and includes multiple other auto companies. It lacks specific, company-driven news or events from Toyota itself that would constitute actionable intelligence for a trader focused solely on TM.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation, mentioning Honda, Subaru, Mazda, and Denso alongside Toyota.;Focus on external market factors (GM's performance, yen depreciation) rather than specific Toyota company actions or announcements.;Lack of specific, company-driven news or events from Toyota that could directly impact its stock price.;The article serves more as a market commentary explaining a trend rather than providing a direct catalyst for Toyota.
original_headline: トヨタ－新高値 米ＧＭ上方修正や円安進行を好感 自動車株に買い
main_content: トヨタ－新高値 米ＧＭ上方修正や円安進行を好感 自動車株に買いトヨタ自動車<7203>が新高値。米ゼネラル・モーターズ（ＧＭ）の株価急騰や円安進行が好感されている。ＧＭは21日に7-9月決算を発表。純利益は前年同期比で減少したものの、関税影響の縮小などを背景に通期の見通しを引き上げた。これが好感されてＧＭ株は15％近い上昇で終えた。また、積極財政や金融緩和を志向するとされる高市早苗氏が新首相に就任したことを手掛かりに円安が進行。夜間に1ドル152円台を付ける場面があった。米自動車大手の業績見通しや円安進行を受け、国内自動車株にも買いが入っている。ホンダ<7267>、ＳＵＢＡＲＵ<7270>、マツダ<7261>、デンソー<6902>なども高い。
main_content_en: Toyota Motor <7203> hit a new high. The surge in US General Motors (GM) stock price and the ongoing yen depreciation are being favorably received. GM announced its July-September earnings on the 21st. Although net profit decreased year-on-year, the company raised its full-year outlook, partly due to the reduced impact of tariffs. This was well-received, and GM shares closed with a nearly 15% gain. Furthermore, the yen depreciation progressed, triggered by the assumption of office by Sanae Takaichi, who is said to favor aggressive fiscal policy and monetary easing, as the new Prime Minister. During the night, there were instances where the yen reached the 152 yen level against the dollar. Following the earnings outlook of major US automakers and the ongoing yen depreciation, domestic auto stocks are also seeing buying. Honda <7267>, SUBARU <7270>, Mazda <7261>, Denso <6902>, and others are also up.

headline: Morning Session Commentary No. 4: SoftBank Group, Itami Art, Toyota, Inter-Trade, Daido Steel, Daiichi Kigenso
description: TOYOTA MOTOR CORP reached a new high, favored by the upward revision of US General Motors' outlook and the ongoing depreciation of the yen. These factors are driving increased buying in domestic auto stocks.
key_takeaways: SoftBank Group and other Japanese AI-related tech stocks declined significantly, influenced by a downturn in US tech and semiconductor markets.;Itami Art plunged as speculation for an early House of Representatives dissolution, which would benefit its election-related business, faded after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's remarks.;Toyota Motor and other Japanese auto stocks rallied, buoyed by General Motors' positive earnings revision and a weakening yen, which reached the 152 yen level against the dollar.;Inter-Trade surged following comments from BOJ Deputy Governor Ryozo Himino suggesting stablecoins could partially replace bank deposits, benefiting companies involved in stablecoin trading systems.;Daido Steel and Daiichi Kigenso Kagaku Kogyo saw sharp gains due to their respective developments of magnets and ceramic materials without reliance on rare earths, addressing supply chain concerns.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports on TOYOTA MOTOR CORP's stock hitting a new high, attributing it to external factors like GM's recent earnings announcement and yen depreciation. It does not contain any new, company-specific announcements, releases, or developments directly from Toyota, making it a market observation and interpretation rather than breaking news for the company itself.
source: トレーダーズ・ウェブ
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company market commentary, covering several stocks including Toyota. While it notes Toyota's stock surge due to GM earnings and yen depreciation, this information reports on a past event and its external drivers, rather than providing new, company-specific actionable intelligence from Toyota itself.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article;Reports on past stock movement for Toyota, not forward-looking intelligence;Focuses on external market factors (GM earnings, yen) rather than internal company developments for Toyota;Derivative content, summarizing market activity
original_headline: 前場コメント No.4　ソフトバンクＧ、イタミアート、トヨタ、インタトレード、大特鋼、稀元素
main_content: ★9:20　 ソフトバンクＧ－急落　米ハイテク株安など嫌気　上昇一服感から手じまい売り強まるソフトバンクグループ<9984>が急落。米ハイテク株の下落などが嫌気されている。前日の米国市場ではアルファベット、エヌビディアなどのAI関連株が下落。NYダウが上昇した一方で、ナスダックやフィラデルフィア半導体株指数（SOX指数）は下げた。また、大引け後に決算を発表した半導体大手の米テキサス・インスツルメンツは時間外で急落している。同社はこのところAI関連の代表格として株価が大きく上昇しており、前日は25735円の上場来高値を付けた。昨年末比の上昇率は2.8倍となる。高市トレードで特に商いが活況だった銘柄でもあり、前日は最高値更新後にマイナスへ転じた。きょうは上昇一服とみた手じまい売りが一段と強まり、足元で9％を超える下落となっている。これまでAI関連として相場上昇をけん引していたアドバンテスト<6857>やレーザーテック<6920>、フジクラ<5803>なども安い。★9:22　 イタミアート－急落　高市首相が早期の衆院解散に否定的な見解を示すイタミアート<168A>が急落。高市早苗首相が21日、首相官邸で就任後初の記者会見に臨み、早期の衆院解散に否定的な見解を示したことが材料。21日付の日経電子版の記事によると、早期の衆院解散に否定的な見解を示し、経済対策が最優先だとして「いますぐに解散どうのこうのと言っているひまはない」と話したとしている。同社は、のぼり旗、たすき、腕章、選挙カー用マグネットシートなどを手がけており、首班指名選挙前には衆院早期解散への思惑から買いが入っていた。しかし、高市氏の発言によってその期待がはく落したことから大きく売られている。★9:33　 トヨタ－新高値　米ＧＭ上方修正や円安進行を好感　自動車株に買いトヨタ自動車<7203>が新高値。米ゼネラル・モーターズ（ＧＭ）の株価急騰や円安進行が好感されている。ＧＭは21日に7-9月決算を発表。純利益は前年同期比で減少したものの、関税影響の縮小などを背景に通期の見通しを引き上げた。これが好感されてＧＭ株は15％近い上昇で終えた。また、積極財政や金融緩和を志向するとされる高市早苗氏が新首相に就任したことを手掛かりに円安が進行。夜間に1ドル152円台を付ける場面があった。米自動車大手の業績見通しや円安進行を受け、国内自動車株にも買いが入っている。ホンダ<7267>、ＳＵＢＡＲＵ<7270>、マツダ<7261>、デンソー<6902>なども高い。★9:38　 インタートレード－急騰　ステーブルコイン「銀行預金を一部代替も」　日銀副総裁が言及＝日経インタートレード<3747>が急騰。22日付の日本経済新聞朝刊は、日銀の氷見野良三副総裁が21日、「（法定通貨の価値に連動する）ステーブルコインは銀行預金の役割を部分的に代替し、国際決済システムの主要なプレーヤーとして浮上する可能性がある」と話したと報じた。米調査会社ユーラシア・グループが主催したイベントで講演したという。報道を受け、金価格連動型ステーブルコイン「ジパングコイン」の取引システムなどを手掛ける同社や、子会社を通じてステーブルコイン関連事業を行うＳｐｅｅｅ<4499>、円建てステーブルコインを発行するＪＰＹＣ（東京都千代田区）に出資しているアステリア<3853>などに買いが入っている。★9:49　 大同特殊鋼－大幅反発　重希土を使わない磁石を開発　注文増で生産量3倍へ向けた投資計画と伝わる大同特殊鋼<5471>が大幅反発。東洋経済オンラインが21日、レアアースと切り離せない磁石の製造で、中国依存100％の重希土類を使わない磁石を開発した企業として、同社を取り上げたことが材料。記事によると、同社はネオジム磁石の開発者として毎年ノーベル賞候補に名が挙がる佐川眞人氏を顧問に招き、ネオジム磁石の中でも「重希土類完全フリー」の磁石開発に磨きをかけてきたとしている。同記事のヘッドラインでは「注文増で生産量3倍へ向けた投資計画」との記載もあり、報道を好感した買いが入っているようだ。★9:51　 第一稀元素化学－ストップ高買い気配　レアアース不使用のセラミックス材料を開発第一稀元素化学工業<4082>がストップ高買い気配。同社は21日、セラミックスの材料として、カルシア安定化ジルコニア材料「DURAZR-Sシリーズ、製品名：HSY-0774」を新規開発したと発表した。ジルコニアには、一般的に安定化剤としてイットリアなどのレアアースが使用される。一方、新規開発品は入手が容易なカルシア（酸化カルシウム）を安定化剤として使用することに成功。レアアースを使用しないため、より安定的なセラミックス製品の供給に貢献するとしている。畑尾
main_content_en: ★9:20 SoftBank Group - Plunges; Disliked due to decline in US tech stocks, etc.; Selling to close positions intensifies due to a sense of a pause in the rally.SoftBank Group <9984> plunged. The decline in US tech stocks, among other factors, is being disliked. In the US market yesterday, AI-related stocks such as Alphabet and Nvidia declined. While the NY Dow rose, the Nasdaq and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOX Index) fell. Furthermore, US semiconductor giant Texas Instruments, which announced its earnings after the market close, plunged in after-hours trading. The company's stock price has risen significantly recently as a leading AI-related stock, reaching an all-time high of 25,735 yen yesterday. The increase from the end of last year is 2.8 times. It was also a stock that saw particularly active trading in the 'Takaichi Trade,' and yesterday, after hitting a new high, it turned negative. Today, selling to close positions, seeing a pause in the rally, further intensified, leading to a decline of over 9% currently. Advantest <6857>, Lasertec <6920>, and Fujikura <5803>, which had been leading the market rally as AI-related stocks, are also down.★9:22 Itami Art - Plunges; Prime Minister Takaichi expresses negative view on early dissolution of the House of Representatives.Itami Art <168A> plunged. The reason is that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi held her first press conference after assuming office at the Prime Minister's Official Residence on the 21st and expressed a negative view on an early dissolution of the House of Representatives. According to an article in the Nikkei Digital Edition dated the 21st, she expressed a negative view on an early dissolution of the House of Representatives, stating that economic measures are the top priority, and commented, 'There is no time to talk about dissolution right now.' The company handles banners, sashes, armbands, and magnetic sheets for election vehicles, and before the prime ministerial designation election, buying had entered due to speculation about an early dissolution of the House of Representatives. However, due to Ms. Takaichi's remarks, that expectation faded, leading to significant selling.★9:33 Toyota - New High; Favored by US GM's upward revision and yen depreciation; Buying in auto stocks.Toyota Motor <7203> reached a new high. The surge in US General Motors (GM) stock price and the ongoing yen depreciation are being favored. GM announced its July-September earnings on the 21st. Although net profit decreased year-on-year, it raised its full-year outlook, partly due to reduced tariff impacts. This was well-received, and GM shares closed with a nearly 15% gain. Furthermore, the yen depreciated, triggered by the inauguration of Sanae Takaichi, who is said to favor aggressive fiscal policy and monetary easing, as the new Prime Minister. There were moments overnight when the yen reached the 152 yen level against the dollar. Following the earnings outlook of major US automakers and the ongoing yen depreciation, domestic auto stocks are also seeing buying. Honda <7267>, SUBARU <7270>, Mazda <7261>, Denso <6902>, and others are also up.★9:38 Inter-Trade - Surges; Stablecoins 'may partially replace bank deposits,' says BOJ Deputy Governor = Nikkei.Inter-Trade <3747> surged. The Nikkei Shimbun morning edition dated the 22nd reported that Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Ryozo Himino stated on the 21st that '(stablecoins linked to the value of fiat currency) could partially replace the role of bank deposits and emerge as a major player in the international payment system.' He reportedly spoke at an event hosted by US research firm Eurasia Group. Following the report, buying entered the company, which handles trading systems for gold-backed stablecoin 'Zipangcoin,' Speee <4499>, which conducts stablecoin-related businesses through its subsidiary, and Asteria <3853>, which invests in JPYC (Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo), an issuer of yen-denominated stablecoins.★9:49 Daido Steel - Sharp Rebound; Developed magnets without heavy rare earths; Investment plan to triple production due to increased orders reported.Daido Steel <5471> sharply rebounded. The reason is that Toyo Keizai Online featured the company on the 21st as a company that developed magnets without using heavy rare earths, which are 100% dependent on China, in the manufacturing of magnets that are inseparable from rare earths. According to the article, the company invited Dr. Masato Sagawa, who is nominated for the Nobel Prize every year as the developer of neodymium magnets, as an advisor, and has been refining the development of 'completely heavy rare earth-free' magnets among neodymium magnets. The headline of the same article also mentioned 'investment plan to triple production due to increased orders,' suggesting that buying has entered in response to the favorable news.★9:51 Daiichi Kigenso Kagaku - Indicated at Limit Up; Developed ceramics material without rare earths.Daiichi Kigenso Kagaku Kogyo <4082> was indicated at limit up. The company announced on the 21st that it has newly developed a calcia-stabilized zirconia material, 'DURAZR-S series, product name: HSY-0774,' as a ceramic material. Zirconia generally uses rare earths such as yttria as a stabilizer. In contrast, the newly developed product successfully uses readily available calcia (calcium oxide) as a stabilizer. Since it does not use rare earths, it is expected to contribute to a more stable supply of ceramic products. Hatao

headline: ispace Signs Agreement with Toyota for Next-Generation Small Rover Development Support
description: TOYOTA MOTOR CORP has signed an agreement with ispace to provide technical evaluation and quality improvement support for the conceptual design of ispace's next-generation small lunar rover. This collaboration aims to leverage Toyota's system-level expertise to optimize the rover's design.
key_takeaways: ispace will receive technical evaluation and quality improvement support from Toyota Motor for its next-generation small lunar rover.;The agreement focuses on system-level technical evaluations to derive optimal design solutions for ispace's rover.;Toyota Motor is already involved in lunar rover development in collaboration with the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA).;The partnership highlights a growing collaboration between private and established companies in space exploration technology.;The announcement was made after the close of trading, potentially impacting stock performance for both companies.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article explicitly states that ispace "announced today, after the close of trading" a new contract with Toyota Motor Corp. for technical evaluation. This signifies a new, specific event and development for Toyota that is likely not yet priced into the market.
news_worthy_reasoning: While the article details a specific, timely partnership involving Toyota, the nature of the collaboration (technical support for a small lunar rover) is unlikely to have a material short-term financial impact on a company of Toyota's scale. It represents a niche R&D effort rather than a core business development that would drive immediate stock price movement for traders.
news_worthy_key_factors: Nature of partnership: Technical support for a non-core, niche product (lunar rover).;Scale of Toyota: The event's financial impact is negligible relative to Toyota's massive automotive and financial services businesses.;Lack of direct financial implications: No immediate revenue, profit, or cost savings are indicated.;Long-term strategic vs. short-term trading relevance: More of a long-term R&D and brand image play than a short-term trading catalyst.
original_headline: アイスペース、トヨタと次世代小型ローバー開発支援で契約締結◇
main_content: ｉｓｐａｃｅ < 9348 > はこの日の取引終了後、現在開発を進めている次世代小型探査車（次世代小型ローバー）の概念設計について技術評価と品質向上の支援を受けるため、トヨタ自動車 < 7203 > と契約を締結したと発表した。トヨタからシステムレベルで技術的な評価を受け、小型探査車の開発において最適なシステム設計解を導くことを目指す。トヨタは宇宙研究開発研究機構（ＪＡＸＡ）と共同で月面探査車の開発に取り組んでいる。（注）タイトル末尾の「◇」は本文中に複数の銘柄を含む記事を表しています。出所：MINKABU PRESSみんなの株式（minkabu PRESS）みんかぶ
main_content_en: ispace <9348> announced after the close of trading today that it has signed an agreement with Toyota Motor <7203> to receive technical evaluation and quality improvement support for the conceptual design of the next-generation small lunar rover (next-generation small rover) it is currently developing. The aim is to receive technical evaluations at the system level from Toyota and derive optimal system design solutions for the development of the small lunar rover. Toyota is engaged in the development of a lunar rover in collaboration with the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA). (Note) The "◇" at the end of the title indicates an article containing multiple stock issues in the main text. Source: MINKABU PRESS Minna no Kabushiki (minkabu PRESS) minkabu

headline: Featured Stocks Pick-up [Midday Edition]: IHI, Toyota, SBG
description: TOYOTA MOTOR CORP surged to a year-to-date high, driven by the positive market reaction to General Motors' Q3 2025 earnings. GM's results exceeded expectations and led to an upward full-year outlook revision, stimulating other automotive stocks.
key_takeaways: Multiple companies like Convano, IHI, Toyota, JGC Holdings, and Daiichi Kigenso Kagaku Kogyo saw stock price increases due to specific positive catalysts including business alliances, M&A, product launches, and technological advancements.;Defense-related stocks, including IHI, Kawasaki Heavy Industries, and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, rallied on expectations of increased defense spending following the inauguration of the Sanae Takaichi cabinet.;SoftBank Group experienced a sharp decline, contributing significantly to the Nikkei Average's fall, attributed to profit-taking after a recent surge and potential algorithmic selling.;Gold ETFs and semiconductor-related stocks (e.g., Advantest, Tokyo Electron) also fell, influenced by profit-taking, a shift towards risk assets, and a weaker outlook from US semiconductor giant Texas Instruments.;Daiichi Kigenso Kagaku Kogyo surged to its limit up on the development of a rare-earth-free zirconia powder, addressing concerns about China's export restrictions on rare earths.
breaking_recap_reasoning: The article reports on TOYOTA MOTOR CORP's stock movement (surging to a new year-to-date high) but attributes this to the positive market reaction to General Motors' earnings announcement, which stimulated the broader auto sector. There is no new event, release, or development directly from TOYOTA MOTOR CORP itself; rather, it's a recap of market performance influenced by external news.
news_worthy_reasoning: The article is a multi-company market summary that briefly mentions Toyota's stock surge but fails to provide any specific, actionable reason or catalyst for this movement. The information about Toyota is incomplete and lacks the detail required for trading decisions.
news_worthy_key_factors: Multi-company consolidation article, not focused solely on Toyota.;Lack of specific catalyst or detailed reason for Toyota's stock movement.;Information about Toyota is incomplete (indicated by ellipsis).;No actionable intelligence provided for Toyota beyond reporting a past price change.
original_headline: 話題株ピックアップ【昼刊】：ＩＨＩ、トヨタ、ＳＢＧ
main_content: ■コンヴァノ < 6574 > 192円 +24 円 (+14.3％) 11:30現在 コンヴァノ < 6574 > が急騰。前日取引終了後、韓国ＨＭ Solution社と鼻筋形成用糸リフト素材の共同開発及び独占輸入代行に関する業務提携契約を締結したことを発表した。糸リフト市場における製品ポートフォリオを拡充し、注入系施術に続く第二の事業の柱を構築する構えにある。 ■ＩＨＩ < 7013 > 2,998円 +158 円 (+5.6％) 11:30現在 ＩＨＩ < 7013 > が急反発。川崎重工業 < 7012 > が買われ、三菱重工業 < 7011 > が堅調に推移している。２１日に高市早苗内閣が発足した。同日夜の記者会見で、高市首相は防衛費の増額に向けて、国家安全保障戦略など「安保３文書」の改定を指示する考えを表明した。これを手掛かりとし、日経平均株価の騰勢が一服するなかで防衛関連株の一角を物色する姿勢が広がっている。高市内閣では防衛相に小泉進次郎氏が起用された。 ■イー・ギャランティ < 8771 > 1,631円 +63 円 (+4.0％) 11:30現在 イー・ギャランティ < 8771 > が３日続伸している。２１日の取引終了後、地銀を中心に投資するありあけキャピタル（東京都中央区）がイー・ギャラ株を買い増していたことが明らかとなり、思惑視した買いを誘ったようだ。同日に提出された変更報告書によると、ありあけキャピタルの保有割合は７．２４％から８．３３％に上昇した。保有目的の項目では「純投資」とともに、「状況に応じて経営陣への助言、重要提案行為等を行うこと」と記載している。報告義務発生日は１４日。 ■トヨタ自動車 < 7203 > 3,096円 +91 円 (+3.0％) 11:30現在 トヨタ自動車 < 7203 > がマドを開けて急伸し、年初来高値を更新。ホンダ < 7267 > やＳＵＢＡＲＵ < 7270 > など自動車株が軒並み高となっている。米自動車大手のゼネラル・モーターズが２１日に発表した２５年７～９月期（第３四半期）の決算は、減益ながら調整後１株利益は市場予想を上回った。あわせて通期の見通しを上方修正しており、同日の米株式市場でＧＭ株は１５％近く上昇して取引を終えた。決算発表後のＧＭ株の好反応が、自動車株の刺激材料となったようだ。ＧＭは関税影響が見込みよりも小さいものとなるなどと想定して今回、業績予想の修正に踏み切った。日産自動車 < 7201 > やマツダ < 7261 > も高い。 ■日揮ホールディングス < 1963 > 1,530.5円 +29.5 円 (+2.0％) 11:30現在 日揮ホールディングス < 1963 > が反発している。２１日の取引終了後、傘下の日揮がＪＲ九州 < 9142 > 及びエネコートテクノロジーズ（京都府久御山町）と博多駅ホーム上にフィルム型ペロブスカイト太陽電池を設置し、発電実証実験を開始したと発表しており、好材料視されている。駅ホーム屋根におけるペロブスカイト太陽電池を用いた発電実証実験として国内初の取り組みとなる今回の実証実験では、エネコートが開発したフィルム型ペロブスカイト太陽電池を日揮が軽量・着脱容易なシート工法用に成型のうえ太陽光発電システムとして開発し、ＪＲ九州が博多駅第２ホーム先端の屋根上に設置して実証実験を行う。鉄道運行では列車や駅舎などに大規模に電力を使用することから、ペロブスカイト太陽電池を実装することで再生可能エネルギー使用率向上の可能性に期待しているという。 ■ＥＲＩホールディングス < 6083 > 3,945円 +70 円 (+1.8％) 11:30現在 ＥＲＩホールディングス < 6083 > は反発。２１日取引終了後、小型ドローン開発ベンチャーのＴＯＭＰＬＡ（トンプラ、川崎市幸区）の株式を取得し、子会社化すると発表した。株式譲渡日は月内を予定している。これが材料視されているようだ。 ■アイスタイル < 3660 > 479円 +8 円 (+1.7％) 11:30現在 アイスタイル < 3660 > は３日続伸。２１日取引終了後、海外初のフラッグシップショップ「＠ｃｏｓｍｅ HONG KONG」を１２月５日にオープンすると発表した。東京、大阪、名古屋に次ぐ、４つ目の旗艦店になるという。これが手掛かりとなっているようだ。 ■イオン九州 < 2653 > 2,991円 +46 円 (+1.6％) 11:30現在 イオン九州 < 2653 > が反発している。２１日の取引終了後、大分県でスーパーマーケットなど２３店舗を運営するトキハインダストリー（大分県大分市）の全株式を２６年１月末日の予定で取得し子会社化すると発表しており、好材料視されている。今回の子会社化は、新規顧客の獲得に加えて、大分県における強固なドミナント形成によりグループの企業価値向上を図るのが狙い。取得価額は非開示。なお、２６年２月期業績への影響は軽微としている。 ■ＰＡコンサル < 4071 > 2,428円 +29 円 (+1.2％) 11:30現在 プラスアルファ・コンサルティング < 4071 > は３日続伸。２１日取引終了後、タレントマネジメントシステム「Talent Palette」について三井住友信託銀行が導入したと発表した。また、２２日朝方には対話力向上支援サービス「ＡＩトークトレ」を提供開始すると発表。実際の顧客応対に近いリアルなペルソナを生成ＡＩが生成し、実践的な応対練習を可能にするという。リリースが相次ぎ材料視されたようだ。 ■帝人 < 3401 > 1,341円 +15.5 円 (+1.2％) 11:30現在 帝人 < 3401 > は３日続伸している。旧村上ファンド関係者が設立したシンガポール拠点の投資ファンド、エフィッシモ・キャピタル・マネージメントは２１日の取引終了後、関東財務局に変更報告書を提出した。同報告書によると、株式保有比率が従来の１１．０８％から１２．１２％に上昇しており、思惑的な買いが入っている。報告義務発生日は１０月１４日。保有目的は純投資としている。 ■ソフトバンクグループ < 9984 > 23,630円 -1,290 円 (-5.2％) 11:30現在 東証プライム 下落率2位 ソフトバンクグループ < 9984 > が急落、一時１０％を超える急落となり、ここまで上昇相場のサポートラインとなっていた５日移動平均線を大陰線で下放れる格好となっている。同社の株価は今月に入ってから上げ足を強め、前日につけた最高値２万５７３５円まで３週間で４割強も株価水準を切り上げていたが、足もとでその反動が出ている。日経平均の構成比率ではソフトバンクＧは２２５銘柄の中でアドバンテスト < 6857 > を凌ぎトップに位置している。きょうは日経平均が一時７００円あまりの下落をみせるなど波乱含みの値動きとなったが、その下げ分の８割強をソフトバンクＧが１銘柄で占める状況となっており、「（同社株固有の）悪材料に反応しているということではないが、ＡＩアルゴリズムの機械的な売りが下げを助長している」（中堅証券ストラテジスト）という指摘が聞かれる。株式需給面では直近１７日現在で信用買い残が増勢となる一方、売り残は減少しているが、信用倍率は１．３倍台と引き続きタイト感がある。また、日証金の貸借倍率は２１日現在で１．０２倍と売り買い拮抗した状態にある。 ■ＳＰＤＲ < 1326 > 57,370円 -2,990 円 (-5.0％) 11:30現在 金ＥＴＦが急落。ＳＰＤＲゴールド・シェア < 1326 > が一時、前日に比べ７％超安に売られたほか、ＮＥＸＴ FUNDS 金価格連動型上場投信 < 1328 > や純金上場信託（現物国内保管型） < 1540 > が大幅安となっている。２１日のニューヨーク商品取引所（ＣＯＭＥＸ）の金先物相場は、１２月限が前日比２５０．３ドル（５．７％）安の１トロイオンス＝４１０９．１ドルと急落した。一日の下落幅としては過去最大とみられている。年初から大幅な上昇を演じ、前日には最高値を更新していたが、利益確定やポジション調整の売りが膨らんだ。米中通商協議の進展期待やドル高が金価格には逆風になったとの見方も出ている。２１日にＮＹダウが最高値を更新したことも、資金がリスク資産の株式に向かい、安全資産の金から離散したとみられている。 ■アドバンテスト < 6857 > 16,815円 -585 円 (-3.4％) 11:30現在 東証プライム 下落率6位 アドバンテスト < 6857 > 、東京エレクトロン < 8035 > など半導体製造装置関連は売り優勢。前日の米国株市場ではエヌビディアやアドバンスト・マイクロ・デバイシズ、マイクロン・テクノロジーなど半導体の主力銘柄が軟調に推移しフィラデルフィア半導体株指数（ＳＯＸ指数）も反落した。ＳＯＸ指数は最高値圏での推移が続いているが、足もとで上値がやや重くなっている状況だ。また、前日の米株市場取引終了後に発表された半導体大手テキサス・インスツルメンツの１０～１２月期見通しが市場コンセンサスを下回る内容で、時間外で急落していることもネガティブ視される。一方、外国為替市場で足もとドル高・円安方向に振れていることは株価の下支え材料として意識される。アドテストや東エレクは日経平均構成比で上位に位置しており、日経平均株価への影響力も大きいだけに、その値動きが注目される。 ■西松屋チェーン < 7545 > 2,108円 -6 円 (-0.3％) 11:30現在 西松屋チェーン < 7545 > は小高い場面があったもののその後冴えない動き。２１日の取引終了後に発表した１０月度（９月２１日～１０月２０日）の月次売上高速報で、既存店売上高は前年同月比４．４％減と、２カ月ぶりに前年実績を下回ったことが嫌気されているようだ。気温の高い日が続いたことで、秋物衣料や冬物衣料の売上高が前年を下回った。なお、全店売上高は同０．２％増だった。 ■第一稀元素化学工業 < 4082 > 794円 +100 円 (+14.4％) ストップ高 11:30現在 東証プライム 上昇率トップ 第一稀元素化学工業 < 4082 > はストップ高水準となる前営業日比１００円高の７９４円に買われ、年初来高値を更新した。２１日、セラミックス製品の材料となるジルコニア粉末シリーズ「ＤＵＲＡＺＲ－Ｓシリーズ」の「ＨＳＹ－０７７４」を新規開発したと発表した。中国によるレアアースの輸出規制が話題になるなか、新規開発品はレアアースを使わないという特徴を持っており、事業の成長を期待する買いが流入している。稀元素によると、セラミックス製品の材料となるジルコニアには一般的に安定化剤としてイットリアなどのレアアースが使われている一方、新規開発品では入手が容易な酸化カルシウムを安定化剤として使うことに成功した。 ●ストップ高銘柄 要興業 < 6566 > 1,584円 +300 円 (+23.4％) ストップ高 11:30現在 ＪＤＳＣ < 4418 > 1,681円 +300 円 (+21.7％) ストップ高 11:30現在 アールシーコア < 7837 > 710円 +100 円 (+16.4％) ストップ高 11:30現在 など、4銘柄 ●ストップ安銘柄 櫻島埠頭 < 9353 > 2,875円 -700 円 (-19.6％) ストップ安 11:30現在 など、1銘柄
main_content_en: ■Convano <6574> 192 yen +24 yen (+14.3%) as of 11:30 Convano <6574> surged. After the close of trading on the previous day, the company announced that it had concluded a business alliance agreement with South Korean company HM Solution for the joint development of thread lift materials for nose bridge formation and exclusive import agency. The company aims to expand its product portfolio in the thread lift market and establish a second pillar of business following injection-based procedures. ■IHI <7013> 2,998 yen +158 yen (+5.6%) as of 11:30 IHI <7013> sharply rebounded. Kawasaki Heavy Industries <7012> was bought, and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries <7011> is performing strongly. The Sanae Takaichi cabinet was inaugurated on the 21st. At a press conference on the evening of the same day, Prime Minister Takaichi expressed her intention to instruct the revision of the 'Three Security Documents,' including the National Security Strategy, to increase defense spending. Taking this as a cue, and amidst a pause in the Nikkei Average's upward momentum, there is a growing trend to seek out defense-related stocks. In the Takaichi cabinet, Shinjiro Koizumi was appointed Minister of Defense. ■eGuarantee <8771> 1,631 yen +63 yen (+4.0%) as of 11:30 eGuarantee <8771> has risen for three consecutive days. After the close of trading on the 21st, it became clear that Ariake Capital (Chuo-ku, Tokyo), which primarily invests in regional banks, had increased its stake in eGuarantee shares, which seems to have attracted speculative buying. According to the amendment report submitted on the same day, Ariake Capital's ownership ratio increased from 7.24% to 8.33%. Under the purpose of holding, it states 'pure investment' as well as 'to provide advice to management and make important proposals depending on the situation.' The date the reporting obligation arose was the 14th. ■Toyota Motor <7203> 3,096 yen +91 yen (+3.0%) as of 11:30 Toyota Motor <7203> surged, opening with a gap, and updated its year-to-date high. Automotive stocks such as Honda <7267> and SUBARU <7270> are all rising. General Motors, a major US automaker, announced its Q3 (July-September) 2025 earnings on the 21st, which, despite a decrease in profit, saw adjusted earnings per share exceed market expectations. In conjunction, the full-year outlook was revised upward, and GM shares closed nearly 15% higher in the US stock market on the same day. The positive reaction of GM shares after the earnings announcement seems to have stimulated automotive stocks. GM decided to revise its earnings forecast this time, assuming that the impact of tariffs would be smaller than expected. Nissan Motor <7201> and Mazda <7261> are also up. ■JGC Holdings <1963> 1,530.5 yen +29.5 yen (+2.0%) as of 11:30 JGC Holdings <1963> has rebounded. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that its subsidiary JGC, together with JR Kyushu <9142> and Enecoat Technologies (Kumiyama-cho, Kyoto Prefecture), had installed film-type perovskite solar cells on the platform of Hakata Station and started a power generation demonstration experiment, which is being viewed positively. In this demonstration experiment, which is the first of its kind in Japan to use perovskite solar cells for power generation on a station platform roof, JGC developed Enecoat's film-type perovskite solar cells into a solar power generation system using a lightweight and easily detachable sheet construction method, and JR Kyushu installed them on the roof at the tip of Hakata Station's second platform to conduct the demonstration. As railway operations consume large amounts of electricity for trains and station buildings, there are expectations for the possibility of improving the utilization rate of renewable energy by implementing perovskite solar cells. ■ERI Holdings <6083> 3,945 yen +70 yen (+1.8%) as of 11:30 ERI Holdings <6083> rebounded. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that it would acquire shares in TOMPLA (Kawasaki City, Saiwai-ku), a venture company developing small drones, and make it a subsidiary. The share transfer date is scheduled for within the month. This seems to be viewed as a positive factor. ■istyle <3660> 479 yen +8 yen (+1.7%) as of 11:30 istyle <3660> has risen for three consecutive days. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that it would open its first overseas flagship store, '@cosme HONG KONG,' on December 5. This will be its fourth flagship store, following Tokyo, Osaka, and Nagoya. This seems to be the catalyst. ■AEON Kyushu <2653> 2,991 yen +46 yen (+1.6%) as of 11:30 AEON Kyushu <2653> has rebounded. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that it would acquire all shares of Tokiwa Industry (Oita City, Oita Prefecture), which operates 23 supermarkets and other stores in Oita Prefecture, with a scheduled acquisition date of January 31, 2026, making it a subsidiary, which is being viewed positively. The aim of this acquisition is to enhance the group's corporate value by acquiring new customers and establishing a strong dominant position in Oita Prefecture. The acquisition price is undisclosed. Furthermore, the impact on the fiscal year ending February 2026 performance is stated to be minor. ■Plus Alpha Consulting <4071> 2,428 yen +29 yen (+1.2%) as of 11:30 Plus Alpha Consulting <4071> has risen for three consecutive days. After the close of trading on the 21st, the company announced that Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Bank had adopted its talent management system 'Talent Palette'. Additionally, on the morning of the 22nd, it announced the launch of its conversation skill improvement support service 'AI Talk Train'. It states that generative AI creates realistic personas similar to actual customer interactions, enabling practical response training. The successive releases seem to have been viewed as positive factors. ■Teijin <3401> 1,341 yen +15.5 yen (+1.2%) as of 11:30 Teijin <3401> has risen for three consecutive days. Effissimo Capital Management, a Singapore-based investment fund established by former Murakami Fund associates, submitted an amendment report to the Kanto Local Finance Bureau after the close of trading on the 21st. According to the report, the shareholding ratio increased from the previous 11.08% to 12.12%, attracting speculative buying. The date the reporting obligation arose was October 14. The purpose of holding is stated as pure investment. ■SoftBank Group <9984> 23,630 yen -1,290 yen (-5.2%) as of 11:30 TSE Prime 2nd largest decline SoftBank Group <9984> sharply declined, temporarily falling by over 10%, breaking below its 5-day moving average, which had been a support line for the upward trend, with a large bearish candlestick. The company's stock price had accelerated its rise since the beginning of this month, increasing by over 40% in three weeks to reach a high of 25,735 yen set on the previous day, but a reaction to this surge is now being seen. In terms of Nikkei Average weighting, SoftBank Group ranks first among the 225 stocks, surpassing Advantest <6857>. Today, the Nikkei Average saw volatile movements, including a temporary decline of over 700 yen, but SoftBank Group alone accounted for over 80% of that decline, leading to comments such as, 'It's not a reaction to negative news specific to the company's stock, but mechanical selling by AI algorithms is exacerbating the decline' (mid-tier securities strategist). In terms of stock supply and demand, as of the 17th, margin buying has been increasing while short selling has decreased, but the margin ratio remains tight at around 1.3 times. Additionally, the Japan Securities Finance Co. (JSF) loan-to-stock ratio was 1.02 times as of the 21st, indicating a balanced state of buying and selling. ■SPDR <1326> 57,370 yen -2,990 yen (-5.0%) as of 11:30 Gold ETFs sharply declined. SPDR Gold Shares <1326> temporarily fell by over 7% compared to the previous day, while NEXT FUNDS Gold Price Linked ETF <1328> and Pure Gold ETF (Physical Domestic Storage Type) <1540> also saw significant declines. On the 21st, gold futures on the New York Mercantile Exchange (COMEX) for the December contract sharply fell by $250.3 (5.7%) from the previous day to $4,109.1 per troy ounce. This is believed to be the largest single-day decline in history. After a significant rise since the beginning of the year and hitting a new high on the previous day, profit-taking and position adjustment selling expanded. There are also views that expectations for progress in US-China trade talks and a stronger dollar acted as headwinds for gold prices. The fact that the NY Dow updated its record high on the 21st is also seen as capital shifting towards risk assets like stocks and away from safe-haven gold. ■Advantest <6857> 16,815 yen -585 yen (-3.4%) as of 11:30 TSE Prime 6th largest decline Semiconductor manufacturing equipment-related stocks such as Advantest <6857> and Tokyo Electron <8035> are dominated by selling. In the US stock market on the previous day, major semiconductor stocks such as Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices, and Micron Technology performed weakly, and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOX Index) also fell back. While the SOX Index continues to trade near its all-time high, it is currently facing some resistance to further upside. Furthermore, the outlook for the October-December quarter announced by semiconductor giant Texas Instruments after the close of the US stock market on the previous day fell below market consensus, and its sharp decline in after-hours trading is also viewed negatively. On the other hand, the current trend of a stronger dollar and weaker yen in the foreign exchange market is seen as a supporting factor for stock prices. Advantest and Tokyo Electron are highly weighted in the Nikkei Average, and their movements are closely watched due to their significant influence on the Nikkei Average. ■Nishimatsuya Chain <7545> 2,108 yen -6 yen (-0.3%) as of 11:30 Nishimatsuya Chain <7545> saw a brief rise but then moved sluggishly. The quick report on monthly sales for October (September 21 - October 20) announced after the close of trading on the 21st showed that existing store sales decreased by 4.4% year-on-year, falling below the previous year's results for the first time in two months, which seems to have been disliked. Due to continued warm days, sales of autumn and winter clothing fell below the previous year's levels. Total store sales, however, increased by 0.2%. ■Daiichi Kigenso Kagaku Kogyo <4082> 794 yen +100 yen (+14.4%) Limit Up as of 11:30 TSE Prime Top Gainer Daiichi Kigenso Kagaku Kogyo <4082> was bought up to 794 yen, a 100 yen increase from the previous trading day, reaching its limit up level and updating its year-to-date high. On the 21st, the company announced the new development of 'HSY-0774' in its zirconia powder series 'DURAZR-S Series,' which is a material for ceramic products. Amid discussions about China's export restrictions on rare earths, the newly developed product features the absence of rare earths, attracting buying in anticipation of business growth. According to Kigenso, while zirconia, a material for ceramic products, generally uses rare earths such as yttria as a stabilizer, the newly developed product successfully uses easily obtainable calcium oxide as a stabilizer. ●Limit Up Stocks Kaname Kogyo <6566> 1,584 yen +300 yen (+23.4%) Limit Up as of 11:30 JDSC <4418> 1,681 yen +300 yen (+21.7%) Limit Up as of 11:30 RC Core <7837> 710 yen +100 yen (+16.4%) Limit Up as of 11:30 and 4 other stocks ●Limit Down Stocks Sakurajima Futo <9353> 2,875 yen -700 yen (-19.6%) Limit Down as of 11:30 and 1 other stock

original_headline: 採れたて株価材料－ｉｓｐａｃｅ 次世代小型ローバー開発をトヨタが支援決定
main_content: ・日経平均－反落 下落から切り返すも前日終値近辺でもみ合い。・フジコピアン<7957>－福証本則市場へ重複上場承認。・Ａｒｅｎｔ<5254>－大型案件2件を受注。・ａｂｃ<8783>－ビットコインオプション取引導入に向け準備開始。・エクサウィザーズ<4259>－「exaBase だれでも自動化」製品版をリリース。・ツナグＧＨＤ<6551>－RPO（採用業務代行）の価格を改定。・ＨＩＳ<9603>－観光土産品製販のサウスウィングを子会社化。・ＴＨＥＣＯＯ<4255>－株主優待制度を変更。・ｉｓｐａｃｅ<9348>－次世代小型ローバー開発をトヨタ<7203>が支援決定。・リプロセル<4978>－産総研とiPS細胞の遺伝子改変に関する共同研究契約締結。・エフアンドエム<4771>－fundnoteが大株主に浮上 5.80％。・大垣共立銀行<8361>－fundnoteが買い増し 5.39％→6.65％。・平河ヒューテック<5821>－アクシウムキャピタルが大株主に浮上 5.52％。・ＣＥＨＤ<4320>－アクシウムキャピタルが大株主に浮上 6.90％。・神戸物産<3038>－9月度の売上高6.9％増 営業利益17.0％増 経常利益3.8倍。・ＧＥＮＤＡ<9166>－9月度売上高（速報値）は47.7％増。
main_content_en: Nikkei 225 - Falls back, recovers from a decline but trades sideways near previous day's closing price. Fujicopian <7957> - Approved for dual listing on Fukuoka Stock Exchange Main Market. Arent <5254> - Receives orders for 2 large projects. abc <8783> - Begins preparations for introducing Bitcoin option trading. ExaWizards <4259> - Releases the product version of 'exaBase Anyone Can Automate'. TSUNAGU GHD <6551> - Revises prices for RPO (Recruitment Process Outsourcing). HIS <9603> - Makes South Wing, a manufacturer and seller of tourist souvenirs, a subsidiary. THECOO <4255> - Changes shareholder benefit program. ispace <9348> - Toyota <7203> decides to support next-generation small lunar rover development. ReproCELL <4978> - Concludes joint research agreement with AIST on gene modification of iPS cells. F&M <4771> - fundnote emerges as a major shareholder with 5.80%. Ogaki Kyoritsu Bank <8361> - fundnote increases stake from 5.39% to 6.65%. Hirakawa Hewtech <5821> - Axium Capital emerges as a major shareholder with 5.52%. CEHD <4320> - Axium Capital emerges as a major shareholder with 6.90%. Kobe Bussan <3038> - September sales up 6.9%, operating profit up 17.0%, ordinary profit 3.8 times. GENDA <9166> - September sales (preliminary figures) up 47.7%.

headline: Nikkei 225 up by about 240 yen; SoftBank G, Advantest, Fujikura among top trading values
